Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: 394Mike
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 12th floor, ocean front, king bed and it was great! The room was very clean and very well maintained. The lounge chairs on the balcony made us feel as if we were on the beach but without all the sand to wash out of the swimsuits! When we went to the outdoor pool we were treated like royalty! The female attendant immediately greeted us with plush towels that she laid out on our loungers and she had rolled up towels that were placed (just slightly rolled down) at the top of the loungers that made a nice pillow! The shops on the boardwalk level were great. The smell of good coffee greets you when you step out the elevator in the lobby. We only have two minor complaints: 1) the wi-fi was not so great (it went completely down during our stay for about 1 full day): 2) the lattice in between the balconies does not give you any privacy (perhaps this should be addressed at the next board meeting) oops i may have 2 1/2 minor complaints: 2 1/2) although we don't smoke, we didn't see any reason why guests can not smoke on the balcony..we saw some frustrated guests that could not figure that out..the balconies are outside All in all, it was very enjoyable! I recommend Phillips which is within one block. We had the buffet one night $28.99 per person and then the next night we had the carry-out 10 piece chicken that came with cole slaw, potato salad, rolls & butter ($18.99). We also highly suggest the crab cake sandwich (comes with delicious fries) $14.99. We could have feasted off the carry-out for 2 days at least! Hall's has an excellent breakfast buffet for about $10 per person (coupon in the flyers). Eggs Benedict, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, yummy potatos, pancakes, waffles, biscuits w/sausage gravy, corned beef hash (or something very similar to it), fresh fruit, any kind of toast, bagels, cream cheese, cinnamon buns, and all the sweet stuff! Be sure to bring your bicycle or rent a surrey to pedal all of the boardwalk! We walked most of the 3 miles, but the surrey was much more fun!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, service, rooms and view.”
Reviews.Author: robinlyn13
Reviews.Content: We were at Grand Hotel Sept 9-11, 2012. When we arrived the desk personnel were helpful and we were in our room quickly. The hotel is very clean. The elevators were clean and quick. Our room was awesome. The rooms, rugs, bathroom, shower, kitchenette, everything was clean and odor free. The pillows and the bed was very comfortable. We called the desk three times and our questions were answered immediately. Everyone went out of there way to make us feel welcome and special. Especially "Stephanie" who was at the pool when we were there and gave us thick lounge chair covers and towels and directed us to the type of restaurant we were looking for and her suggestions were excellent. It is right on the boardwork with many shops located on the lobby level. I hope we are able to go there again next year. I have stayed in approximately twenty five different hotel/motels and this one I put in my top two. Highly recommend the Grand Hotel and Spa.

Reviews.Title: “"upgraded rooms need some work"”
Reviews.Author: AndyH626
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 11th floor and paid a premium for it (259.00 per night plus tax) to get the upgraded rooms with the semi-private balconies. We learned while staying there others had paid less for the same floors so that was disappointing. Biggest thing my wife pointed out was for “newer” rooms the carpet has rolls in it all over the place, and the semi-private balcony upgrade is lattice-work zip tied to the metal poles. I’ve stay at the hotel before so knew what I was expecting….just expected a little more for the nicer rooms for the price compared to a standard room. Pizza place in the hotel is the best! For the other reviewers that stayed the weekend of 9/7..the crying baby was probably ours….sorry.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: tammyBoonton_NJ
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. My husband and I had an oceanfront room on the 11th floor. All rooms have great views and next time I do not think we would pay the extra money for oceanfront. The hotel is clean which is VERY important to me. Maid service, check in/out, restaurant, parking, location was all good. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant 2 times and both times enjoyed it. Great service and food also, enjoyed the 24 hr. coffee shop and visited daily. Karaoke is in the bar Friday/Sunday nights which was entertaining. If you want to get a massage at the hotels spa you need to book ahead. We tried to make an appointment but, they were booked. I do think the $270 a night is a little high but would still recommend The Grand. Note: We were told this hotel is North of Ocean City when actually it is South. We walked one block to Phillips for dinner which was excellent. I had the broiled crab cakes and it was all crab, no filler. I highly recommend the restaurant. Another night we went to Fresco's Restaurant which is more expensive but had a table by the window, watched the sunset and listened to the piano player in the background. Once again, I recommend (you need reservations) Went to Fish Tales (walking distance) to see the sunset. It was nice to sit back, relax and have a cocktail but it wasn't my kind of place to eat. The hotel is about 15 minutes from Assateague Island. This is where wild horses roam the beach. Beautiful, peaceful beach with no crowds. Costs $15 per car for the week and was well worth it. Mosquitos are bad but, on the beach no problem. If your a beer drinker try Evolution (EVO) my husband bought a case while there to bring back. He also really enjoyed the Phillips brand beer. Hope this was helpful. Feel free to email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Employees are very unprofessional!!”
Reviews.Author: Tina T
Reviews.Content: We checked in to hotel 9/6/2012@ 11:38 P.M.. The lady at the desk was very helpful to the best of her ability. I ask her why I was charged a higher rate than what the internet had indicated. She told me to talk to the manager in the morning, I went down and ask the lady, and the gentleman in charge the following morning he said he didn't know but would find out and let me know. Well I still don't know. I then questioned "Nina", I think that is her name , who was in charge she said "Now what your saying is not true, we did not change our rates till 10 o'clock this morning.{This was 9/7/2012 }. It took 3 times asking to get wash clothes. Got up this morning to listen to banging and thumping everytime I've been in my room today. After 2 calls and a trip downstairs, security finally checked it, but only after he argued it was the sliding door above me. I said I don't think thats it. He said he hears this all the time, well guess what thiers no sliding door above me thiers not even a room they say. We went to the sixth floor retaurant for breakfast, there was no toilet tissue in the restroom, when I brought it to thier attention they brought a stack of dinner napkins to put in the stalls. YUK. As I type this I'm Listening to the people in the room next to me Scream "oww you f*****g hurting me, your hurting my fingers!" It seems none of the staff is "allowed" to handle the situations, and none of the managers are here. I was informed they were not allowed to bother the manager unless the hotel was on fire. I could go on but won't i just would not recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was going great, until the front desk manager on duty failed to follow up”
Reviews.Author: Tara N
Reviews.Content: I work for a hotel in the DC area so I have pretty high expectations. Our stay was going great, but tonight (we're still here) we have experienced quite a bit of noise in the room. I called down and the front desk said that they would send security to investigate the noise. I must say I was shocked when several moments later, security was knocking on my door. As management of a hotel myself, I was completely flabbergasted. Not only does that put my security at risk, it shows a complete disregard for my anonymity. The noise started up again soon thereafter, at which point I called and spoke with Kara, the manager on duty. She informed me that the noise I was hearing was because of a wedding. She then said she would verify this because it could possibly be from a neighboring room, and follow up with me with a call to my room. It has now been 30 minutes and I have not heard anything and there is still noise. I am here on a rare weekend with my fiancee as in the hospitality field (as I'm sure you're aware) a weekend off is a rarity. Follow through is imperative. It is completely unacceptable that nobody has followed up with me. On top of that, if the noise is due to a wedding, why wasn't I made aware of that at check in? Perhaps it is best to stay at another hotel if you are interested in visiting Ocean City....

Reviews.Title: “A great stay that became average...”
Reviews.Author: tmac54
Reviews.Content: As stated by other reviewers our room was large,clean and well suited for our family. To our surprise the all the appliances worked well and if you travel you know this can be one of those hit of miss areas. Travelling with a two year old has it's challenges so for that reason a solid divider between balconies really would have been nice. The plastic furniture was something that could have been overlooked alone with the lack of lighting because in the end it was the view of the Ocean that we paid for! Our one sore point...now two sore point ( our backs ) were the beds! Just sitting on our beds...they made more noise than college kids during spring break! I was waiting for the metal spring to poke me...they sounded as if they needed to be oiled...has my point been made? We asked if something could be done but in the end it turned out to be the three worse nights of sleep that we've have had in a very long time. We were considering returning next year but not if the rooms have that same level of comfort or should I say discomfort! Try on your room as you would if you were buying a used car; kick all the tires and look under the hood...let the buyer beware! A great stay that became a average one!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Escape!”
Reviews.Author: Tony M
Reviews.Content: I am pleased to say that my wife and I had a really great experience at the Grand Hotel. Nice oceanfront room with a gigantic balcony. Action packed hotel/area with great choices of food, beverage and of course the Atlantic Ocean just 20 steps from the back door. Mr. Staib, the general manager runs a clean cut operation. Staff were friendly and accommodations were clean and comfortable. Being a GM of a hotel, I can appreciate being a guest especially in an environment such as the Grand Hotel. Keep up the great job and we will look forward to seeing you again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms great staff”
Reviews.Author: Maudeydaudey
Reviews.Content: We just spent tree nights t the Grand and were very pleased. The room was immaculate and the staff went out their way to welcome us. If there is an issue it is with the furniture on the balcony which consisted of two plastic chairs as well as the lack of seating and proper lighting in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaHappy
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really large and have small kitchenettes. Each room has a balcony. The only issue was that there were no solid dividers between balconies so you could hear and partially see the people next to you. There was a mesh screen of some sort between balconies. The place is very large and they have a restaurant that serves lunch and breakfast. We enjoyed sitting around the pool and having frozen drinks from the pool bar. It is quite a walk to the activities on the boardwalk but there is a tram that runs down the boardwalk. My daughter really enjoyed playing chess with the giant chess set.

Reviews.Title: “Late August stay”
Reviews.Author: Barclay B
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Grand Hotel at the end of Aug and had a great time. The location is fantastic and we liked the fact that not only were we close to the beach, but that their were stores available as part of the hotel when we needed something. The room was a good size and like others had mentioned it was a bit warn, but then again this is a hotel right on the beach at the end of the season. The restaurants were ok, we ate at the Pizza place and the breakfast place and both were fine, we had planned to eat again for breakfast on our way out, but by 10:15 they were done serving food, I found that pretty early. The Pizza place had ok food. The service was good and everyone we spoke to was friendly and helpful, our room was cleaned each day while we were gone and we had no issues in the room. This is a really good medium priced option on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Large but average room”
Reviews.Author: NatalieMaryland
Reviews.Content: This hotel off of 21st and Baltimore Ave is right on the beach so it's very convenient but the rooms are just ok. It is very large and has a fridge and microwave, but the bathroom is very small. When you open the bathroom door, it almost brushes against the toilet. The room is so so with old covering and old furniture. It appears to be clean so that's something but for the price I paid, I expected a little more. The outdoor pool is basic so nothing the kids will get excited about. There's a large outdoor bar next to the pool and the building houses a bakery, pizza place and some shops. It's located about 1.5 miles from the official start of the Boardwalk and there's a bike rental place in the next block that you can rent a bike to pedal down that boardwalk to reach the livelier part of Ocean City. Ask for a room above the 4th floor because there's alot of street noise from garbage trucks and the 3rd floor room has alot of morning noises like someone moving lots of furniture around above us. The air conditioning is also very noise when it starts up. Sounds like an engine backfiring but it does a good job of keeping the room cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: jkumpon
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 just returned from an incredible ''last hurrah" trip to the beach before school starts. We stayed at the Grand Hotel & found the accommodations to be perfect for us. We loved the location right on the beach & found the hotel to be extremely clean. Our room (2 queen beds) was very spacious & we were thankful for the kitchenette. Our room had an ocean view (well worth the cost) & a nice balcony to lounge on first thing in the morning or last thing at night. We all enjoyed swimming in the outside pool & the staff went out of their way to give us good suggestions on nearby attractions. There was also an indoor pool, fitness room, sauna, and several fun games (shuffle board, ginormous chess game). The location was perfect, as it was a walkable distance to the boardwalk/amusement park...but was far enough away from the high volume of boardwalk-goers.We are already discussing our return trip next year!

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: gbsutures
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to Ocean City in quite some time and this was a somewhat last minute trip for me and my friend. All in all our experience was decent. Location is perfect if you like to be on the boardwalk, but away from the busier area. You literally walk out and onto the beach. Very nice. Check in was easy, plenty of parking and the room was as advertised. Staff is very friendly. We had a "signature" room on the 11th floor with a pretty full ocean view. Balcony was big, but only semi-private. Not all observe the no smoking rule, but can't blame the hotel for that. Room was generous in sizing. We had two queen beds and there is a small kitchenette area with a microwave and a refrigerator. As others have commented, the bathroom is very small. Two people cannot get ready at the same time and there is no exhaust fan. If a hairdryer is vital for you, I recommend bringing your own. My friend thought the one provided was too small. I was trying to figure out when this place was built because it does seem a little dated, but I think some of that has to do with the reality of being at the beach. I spent a lot of time at the Jersey shore growing up and I realize that house and hotels close to beach can take a beating with people dragging in sand and wet items. They are apparently trying to upgrade. Pools were typical of hotel pools - the Grand's was certainly clean and the pool staff was very nice. Like can be typical of hotels of this type, exercise room was present but not much to speak of, but just put on your running shoes and hit the boardwalk round trip and you have 4.5 miles. Had a minor issue with the AC - seemed to have a mind of it's own, but for the most part we were able to have the room temperature about were we desired. We reported it to the staff and they did try to address it. Can't say it changed much and we didn't say anything else about it. Twenty-four hour cafe in the lobby area is a nice addition. Never got a chance to use the spa - our bad - we didn't book early enough. Looked nice. Stay away from Phillips across the street. Take the bridge and go to Hooper's instead. And by Hooper's there is also a nice group of people running parasailing and jet skiing. My bottom line is that it is an average to slightly better than average beach front hotel. I do think that ALL of these places tend to charge what they can get from you - which can vary from expensive to really pricey. I'd probably stay here again, but I'd also maybe want to try somewhere else too. Oh - if I could have one wish for the hotel, it would've been a screen on the sliding door to the balcony so I could've heard the ocean as I went to sleep (I didn't want to get bitten by those tiny flies all night!) but these are probably hurricane doors which might preclude the screen.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nanette J
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's and I first time at the Grand celebrating our 1st year anniversary and we enjoyed every bit of it. We had a direct oceanfront view on the top and we couldn't have asked for anything more. Whenever we did have an issue, housekeeping and/or maintenance addressed our concerns immediately and efficiently. The service was great, hotel was clean and the employees were courtesy. We didn't eat at the hotel so I cannot comment on the food. The only thing that bothered me were the elevators. One was out of service one day and on another day it was slow. But honestly, it didn't bother us or interfere with our overall stay which is why I'm giving it a rating of 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, management and staff needs to work together”
Reviews.Author: Anthony B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week. Hotel check in tells us only oversized cars can park in front. We own a cadillac escalade esv and could have rode over all the compact cars parked where the oversized cars should be parking. Main restaurant does not serve lunch or dinner you have to go to pizzeria. We ate there for breakfast, it took 30 minutes for the food and when we asked for ketch up, the was mold around the rim and in the cap itself. In the game room four of the game either did not work or ate your money which meant going down to front desk to get a credit to your room and $1 for a game of Ms. pacman is robbery. We asked at front desk if we can charge services and food to our room. Of course all the restaurants and coffee shop and ice cream parlor scoops all accept our card, so we get it and guess what most places do not take it and everywhere you go signs say cash only. Ok can deal with no hotel room charges but no credit cards, every store though has a cash machine where hey get three bucks per swipe and then your own bank charges you on top of that. And god forbid you complain, the staff then starts speaking in their own language and laughing at you. Hotel is convenient to a lot but the rooms are somewhat run down, we had what looked like someone punched 2 holes in the wall and someone just pasted a piece of wall paper of it and the bathrooms were run down and the ceiling tiles above the 5 lights over the mirror were showing signs of burning from the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at the Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deb456Cleveland
Reviews.Content: I want to start out by saying the housekeeping staff was very timely and efficient. The hotel is nice, and on the quieter end of the boardwalk, but needs to finish updating rooms. Especially needs knew sliding doors, (among other improvements) that are not fogged and you can open and close without a struggle. There is a lack of communication between employees at the hotel front desk, we received different check-in information from different employees, which was a little frustrating and confusing. Also, one of the front desk managers, Nina, needs to work on her people skills. A manager can be an efficient manager or be an efficient manager with interpersonal skills. As far as achieving those skills, that would depend on how much of a priority good customer service is to that manager and to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with nice spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn D
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights and it was a nice stay overall! Enjoyed the pools and the location. The room was pleasant and spacious and very clean. Our only complaint might be that the elevator doors were extremely slow. All of the staff are pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but average”
Reviews.Author: Dianne K
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the hotel with my daughter, who is 11yrs old for our summer vacation. I arrived about one hour early prior to check in, which was at 4pm on a Wednesday. We had to wait for our room until 4, which was ok, since parking was available. Upon arrival to the room, I had to call the front desk, since my daughter noticed a stain on the inside of the bedspread, which looked like dried blood, the tv remote was not working. Housekeeping arrived in about 20 minutes to remedy the problem. The bathroom was extremely small, to the point where the door hit the toilet when you walk in. I liked the location since it is on the boardwalk and right on the beach. However view included the roof top with debris from hotel guests and fighting seagulls. The staff were helpful, would recommend some updating/renovations to the hotel for improvement, especially considering the pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel is pretty grand...”
Reviews.Author: ajps1020
Reviews.Content: Pros: Room looks like online photo…pleasant surprise, met expectations Room is spacious…comfortably housed two adults, a teen and a pre-teen Management was responsive to wi-fi issues Housekeeping was very responsive to requests for additional towels and washcloths No problem finding a parking space in garage Great location (far enough away from the main section of the boardwalk, but close enough) Side view room still gave great view of the beach / ocean Easy beachfront access Overall, a comfortable environment Cons: Sliding door to balcony an issue – way too heavy that my 11 year old could not slide it open (addressed here by management; apparently these are being replaced). General housekeeping was just okay – in and out of the room in no time flat Only two plastic chairs on balcony – not comfortable for enjoying the beautiful ocean view (even from our side room) or people-watching Charge for room safe (What’s next? Charging for use of the TV or toilet?) Would I return to the Grand Hotel? Most likely! And note to Management: if my car key / remote is found, please let me know (details left with front desk). Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations, disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Sandi K
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6d/5n stay at Grand. it started off on the wrong foot: The check-in was delayed because the room wasn't ready, but it was disappointing to see the lobby area fill, empty and fill again with travelers--how it is that all their rooms were ready? Trying to get a baggage cart was a disaster. The management should consider holding a room key as a "deposit" so that baggage carts aren't holed up in people's rooms. When the room was finally ready, it was overlooking the parking garage with a sliver of ocean view. I made these reservations in early July directly through the hotel, and was assured we would not get the side view. Thankfully, Denise at the front desk remedied that. But it was still a stressful start to what was supposed to be a vacation. Next: Elevator #3 is unsafe. the door kept closing and trapping things. I reported this to the front desk and was told "we'll look into it" but at no point during the stay was the elevator put out of service for inspection. This could have closed on a kid. Really unsafe. Next: We asked the front desk where to buy some milk. They didn't know. OK--in early season, you might have new people who don't know the area, but this is late August. You should know better. Next: There was an exercise program advertised (Core-Works, I think). There was a poster in the exercise room and an advertisement in one of those hotel-service guide books in the room, so when I asked about it, no one knew what I was talking about. It was then generally declared that "we don't do that anymore" Well, then, don't promote it. Next: When I called to make the reservation, the gentleman asked me if I would like to reserve some time in the spa during my vacation, and I said "sure" and he said "you'll be asked to reserve your time on check-in" Well, like I said earlier, check-in was awful, and when I asked them "How do I arrange for the spa service" I was told I needed to call them directly, but the phone extension didn't work, yada yada. Having said all this, Sharon in the spa was fantastic and should be commended for her work. Next: Housekeeping was inconsistent. One day things were proper, the housekeeper even arranged the stuffed toys on the beds for the kids. That was sweet. But the next day, the washcloths were in a pile stacked with towels, not folded. We never got fresh water glasses. I used the lotion (nice light-lemony scent) but it wasn't replaced. This was supposed to be a Signature Service room. It sounds picky, but I fold my washcloths and get clean glasses everyday at home, and this wasn't a camping trip, it was a hotel trip. Next: there was a foot-washing station on the side entrance, but my kids needed a good hose-down, so we needed to go to the 2nd floor pool area for that. Too much fussing. Overall, it looks nice on the website, but really not so Grand. I personally didn't like the coffee at the coffee bar, luckily there was a Dunkin a few blocks over and it's always nice to walk in the morning. Looking at the other reviews, I am thankful we didn't have any Alarms, and we didn't have any problems with the balcony doors. The take-home message to management is this: you never get a second chance to make a good first impression. Our trip started off sour because we were not made to feel welcomed. We will not be returning and will be telling everyone of our experience here. The take-home to travelers is this: we stayed at Park Place on 9th St last year. Go check them out instead.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VIEW OF OCEAN!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmondello
Reviews.Content: Just returned fromOcean City Maryland.We stayed at the Grand Hotel and Spa on 21st.Very clean and well kept.The rooms overlooking the ocean are breathtaking.Their balconies are very large.Location is great and staff is friendly.The pool area is wonderful u are treated to a towel and pillow on your lounge chair and the bar is an added touch.Cant say enough good things about this Hotel.Would definately return there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice time in OC.”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee10_12
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice time. Room was decent, check in was easy. They originally offered the 3rd floor, but when we requested a higher floor, they did their best to accomodate us and we got the 8th floor (which had a great view). We got there before check in and were able to park, use the pool and enjoy the day. Asked for extra pillows and got them right away. Location was perfect. Pizza place around the corner had a lot to be desired (would not recommend it). Loved Fish Tails, which was just a few blocks over. Beach was awesome. Saw tons of dolphins. Pool was nice too. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “August 2012”
Reviews.Author: JoAnn L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice however was not impressed at all with the restaurant in the hotel. Service was terrible and the food was not good at all...would not go back!! Also not impressed that at 12:30am the Alarm went off telling all guests to evacuate the building because an emergency had been reported. We climb down 11 flights of stairs with my 3 year old son sleeping in my arms to find out it was a false alarm and that someone burnt popcorn...not impressed...however the alarm did do its job. I would recommend the hotel as it's a clean facility and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic getaway.”
Reviews.Author: Harold Z
Reviews.Content: Recently had a three night stay. Had a wonderful King bedroom suite with spa bath. The candles they provided, for the spa, were a great touch and were replaced each night. Staff was helpful and pleasant. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Bluefox3
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Grand Hotel & Spa in Ocean City, Maryland. The hotel is convieniently located on the boardwalk with many amenities within the hotel itself. We stayed in the King Jacuzzi Suite on the twelveth floor. We encountered a problem with our room on the first night but the manager Kara took care of our concerns and did everything possible to ensure a pleasant stay at the hotel. Overall, we had a very pleasant experience during our stay at the Grand. We reccommend this hotel without reservation. The only suggestion I would make to the hotel would be to add a love seat or sofa in the Jacuzzi Suite to watch television. Thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Much, much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: JimWPPA
Reviews.Content: This is not the Ritz Carlton in Palm Beach, or the Four Seasons in Maui. Both of which are opulent, ridiculously awesome and worthy of a 5 star rating. This is a Boardwalk Hotel in OC Maryland. They understand what they are and they do it quite well We were there 5 nights, end of July 2012. We rented a house for a week, and decided to hit the beach 5 days early and wanted to stay on the boardwalk. Grabbed a Deluxe Ocean View about 30 days b4 we arrived. This is a top notch Maryland beach hotel. It is very nice and clean. It had a pool with a bar and decent food, it had a indoor pool and game room. There was a spa, we didn't go to. Room was clean, had a nice view, fridge, microwave and a tiny, tiny bathroom. I did not like the railing on the balcony, seemed a bit week to me. plus, the hallways are not level, they are kind of sloped, not sure what that is about. elevators were prompt and very modern. Hotel was staffed with foreign students, mostly Eastern European and Irish. They were extremely attentive and took a great deal of pride in their job and hotel. Beds were comfortable, pool was clean and well maintained, beach rentals right in front, little beach shop in the hotel, pizza parlor and ice cream as well. It is right on the boardwalk, we heard no noise from the Boardwalk, they had a 24 hour coffee shop, and front desk and consierge that was somewhat helpful. Plenty of parking and so forth. It is not a 5 star hotel, but everything they did . . . was done correctly. My family and I (currently my wife and 2 boys 2 and 5) have stayed at many fancier hotels and weren't treated this nicely. we liked it, would stay there again and we were pleasantly surprised by the entire experience. Thanks for having us

Reviews.Title: “Frequent false fire alarms, poor seating in rooms”
Reviews.Author: MarylandSunshine1
Reviews.Content: Fire alarm went off at 1230am and we were told afterwards that this is a common occurrence at this hotel. Walking down 5 flights carrying a toddler and w elderly mother not fun. Indoor pool was dirty and outdoor pool not kid friendly. Rooms clean and spacious but no comfortable seating, weird cocktail like table w armless chairs. Ok place to stay if u are there to party on the boardwalk, but not the best place for families. Flat pillows. We had a better experience at Holiday Inn on 67th street.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay; will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: chips118
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view from our balcony, friendly housekeepers who stocked us with extra towels, pillows, etc. and amazingly quick service when we had an issue with the room safe. The room was clean & quiet. Kids loved the choice between an indoor and outdoor pool, as well as shuffle board, big chess & bean bag toss inside. The pool guy even organized a pool game for all the kids when we were there that was fun. Love the convenience of being on the boardwalk so that we can easily get onto the beach and head down to the rides/games at night. Second stay at a hotel recently, though, where guests failed to follow instructions that were clearly written along with a fine amount...to not smoke in rooms or to watch their food, esp. popcorn, in the microwave, and we had another midnight evacuation b/c of burnt popcorn. Can't blame the hotel for this.....It's just aggravating.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand doesn't live up to it's name”
Reviews.Author: Karen M
Reviews.Content: Our family looked forward to this trip but were very disappointed in the lack of Wii Fii in the hotel. The staff kept saying it was being worked on but in 3 nights it never was accessible. That was a huge problem for us as our girls were trying to fill college schedules. I was disappointed in the rooms. The $300.00 room should have been nicer, but it was dingy and needs upgrading. The staff was very pleasant but I think for the money you can find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always loved this hotel, probably wont return”
Reviews.Author: Susan K
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults, 2 children) stayed for 3 nights in late July. We have been going there for years, and have never been unsatisfied. We have always found the rooms CLEAN, the beds FRESH, and the lobby area well maintained considering the amount of beach traffic. The balcony doors are hard to open and close, but that is only a slight inconvenience. My only problem with this hotel...it is non-smoking now. I am a smoker, and really don't care to smoke inside the room at all, but the balconies should allow smoking. I don't understand how smoking is allowed on the beach, and on the boardwalk (which I can see and smell from the balcony), yet it is prohibited there. It is nice to sit out on the balcony at night, have a few drinks (and cigarettes) and watch the ocean and the boardwalk. In the morning....have a coffee and a smoke while watching the sun rise has always been a tradition. This year was different. I was sporting bed-head, sunglasses and a baseball cap, while sitting in a group of strangers (who also were unhappy). It was uncomfortable at best. When I go on vacation, I like to enjoy myself, not spend half of it waiting for an elevator to take me down to a designated smoking area. You can however smoke at the Tiki Bar, which sits right next to the outdoor pool....I saw more children running around down there, than I did at any time on my balcony. Just doesn't make any sense. We will have to shop around next year for a beautiful, clean hotel (like the Grand), its kinda sad.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff/pool area:) could be better value, quieter”
Reviews.Author: c9bar
Reviews.Content: Wish we can find a Quiet boardwalk hotel w/the pool bar luxuries & an indoor pool for emergencies. Been here 4 times due to the price (7th, 2nd, 3rd, 6th floors, least expensive room). Had a good view on the 7th floor at the end, better than the 2nd floor w/the railing blocking the view for picture taking. A bit noisy outdoors & the A/C noise was inconsistent (only hummed when it needed to reach thermostat temp). Screen door needed oiling/unrusting. Staff was professional. Apologized when they were talking too loudly at the service elevator. Honored the "please clean" sign promptly. Bed & toiletries made beautifully. At the swimming pool, staff put on the lounge coverup & gave a strong towel. Nice to have a tropical drink on the lounge chair:) Boardwalk location had a bit of room so it wasn't exactly right next to the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE SPA”
Reviews.Author: Andy S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been coming to OC for 23 years, we have never been able to find a good spa down here. That has all changed now that we found the spa at Grand Salon and day spa. The spa is very nice and clean and is ran by a very professional staff. I found Karen Thibault to be very professional in the way she handled us from our reservation right on through to the quailty of the massage. My wife also had a massage from Sharon that was also great. We both have had massages at resorts all over the world and feel both of these ladies measured right up there with the best. We would highly recommend going and getting a massage there. We both will be back there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colleen8789
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day girls get away (mom, aunt and 3 daughters ) to Ocean city and had a wonderful time at the Grand. This is our second time at Ocean city but our first time at the Grand and I will never stay any where else. The rooms are clean and very roomy - more then enough room for the 5 of us. There is plenty of rooms to unpack - 2 dressers and a large closet. There is a mini frige, microwave and plenty of cupboard and counter space which allowed us to make breakfast and lunch in the room. A great outdoor pool with great towel service and a nice bar. The location is perect as it is right on the boardwalk but on the quiet side- everything is a close walk. But the biggest selling feature for us was the balcony - it is the best! The best view you can ask for as you have both the beach and the boardwalk and it is very large - the five of us could sit out there with a lot of room to spare. The staff were all great - we had a couple of mix ups at the begining with our reservation and our cot but they were more then willing to fix everything for us. The housekeeping staff were on top of everything and made sure we had enough towels, soap etc for all five of us. Finally the restaurant had a great breastfast at a reasonable price (even cheaper if you go before 9) and the wait staff were great. This was my first trip to the Grand but it wont be my last

Reviews.Title: “Rip off!”
Reviews.Author: Bummer4
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, cheap furniture, bad flooring(carpet lifting) wallpaper peeling, tight bathroom, water malfunction in the tub took forever to go down, pregnant back tv, really, my child couldn't hook his game up, no wi fi for our stay there, according to them bad weather, hmmm, is we not in the same place, hmmm, yu'll pull a muscle trying to open the balcony door, plastic ran down chairs on the balcony, and the curtains were dirty.....and fo the $$$$'s we paid. What a Lovely stay #bookelsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: loriweitz6
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful time at The Grand Hotel. The hotel is kept so nice and clean. Everything is there for you - outdoor pool with towel service, indoor pool, game room, bar, coffee shop and pizzeria right in hotel. The rooms are very large with beautiful views of the ocean. The staff is wonderful - attentive, courteous and friendly. Patrick the General Manager is always available and visible should any problems arise. The housekeeping staff under the direction of Elizabeth is superb. Never did I have to ask for anything - everything was put in my room (towels, shampoo, etc.). The people that work the front desk (Nina, Cara, Levi, Denise, James, Matthew just to name a few) are so nice and quick. The location of the hotel is perfect - far enough away from all the noise of the boardwalk but close enough should you want to be within walking distance (15-20 minute walk). Also the hotel is right on the beach - what more could you ask for!!!! The Grand is Grand and there is no other place I would stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Tracie W
Reviews.Content: This is located on 21st street, a bit of a walk from boardwalk activities and restaurants. Stayed in room 1112 (11th floor center). Room average, you can get same room quality for less at other hotels. View was breath taking!!!! Outside pool located on parking lot side in order to get afternoon and sunset sun. Pool is kind of small. Pool bar is great and food is good. I rented the cabana by the pool one day and was worth it, however it was only set up for two people, so if you need more than that, you should go around 10am to check in with attendant to get more chairs. It was $50 for all day. You can leave and come back if you want.

Reviews.Title: “"Sucks"”
Reviews.Author: DisappointedKimbro4
Reviews.Content: I feel like the hotel was falsely advertized. It looks bright and really clean from the pictures on the internet but when you get here its dark and gloomy. The balcony is hard to get to sliding door sucks at sliding.Wifi does not even work. Maid serivce sucks we called for towels and wash cloths and never got them had to walk to get them on our own. This section of the boardwalk is dead, its greater populated when you go further down the boardwalk. While touring the boardwalk we spotted other hotels with better balcony furniture and they looked generally cleaner and more lively. The so called "spa" does not look like any place that I would go to, to relax. The parking is good but thats like the only thing that is decent. When you check in they try to offer you some cheap water taffy candy. For the kind of money they charge for this hotel alot of things could be better. Do not stay here go to the Holiday Inn or Quality Inn or Comfort Inn

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Grand!”
Reviews.Author: KMate
Reviews.Content: Just back from my third trip to the Grand. It gets better each time! The rooms are large with room to walk around even with a roll-a-way ($10/nite). Several kitchen cabinets, a microwave and refridgerator. Lots of counter space in the bathroom. The view of the beach from the balcony is wonderful. They have placed privacy screens on the each balcany; you can still see your neighbor, but there is a degree of privacy now. Ample parking in the lot in front of the hotel or in the ramp garage next to the hotel. The fire bell did go off at 6 AM one morning, and it was helpful that in addition to the clanging bell there was an automated voice announcing in all rooms that an emergency had been declared and to not use the elevator but head to the nearest stairwell. The evacuation went smoothly and quietly. No one panicked; the fire department arrived within minutes. A hotel employee informed all the guests gathered outside that someone had discharged a chemical fire extinguisher in the stairwell which caused the stairwell to fill with what seemed to be smoke. We were allowed back in within the hour. The hotel put up notices in the hallways and elevators explaining what happened. There are several shops, a 24 hour coffee shop, an icecream parlor and a pizza parlor attached to the hotel - very handy.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NEVER RETURN!!”
Reviews.Author: Cfamilyof4
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. The first room we were given, on the second floor was run down, with peeling wallpaper and chipped furniture. Not to mention I was staring out the balcony window to the people in a run down hotel next door. I refused to even unpack and was assigned another room on the 4th floor. Slightly better, but still peeling wallpaper, dirty balcony windows and cheap plastic chairs on the balcony. The stench as you walk from the lobby to the parking garage was horrible. We made a joke of it, reminding each other not to breathe. On the first night at 5:30 the emergency alarms went off and we had to be evacuated. This was a horribly scary experience for the kids, as well as the adults. From reading other reviews its a common occurence. The only positive was the access to the beach. That said the hotel does not have a water station at the beach entrance to rinse your feet or beach equipement off. The station is around the corner, therefore sand is tracked in through the hotel right up to your room. Needless to say, I would never stay here, nor would I even recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Mary0820
Reviews.Content: My family came upon the Grand Hotel by accident. The first hotel we reserved, long story, didn't work out well, so we started walking up the boardwalk hoping to find a nice, clean hotel we could afford. By looking at the outside, we were sure the Grand was out of our reach. After talking to the front desk, we were pleased we could not only afford the Grand, but could enjoy our vacation in a clean, modern, and friendly hotel! There aren't many places which accomodate price, cleanliness, friendliness, and efficiency with check in and check out. When we approached the front desk, the girl working the desk asked us if we would like to view one of their rooms before reserving, which we thought was nice. Wow! The rooms have so much more space than what we have been accustomed to. I'm a clean freak. I took my Clorox wipes and wiped the bathroom counter/shower, but *nothing* was on my wipe when I was finished. Our room had two double beds, two dressers, sink, cabinets, microwave, fridge, (all which came in handy when cooking/doing dishes), nice bathroom, clean balcony, great working a/c, etc etc...the pool was fabulous, both of them, as was the tiki bar by the pool and the fitness area. Truly, I can't say enough about the Grand. The Grand saved our 2012 vacation. Because of their superior service and accomodations, they acquired permanent summer vacationers year after year. We'll also be sure to spread the news to family and friends in case they want to plan an OC stay as well. The *only* downsides: the sliding glass doors were a bit hard to open/close and the wifi was sparse at best. But those are minor when compared to bigger more important factors when considering a hotel. Look no further than the Grand. You won't be disappointed! Thank you Grand and staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Loni W
Reviews.Content: Overall not impressed. On the plus side: +The room was clean +Coffe shop and pizza shop were good values, with friendly staff On the negative side: -The sliding door was a constant battle to open and close. We could hear everyone else struggling with their doors as while. It was so loud, I thought a plane was going by. -No table on the balcony -"privacy" screens between balconies provided no privacy or security. Anyone on our floor could have easily came on our balcony and our neighbor's trash blew onto to our balcony -The elevators were slow and there were not enough luggage carts -The pool was small. Didn't have enough chairs and the bar played loud heavy-metal type music.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: hatesthecold
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, we enjoyed our stay the first week in August at Grand hotel and Spa. We arrived at Noon and was pleasantly surprised our 3 rooms were ready and our request was honored to have all 3 rooms next to each other. All rooms were very clean, new carpet, new sliding doors and new TV..Room temperature was perfect - with cold air conditioning. Grand hotel was lot more then I espected - this is beach town..we walked out of the Hotel and were on the beach - what more do you need. Pool area was clean with plenty of towels.. Tiki bar service was good -tiki bar or SHED was in need of update. Few things for management.. Our rooms were cleaned around 2 - 3pm everyday.. needs to be done earlier. ( I tipped her also ) The need of more luggage carts..more privacy on the Balcony's I would recommand this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel & Spa Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gloria P
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Located on the boardwalk, oceanfront was wonderfull. Room was very clean. This is the second time we stayed this summer. Room was very large. Nice size balcony. Little kitchenette had plenty of cabinet space & countertop. Bathroom, beds & carpet was very clean. This end of the boardwalk was very quite & away from the crowd. You leave the hotel & walk across the boardwalk & right down to the beach. Very convenient. We plan to go back in September which will make it the third time this summer. So it must be a very nice place to stay because we would not keep coming back if it wasn't. The only thing that wasn't that great was the breakfast in the restaurant. Will eat somewhere else next time. The bar had great pina collattas.

Reviews.Title: “the Grand was not so "grand"”
Reviews.Author: sandy w
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been going to ocean city,Md all our lives and have stayed in many places. We had a weekend free and decided to try the (stowaway) Grand as we passed it many times on the boardwalk and it looked awesome. Well, the only thing awesome is the location and the ocean view. Even though it is fairly new, the building from the entry way on up is not in good repair. The lobby and the rooms are cheaply and sparsely furnished and all the the hotel offers appear the same. The lounge, the shops, the pool areas all have potential too be fabulous, but aren't...somebody was way too frugal here, especially for the premium you pay to stay there. The front desk staff was all teenage when we were there(early July). We left early...very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Better than usual boardwalk hotel”
Reviews.Author: spyderpig
Reviews.Content: Was impressed with the quality and cleanliness of the hotel. Rooms were updated and clean, not the usual beach front hotel with sandy carpets, peeling wallpaper and shoddy furnishings. Bathroom was a little small, and other guests comments about the screens between balcony patios is true. Still, and much better than usual beach accomodation. A little pricey, but if clean and comfortable is important to you, then use some rewards points on this one. You won't regret it. Convenient shops located in the lobby/ on the boardwalk are great, especially the coffee/ breakfast/ ice cream shop and Oh La La, which is so much nicer than the usual boardwalk schlock stores. Pool and bar are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in area”
Reviews.Author: bhresp38
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there 4 of 4 times and never a complaint. Courteous staff, clean rooms, excellent amendities. Indoor pool and outdoor pool were exceptional. I love having a cover and towel on my beach chair at the pool and enjoying a mixed drink from the tiki bar. No complaints. Will definaley return and stay for the 5th time. If it rains there is much to do in the hotel that you will never be bored. Definately recommended ***

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but needs serious upgrades. Old and Rusty.”
Reviews.Author: FAPRULES
Reviews.Content: Perfect location but rooms and amenities in general need some serious updates. Looks worn out and rusty. Beds are so cheap and the lowest quality, it's screaming for replacement. This could easily be a top notch hotel in Ocean City, if the interiors and facilities are upgraded to current or at least 4-star standards.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive, low quality”
Reviews.Author: KKev77
Reviews.Content: This may be the high-end in Ocean City but it lacks quality. We had a 12th floor King Jacuzzi room and paid $380 a night. NOT WORTH IT. Maid service was very, very weak. Bed was rock hard and the room wall to the south was paper thin. We heard the guy next door talking on his phone all the time. Wi-Fi was quite weak. The top floor room with the view and the location are the only redeeming qualities of this hotel. I travel a lot and spend many nights in many hotels every year so I am probably pickier than most, but i do not feel there was the value in this room for almost $400 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! I highly recommend this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cassidy L
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! I really recommend this! The view was excellent. I would stay here again and again and again! Everything was so clean! The pool and the pool bar was so good! I highly highly recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Saver”
Reviews.Author: sam j
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying there after another hotel messed up our reservation. The front desk girl, Danielle I think, offered to let us see a room before we decided to stay there. It was very clean, modern, and had a wetbar which really came in handy. The view was amazing and I actually saw dolphins from our balcony. The boardwalk is right there, as well as the coffee shop, jewelry store, pizza place and some other shops. The pool was great and they had lots of lounge chairs and as many towels as you wanted. The poolbar was awesome and the prices weren't bad either. Parking was good with a main lot onsite and an adjacent 6 floor parking garage. Four elevators in the lobby kept everyone moving and there are free ice machines on almost every floor. I can't say enough about this place. From the outside, it looks like it would be pricey, but I think we got a value for our vacation dollar. We will never stay anywhere else, never.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Angela H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 7/27-29 and loved this hotel. It was very clean, the location was amazing, right on the boardwalk, and the beach was only a few steps away. It was within easy walking distance to Embers, the mini golf courses, and Phillips was right beside the hotel. The pool was also very nice, we only tried the outdoor but there was also an indoor. Tip for smokers: No smoking allowed on the balcony, there's two places in front of the main hotel doors with chairs and tables where you can smoke, and also at the pool bar. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice views, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Orange2Traveler
Reviews.Content: I had to take time to review the Grand because I am reading some of these negative reviews and experiences and I don't want these few isolated incidents to bring down their rating and deter guests from staying here! The Grand is a fantastic hotel in a fantastic location. We have been traveling to OC for over 12 years and have tried other hotels, but we have chosen to stay here for the past 6 years for good reason. Nothing beats the Grand. The room at the Grand is very large. The beds are comfortable and the floors are quiet (no door slams, loud neighbors). The views can't be beat. The "premiere" view and "oceanfront" rooms are obviously the best, but the design of the hotel lets you have at least an ocean view from any room. We have been requesting the same room for the past few years, and the staff at the Grand has been more than accommodating for us. We actually feel like "important" and "valued guests" at the Grand. Hotels are so commercialized these days, you feel like they just want you in and out so they can make another dollar. We never feel this way here. And, for a resort area, the prices are reasonable! The Grand is situated on the boardwalk just far enough away from the chaos and noise. It is about a 25-30 minute walk to the inlet. You can also easily pick up the boardwalk train from right outside the door. The beach in front of the hotel is crowded, but you can easily find a spot to relax. There are surf shops, a pizza place, and a coffee shop right downstairs. There are also restaurants, mini golf, shopping, and more within a reasonable walk on Baltimore Ave. and the Coastal Highway. The pools at the hotel are small and crowded, but nice. There is a pool bar and a small arcade, too. The only complaint I have with the Grand is trying to obtain a luggage cart on Saturdays/Sundays! You swear you were trying to get the last sale toy on black Friday!! People are vicious in that lobby! There probably are a good 15-20 carts available, but people are usually using them all. People stand around and wait for some to free up and grab them when they do. One year, people were actually walking to people's cars to ask them to use the carts when they were finished. It was a free-for-all. I'm not forward (and didn't want to be a pest) so I waited, and waited, and waited. Eventually, I gave up and we just lugged our belongings down in 2 trips without a cart. Maybe you can organize some kind of waiting list for carts? I think you had something like this last year, but people were still out there trying to snatch them before your staff could give them to the next patiently waiting guest. Although annoying, this is not a deal-breaker. Just thought you would like some constructive feedback and suggestions - hopefully you can make that process more organized. Overall, I would recommended the Grand to anyone staying in OC. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ascorpio1031
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean family oriented hotel, with great services, and locations to everything. I highly recommend this hotel for your next stay weather it's with your family or just as a couple to get away to enjoy the spa, bar, or just to spend time on the beach...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in ocean city, MD”
Reviews.Author: mpierry
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and the way its shaped we got a room with views of both ocean and bayside. There is a cute tiki bar at the pool, but they don't offer pool side service which would make it better. They have alot of amenties in this hotel including a pizza place which is open until midnight and a 24hr cafe. We would def recommend this hotel to others and would come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: annie0696
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 5 day stay. The staff was nice. Room was clean and big for our family. I did not feel cramped like in other places. The bathroom was a bit small, but that was ok. The location is great for the beach and the pools were great for the evening or after being at the beach all day. The best thing is that although it is on the boardwalk you are not too close to all the cluster of the other end of the boardwalk with all the games and noise. This was my first stay in Ocean City, MD and I would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with check-in”
Reviews.Author: Bridget C
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 7/17/12 around 3:45-which was a little bit before check-in time which we were aware of. The girl at the desk informed us that there was not a room ready for us yet, but that we could do all of the paperwork and use the facilities of the hotel and they would contact us as soon as the room would be available, which we assumed would be close to 4 PM-the check-in time. We gave the front desk staff 2 cell phone numbers they could reach us at to let us know the room was ready. We decided to grab a cart and unload our vehicle so that we could park in the garage and wait for our room. We sat in the lobby while we waited with an 8 and a 9 year old who had been travelling all day. Feeling assured that the staff would contact us, we waited as patiently as we could for our call. Finally, around 4:30 my fiance went up to the desk and asked when the room would be ready. He gave the name the reservation was under and the girl(same one who said she would call us) handed him the room keys and told him the room number and said-oh it has been ready and the keys have been sitting here. We never received any notification that our room was ready. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would probably stay there again, but we feel that when you are told a call is to be made, that should be done.

Reviews.Title: “Good location on boardwalk and fab views”
Reviews.Author: mmfoy
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 just got back from staying 2 nights at the Grand Hotel.It was our first time in Ocean City, MD. We stayed on the 11th floor which was an ocean front "Signature" (read:extra money) room but I don't know if it was any different from the other ocean front rooms. That being said, the room was very roomy and it never felt crowded. The bathroom was small but I didn't mind too much. It was nice to have a refrigerator, sink and microwave in the room. Great for keeping drinks cold and re-heating leftovers. The views were the best! Definitely spring for ocean-front and not ocean view. My husband even saw a mama whale and baby in the water! It's on the boardwalk but away from the "busy" parts which I liked. It's about a 20-25 min, walk to reach the amusements at the end of the boardwalk and they have a tram car that runs the length for those who don't want to walk that far. The weather was not good while we were there (cloudy, cool and a little rain) until the morning we were due to leave(our bad luck), but the morning sun shining on the ocean looked fabulous! There is plenty to do within walking distance of the Grand; mini-golf, restaurants, the bay side of the island, and plenty of stores (liquor, candy, ice-cream - what more could you want?) We did not use the pools or eat in the hotel restaurant. We only grabbed coffee in the coffee shop (which is open 24 hrs) off the lobby area and had pizza in the shop on the boardwalk level which was good. Would definitely like to return and spend more time in Ocean City when the weather is better. Bring lots of money though, eating out is very expensive here ($61 for breakfast at a Pancake house?!) but that's like that at any beach town I guess. The beach itself was clean as was the boardwalk. Seemed like a nice, family beach town and the Grand was a good place to stay while there. Also it was very quiet at night, you didn't hear people in the hallways and slamming doors like at some other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “My family's favorite hotel in OC”
Reviews.Author: Frances B
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many hotels over the years but the Grand has been our favorite for the last 6 years. It's clean, the service is good, and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Rick E
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel with great views all around. Staff were very nice. This was our 2nd stay on the 12th floor, we will continue to go their. You can't beat it for convenience of everything at the beach and boardwalk

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel and nice location”
Reviews.Author: klf418
Reviews.Content: Very clean and rooms were spacious. Bathroom was a little small. Elevators were quick too which is always a bonus when staying in such a large hotel. Excellent views from the balcony and only a short walk to the beach. Nice to be at the quiet end of the Boardwalk but yet, still able to walk up and enjoy it. Be sure to request a kitchenette in your room. This is what they advertise, but when we arrived, we were given a room without a kitchenette. I was told they can't put a picture of every room on their website.... I kept complaining to the desk and we were finally able to move the next day. The Wi-Fi in the rooms is Terrible. We were never able to get online in our room. My son had to go to the lobby to use his laptop. Complained to the front desk and she said they would reset the network. Didn't help. The room beside us had Wi-Fi connection but it was very, very slow. Overall our stay was good and we would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “General Manager Rude!”
Reviews.Author: Teri K
Reviews.Content: We were given a handycapped room that I didn't ask for then when I asked them to change to a regular room we were treated like dirt. They rushed us to pack up kept calling knocking on the door asking us to get out fast, packed up as soon as we could then had to stand in the hallway for an hour because of being on the third floor every elavator was full. Went to talk to the general manager to find out how we could get an elevator to get up to our room,and was accused of taking his towel (because of the rush we just grabbed everything and my arms were full of all the beach towels blankets and there happened to be a towel stuck in the mess) all the while my arms were breaking from holding everything! The GM told me he was too busy to help us and what did I expect it was check in time and they were busy! Never was offered anything for ruining my first day at this 300.00 a night hotel, for totally ruining my first day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and stay at the Grand !!!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy B
Reviews.Content: Very clean and large rooms with awesome views from the balcony. Front desk staff was extremely helpfull and courteous. The hotel is a great location on boardwalk and only steps away from the ocean. Rooms were great with the kitchenette and queen size beds were very comfortable. This was our first stay at the Grand and will definately choose this location in the future. Pools were clean, restaurant was great and was nice having parking so convenient. We have stayed at other hotels on boardwalk but none compare to the quality,service,price and location of the Grand. AAA +++

Reviews.Title: “Could Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: PearlJamDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a beautiful lobby and facilities. The room was large and well kept. However, the floor in our room made my son's feet completely black and there was quite a bit of mold around the sink area. This may be a fairly good value in O.C. during the summer season, but I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay, July 13th-15th 2012”
Reviews.Author: Elena Y
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the grand hotel this past weekend. We arrived earlier in the morning, long before check out, and we were given a parking pass until our room was ready. Around 2pm the hotel called us to let us know our room was available. We stayed in room 1001, a signature room. It was clean with a partial view of the ocean, city and bay. We had no issues with loud noises from other guests. The balcony was very spacious. The only thing that went wrong was that at one point, the remote control accidentally brushed my leg and it burned me. The remote started sizzling and popping as if it would eventually go on fire. After calling down for service the maintenance man was at our door within 5 minutes with a new remote. On check out day the hotel allowed us to use the parking pass for the entire rest of the day so we could enjoy ourselves. In addition, I felt that the location of the hotel was perfect. Right on the boardwalk with easy beach access. I definitely would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Our new regular hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Angie4526
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for the 1st time for a week starting July 9th. We had always stayed at one of the cheaper motels and we wanted to explore new places. So glad we did!! This hotel was great, and has so many things right at the hotel. I paid a little more money to upgrade to a Signature Direct Ocean front room and we were so very happy with it!! The view was just awesome, and it was so relaxing to just sit out on the balcony at the end of the day. (we were on the 10th floor, oceanfront) The room was very spacious (especially considering our old room would not even take up half the Grand Hotel room) and we found the beds and pillows to be quite comfy. Our room had the usual microwave and fridge, but it also had a full size coffee maker, sink, and a lot of counter space. It made things a lot easier. The pool, bar, and pizza place were all very good. The 6th floor restaurant had very good views of the bay, and good food. It was a tad pricey, but honestly a lot of places in OC are a tad overpriced. The staff were all friendly, both on the phone and at the hotel. They had a lot of brochures loaded with coupons, so you can get a lot of ideas on what to do when there. The location of the hotel is another great feature. It's right on the boardwalk so you can walk out the door and you're ready to go on the beach or walk the boardwalk. We had no problems with neighbors being too loud or feeling like we were being spied on. It was actually nice how they have it set up, you can see a lot more than if they had it completely blocked off room to room. We plan to make our stay here a yearly thing, and we will definitely be staying in the Signature rooms. The higher floor view is just so worth it, especially when staying for a longer time. Every person has different tastes and priorites when at the beach, but give this hotel a chance. It's a good balance between the cheap, outdated motels and the more expensive luxury hotels. We had an awesome stay here and can't wait to stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms need to be updated”
Reviews.Author: Maureen S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand for 3 nights with our 3 children. This hotel is right on the boardwalk, steps from the beach and has an indoor and outdoor pool. We enjoyed the live music and tiki bar at the outdoor pool one night. A pizzeria, ice cream shop and gift shop right in the hotel was very convenient. My time spent in the spa was delightful. So the price is paid for location! Unfortunately, the rooms had old carpet, old bedspreads, old tvs, sliders covered in a film so you couldnt see out and bathrooms with black mold where the tile grout was missing. Bearable but not what you expect for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Time”
Reviews.Author: Deb J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a short jaunt to OC We stayed at the Grand Hotel and Spa. We had a marvelous time! The hotel is located on the boardwalk and has everything you'll need for your stay. We enjoyed the whirlpool tub in our room and the small kitchenette. We had a great view of the Atlantic Ocean and the beach. There is an indoor and outdoor pool, bars, and a spa. The beach was very clean, unlike many years ago. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A solid "B"”
Reviews.Author: dtp010
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at The Grand (last time was in 2008), and we will choose this hotel again in the future. I stayed for four nights with my husband and two daughters (turning 8 and 5). Our criteria for selecting an Ocean City property is oceanfront, a hotel (not a motel) and right on the boardwalk (street 15 or higher – anything lower than that is too hustle-bustle and high energy for us). As the title says, I’d rate it a solid “B” overall. There’s nothing bad about it but nothing extraordinary about it either. The best thing about the property is its location. Situated ocean front and right on the boardwalk, it’s easy access to the beach, morning bike rentals (@ Eden Rock two doors down), restaurants, shops, the pier, rides, etc. You can really park once and not drive anywhere the rest of the trip. The rooms are fine – two queen beds, clean, and a small kitchenette area with mini fridge, microwave, sink and cupboard space. There’s a fairly large balcony – all have an ocean view. We upgraded to the signature room (floor #10) and probably wouldn’t do that again next time. Not enough extras to warrant the extra cost. There is an outdoor and indoor pool, which we like. The outdoor pool is nice with plenty of chairs and chaise loungers, and towels are offered for pool use. There are also large blue towels that are the length of the chaise loungers (this is new since the last time we were there). We like the indoor pool for drizzly days for our girls. A small fitness center is next to the pool area, and there are rest rooms with showers and a sauna in this area, too. We use the space to change in before our rooms are ready at check-in. Front desk staff was very nice. We arrived at 12:15 PM and our room was ready by 1:30. Staff is always out and about sweeping and mopping as guests track in sand and water. There’s also a spa, but we didn’t visit. Parking is easy and convenient with a small outside lot and large garage immediately next door. There’s a restaurant, pizza shop, retail souvenir shops and a 24-hour shop (coffee, water, snacks, etc.) all on site. So, overall, a good place to stay. Note: My first choice is actually the Holiday Inn on 17th, but for nearly $499/night, it’s just not in our budget. Enjoy your next trip to OC.

Reviews.Title: “1st and last stay”
Reviews.Author: lynn k
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks nice in the pics, we arrived at the hotel, bonus indoor parking, walk across the side street, to the front entrance. the lobby nice. now!!!! to the room #805 was a big room, two queen beds, very outdated, small 19inch tv, very small bathroom, toilet sats right in front of the door,& the tub is right behind the door which may it very hard to get in and out of. into the room..........The one bed mattress pad had stains on them as did the bed sheets, we had a dead moth by the desk for 5 days, (waited to see how long it would stay there). the coffee maker was growing something in the bin. the room above us was very noisey rumbling sounds a few time a night. The balcony had two plastic chairs no table. I was very disappointed in the condition of the room and the Grand Hotel & Spa.. housekeeping supervisor for 25 years for the Hilton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “second trip this year great motel”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the grand every year since it opened and sometimes twice. Love the convient location and especially the parking garage. Have reccommended it to friends and family. Great motel would't stay anywhere elese.

Reviews.Title: “good stay at the grand”
Reviews.Author: Tara C
Reviews.Content: Fourth of July week we stayed at the grand for 7 nights. It was very nicely located with a 24 hours cafe downstairs, 2 pools , 2 bars and some beach stores to shop in. The beach was just a few steps away and very clean. The beds were comfortable, housekeeping was very welcoming and helpful, and the room was very clean. the only thing I wish I had for paying such good money would be a newer television and free hott breakfast of some kind. Overall the stay was great and staff was friendly. See you next year !

Reviews.Title: “One more year at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: AnnMaryland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one more vacation at the Grand. I believe that this is our 6th year. It is looking very dated and is in dire need of a remodel. The vainer is coming off of the furniture now. It is also not as clean as it used to be. When we arrived, there was sand under the table and chair next to the window as if housekeeping could not bother to move the table and chair to vacuum it up. There was also lint and dirt on the floor. I called the front desk and they quickly had housekeeping come up and re-vacuum the room. As we were leaving today, we came back to our room after we ate breakfast. We had not checked out yet and someone was already in our room vacuuming. She seemed to be finishing up the room. We tried to tell her that we had not checked out yet but she did not speak English. She left and we used the bathroom before we checked out. The beds were made which made us wonder if they had changed the sheets for the next people to have the room or if housekeeping thought we were staying an extra day. While we were in Ocean City, we walked up the boardwalk to the Dunes Manor. We had a wonderful dinner there. Before we left we asked if we could see one of the rooms. We were shown a room which looked very clean and updated. I'm thinking we will stay there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Grand Hotel during the 4th of July week. The kids loved the hotel, especially the game room, indoor pool, outdoor pool, location, and great oceanfront view. The room was large, quiet, and clean, but the bathroom was small. We have been to Ocean City, MD several times each year for the past 12 years and stayed at many hotels on the boardwalk. This hotel had great rates and was definitely the best on the boardwalk for the value. The coffee shop and stores in the hotel were nice and our some of our favorite places were very close, such as Phillips, Embers, Candy Kitchen, and mini golf courses. The staff was nice and there was always somebody cleaning the lobby area and all other floors. The only negative was the restaurant on the 6th floor, which was expensive and took a very long time to get food for breakfast, so I would recommend going elsewhere on the boardwalk for breakfast. Otherwise, we really liked the hotel amenities and enjoyed our stay. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “1st and Last stay at The Grand”
Reviews.Author: Fred D
Reviews.Content: We checked in and were expecting a "nice" ocean view; however, our room was on the crappy 2nd floor. We could barely see the ocean due to the 1st floor shops and the restricting balcony. If you are staying, request a room 3rd floor or above. The 2nd floor's ice machine was also broken. We rode to the 12th (top) floor to get ice and everyone was complaining up there because it was so hot on the 12th floor. No free breakfast here, but you can go to the coffee shop where you will pay $5.50 for a latte or $2.75 for a cup of black coffee. Upon entering our room, there was fecal matter that was "left behind" from the previous guests. It was awful and disgusting, on the side of the toilet. Disappointed in the house keepers. I also would have to agree with a previous reviewer--the pillows are terrible, so bring your own or request 12 extras at check in. I had to ask 3 times for 4 extra pillows. They weren't too happy with me. Very outdated furniture and television. I guess that's why the price is so-so. I would highly recommend staying elsewhere. This was my first and last time at the Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Has what you need for beach town”
Reviews.Author: ak629
Reviews.Content: Lets remember this is a beach town not Bermuda. The common area's are clean but in need of an update, rooms were being updated during the winter. Good location on the boards were it is not to noisy at night. Staff was friendly. I read some of the other reviews about food, shops and other belly aching. Are you kidding me? Ocean City has food withing 20 feet of anything in any direction. The beds were great.

Reviews.Title: “Grand ? Not so , but could be”
Reviews.Author: randall w
Reviews.Content: The Grand doesn't live up to name . The hotel is a diamod location and the bones of the building are good but as a gem ...Its a pearl at best. The room had wall paper pealing apart ( rm 411), The funiture was very cheap and took away instantly from any wow factor that should be with this Grand building. No drink cups in bathroom, ceiling fan in bathroom not working. All and all the Grand was like a bad xmas package....Wrapped very nice on internet and to look at but not much inside ! Hint... Go to a Borgata.... Grand,,hint hint ...inside and out ! Oh and AC very noisy.in room. Disturbed sleep every time it came on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Super Clean”
Reviews.Author: Hugo G
