Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel on fourth of July even though it was full house they manage to keep it clean planty of parking friendly staff, conveniently lacated, with sliding doors closed you don't hear a thing of whats going on outside. This was my first time at hotel and I'll be back, more than I can say about other hotels in Ocean City.I stayed there once i don't come back many hotels in Ocean City have rude employees,

Reviews.Title: “Best in its class on the boardwalk...”
Reviews.Author: BriMcD10
Reviews.Content: For a beach town, this hotel was definitely good. My family just stayed there this past 4th of July week and got a 5 day special for the week, so the rates were good. There are no 4 or 5 star hotels in OC so this was better then what I expected. Location wise, it's right on the boardwalk but not in the heart of the activity, which is good because you don't get the noise of the crowds and events. The rooms were large enough for a family of 4. However, the windows on the sliders to the balcony overlooking the beach were foggy. They really need to clean them regularly because of all the salt water residue from being on the beach. When we had them try and clean them, it would not come clean at all. Also they really need to dust the lampshades! The amount of dust that came off the lampshade when it was accidentally brushed into created a cloud of dust. The bathrooms are tiny and the knob to turn the water on in the shower fell off, but we easily popped that back on. Lastly, we ate in their restaurant for breakfast on the first morning there. It took an hour before the got our food served, for breakfast! We went down the street to Sahara Cafe for breakfast each morning after that, for much better service and food. Otherwise the staff was friendly and helpful, both at the front desk, and the pool. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Meathebeach
Reviews.Content: Our patio door was very hard to open. Two cheap plastic chairs were on the patio. Pillows were flat and we had to ask for more. The fitted sheets on the beds did not fit the pillow to mattresses. They just didn't stay on. Hotels.com sold us two queen beds and they were standard sized. None of the staff speak fluent English. This includes the room staff and the staff for the boardwalk shops. Would be nice to see some Americans employeed here. The restaurant only served breakfast and was incredibly expensive. It was not a family restaurant. The wifi was in the lobby but patchy everywhere else. Ice machines on every other floor however you had to search for ice because they were always empty. Snacks in vending machines were lunch box sized chips for $1.00. Tiny out of date RCA tv in room. I'd invest your money in a newer more up to date place.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is grand, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Tammie Y
Reviews.Content: My friend and I called for reservations back in February and requested 2 rooms side by side and were told they'd try to accomadate. When we arrived on June 28th, we were told we would be on 2 seperate floors(6 and 7) and that all rooms were booked. The ocean/beach view was amazing, but the room wasn't very clean (dusty headboards, musty smelling bathroom) and the beds didn't have comforters, just a sheet and blanket. Maid service came to clean the room, but we were still in bed and asked if they could come back later. When we left the room we hung the maid service sign on our door assuming they'd realize we were out of the room. They never came back so I had to call the front desk to request towels. The next day we left the room early figuring they'd clean the room, which they didn't; so I called the front desk AGAIN and requested maid service and their answer was because I had requested towels the night before and they don't always pay attention to the door signs. The service is slow, the elevators are even slower, and they only have 8 luggage carts for a 10 story hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service”
Reviews.Author: Vectorsmom
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel and Spa is a nice place to stay - clean, but a little worn in some areas. The staff were more than accommodating, and were very helpful since my reservation was made through hotels.com and was changed by hotels.com to a side ocean view room from the front ocean view I had originally reserved. The hotel upgraded us to a nicer room on a higher level when one came available, which was very nice. While the original room was fine, there was an adjoining door that all noise could be heard through, and the family in the adjoining room was very loud. The fitness center only had a couple of pieces of equipment working, and we were unable to use the indoor pool because there were always unsupervised children in there - much younger than the 15 year age limit to not be supervised. The outdoor pool was very nice, and again, the staff at the pool bar were wonderful. I would not recommend eating breakfast at the hotel restaurant as it was extremely slow, but the 24 hour coffee shop attached to the hotel was nice and you can get breakfast sandwiches and pastries in there. I would stay here again as it was nice and clean for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: Carolm1217
Reviews.Content: I booked this for a "girl friends only getway" I asked for a room with a great view. The front desk staff assured me of a great view and she was right! wonderful view from the nice large CLEAN room. The staff was very nice and polite!

Reviews.Title: “Our first adult weekend getaway mostly a success”
Reviews.Author: Tracey S
Reviews.Content: Well after 10 years I was able to get to the beach for the first time with my boyfriend without our children. It was an amazing opportunity so we chose the Grand. It looked incredible online and I loved that the General Manager answered all reviews good and bad. This really impressed me. I chose the hotel based on its ammenities as well as the pride the General Manager seemed to take in his hotel. My boyfriend and I are looking to plan a wedding in the near future and thought the Grand might be the place to do it based on all of the reviews. When we arrived we were able to check in early at 2:00pm, our room was ready which was great! When we got up to the room, we were in Room 304 which I knew right away would be on a corner since I had done some research before I got there. So I was a little disappointed as our first adult getaway I would have loved a middle room with a view of the just the beach but our room did provide us with a view of the beach and the street which was fine. Opening up the door to our room I was a little disappointed as I had this amazing vision of what it would look like inside the room since this was my understanding that it was a luxury hotel but it looked like any other hotel room, with the old comforters and the red hotel rug and old furniture. The desk in the room looked like someone had sat on top of it it was warped and looked ready to fall apart. On the second floor I saw that tile floor was in some of the rooms and I had wished we could have gotten on of those rooms because they just looked cleaner. The bathroom was small but it was clean. We didn't experience any bed bugs thankfully and believe me it's the first thing we inspect for when we arrive. No need to have your dream vacation weekend turn into a nightmare. And on the first day we called down to get a lightbulb replaced over the kitchen area and it never was so we removed one from the bathroom and put it in the kitchen area since the bathroom had many lightbulbs available. I also had to call down for maid service since the maid went right past our door with the sign maid service please on it. Now for the great parts of our vacation. Absolutely a million things to do in this hotel, from the sauna to the spa to the game room to the indoor and outdoor pool. Absolutely close to everything!!! Also loved that off of the beach I could use the downstairs bathroom and go right to beach. Wonderful!!! Also on check out day you can stay parked in garage until 2 which is great because it was amazing to be able to relax one more time by the pool and have a drink before the long drive home. Knowing we were going back to four children this was the absolute best part of the trip!! You have this amazing service where the pool person comes over and sets up your lounge chair for you and the pool bar is great! The bartenders aren't very experienced or fast but you get a good drink eventually. The margaritas by the pool superb! The EPIC bar is great except it doens't get alot of customers too often at least we were the only ones in the bar on Saturday night after midnight and Friday night we went to karaoke there and the while entertaining, the karaoke person sat the entire night and his equipment was less than amazing. The sound was not very professional but we did have a good time there. The bartender never heard of a shaker before and then mixed my shots in a shaker. LOL I thought that was funny. All in all I thought that this hotel was great for its ammenities and had a lot to offer however I feel like if I wanted the room lap of luxury to go with it maybe I had to pay a little more a night to get it. I did pay almost 300.00 a night which to most people I guess isn't a lot of money but to a couple raising four children we just thought we would get more room for our money but honestly, it was a great trip and we really did enjoy our stay with the exception of the little instances I stated above. I would stay here again and probably upgrade my room a bit and believe if the rooms would be updated to tile floors and updated drapes and furniture I believe this would be the best kept secret hotel ever!!!!

Reviews.Title: “small,dirty ,and smelly at best should be named cheap motel on boardwalk instead of the Grand Hotel and spa”
Reviews.Author: Deborah T
Reviews.Content: Booked for the weekend two adluts and three teenagers. After seeing the room we expressed that the room would not be large enough for our needs. (and that s after getting over the fact the the room looked dirty and smelled of mold) requested to be moved to a larger room at our expence they said that nothing was availble until the next day. requested for them to send up a roll away bed until we could get a larger room. they agreed however the bed never arrived We requested that bed twice. After one of the kids had to sleep on the tile floor. and there road side flashing billboard in front of the hotel said rooms available all night. we decided to end our stay due to the poor costumer service and the over priced cheap motel appearance.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat guest”
Reviews.Author: familyof5mttop
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year. Great location, wonderful staff. Clean and spacious rooms. Maid service could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view but overall needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: cbluvsthebeach
Reviews.Content: When I was looking at places to stay in OC, MD I knew to check TripAdvisor and choose a place that was in the top 10. A few years ago we stayed at the Park Place Hotel and the reviews of it were spot on just as they have always been. The only reason we didn't stay again was that we wanted to stay on the quieter end of the boardwalk. So, in choosing the Grand, my priority was quiet side of boardwalk, ocean view and clean. I originally wanted the Holiday Inn but it was not available. I was nervous because at the time I was looking, the Grand was at about 30 on the tripadvisor list. However the key elements I wanted were met and I really liked how the managers read and commented on many of the reviews - good and bad. The Grand is a great shaped hotel. It curves so that every room has a view. We stayed on the 11th floor on one of the side rooms. We had a fantastic view of the ocean, the city and the bay. At night the city was lit up and looked cool and, of course, during the day the ocean and bay looked beautiful! The deck is very large and is sparsely decorated with two little old white plastic chairs and little side table. We set up our beach chairs and turned it into a great deck! The bedroom was very big and looks just as it does in the picture on the website. The bathroom, however, is very small. Probably the smallest bathroom I've ever had in a hotel. But, it was very clean. Also, the towels seemed relatively new (although an old towel was mixed in once in a while when the cleaning crew changed them). Our room only had a small fridge with a microwave on top and a old coffee maker. I had glanced into other rooms on our floor and they had little kitchenettes in them which I would have liked better but not enough to ask to change our room. You may need to request it if you are counting on a kitchenette. The furniture is worn and outdated but, again, clean. The beds are not the most comfortable - a little too stiff. The linens and blanket were nice though. The pillows were very old and flat. I think the desk may have thought I was crazy because I asked for 5 extra pillows - but honestly, that didn't even help. The assortment of pillows that we ended up with were in all states of overuse. Note to management . . . buy new pillows! There is a t.v. in the room but it was old school and very dark. If you want a good wifi signal you need to go in the hallway or downstairs to the lobby. I know that many people like to say, well you're at the beach - so what if the t.v. is old or you can't get online - go outside and have fun! I get that argument. My answer is when you have spent all day at the beach and walked around for a couple hours, sometimes you just want that downtime to watch something on t.v. or research fun stuff to do or good places to eat on your computer or tablet. It's 2012 I think that a great hotel needs to keep up to date with technology no matter where it is located. My last thought on the room was that I wondered why there wasn't a little sofa or maybe two nice side chairs to sit on. The room is very large and could accommodate either very easily! The outdoor pool was a good size and clean with plenty of lounging chairs. The inside pool was significantly smaller but, good that they had that option. We ordered drinks at the poolside bar - that was a nice treat. We never ate at the restaurant. It's on the 6th floor and whenever I stopped to look it was either closed or hardly had anyone dining in it. That's all the warning I need to not try to eat at a restaurant. Plus I don't remember seeing it reviewed very nicely on TripAdvisor. Side-note, we did eat breakfast next door at the Sahara Cafe and it was tasty and inexpensive. Check-in was normal and pleasant as was checking out. The shops attached to the hotel were your typical boardwalk shops. Fun touristy stuff. Oh La La had really cute shoes. My kids had ice cream at the parlor and said it was yummy. I bought a t-shirt at another store that had very nice employees. Personally I didn't like the pizza at the pizza place and preferred Franco's a couple blocks down the boardwalk.The coffee shop seemed convenient - I didn't end up buying anything there but the pastries and coffee looked good and I think it's open 24hrs. Best thing was that when you left the hotel all you had to do was cross the boardwalk and you are on the beach! Which, to me, was the most important part of our vacation. I love Ocean City, MD's beach. Its very clean, not a lot of shells to step on and whenever we have been there - no green flies to bite you. We saw dolphins, surfers, windsurfers (of course the annoying advertising boats) and the water was wonderful. With that, our vacation was perfect. I did like the Grand. I couldn't have asked for a better view and thought the price we paid was affordable. As far as staying there again, I'm not sure. I think I would have to see on their website that they have upgraded the hotel with new beds, t.v.'s, room furniture and even simple things like new shower curtains and, of course, pillows. If I see that, I will be back in a heartbeat and recommend them to all my friends otherwise, I will just make reservations earlier at the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cyclone2933
Reviews.Content: For over 40 years I've been going to OC and have stayed at some great places, and some not-so-great places. This will be the 3rd year that we have stayed and the Grand and years ago, I remember sitting on my deck in the Thunder Island condos, watching the Grand being built and remember thinking, "what a cool curved hotel, I'd like to stay there some day." We arrived Wednesday, June 20th right in the middle of the MD State Fire Assoc parade, and we were warned about the traffic mess it caused even before we left our house. The front desk staff told us not to come in on rt 50, but to take the alternate route and come in through the northern part of OC. What a great tip. Since we got there before check-in, the front desk told me that they would text me when our room was ready, so we changed in the 2nd floor changing area and went swimming in the outdoor pool and watched the fireman's parade from the pool deck. Our 11th floor Signature room was very nicely appointed and this was the 2nd time we took advantage of the Signature room. The views from the room were spectacular and the room in general was very nice and clean. The beds were comfortable and the 4 of us loved the crisp white sheets. Other things to love at the Grand are the ample parking spaces in the garage and the proximity to every thing including dining, mini golf, souvenirs and the boards. If there was 1 negative thing that we could say, it was that our room was not made in about 2 days. One day the house keeper said she'd have it done, but never came back, then the next day we were out of our room at 10am and didn't return until after 4pm and the room was still not attended too. We did call the front desk and someone did come up after 4:30 to take care of our room while we went to dinner. The final thing that made us shake our heads, was our neighbor in 1114. Sometimes you just remember people, and this was the second year we stayed next to this particular gentleman. He's a very nice and polite guy and doesn't bother anyone; however, when you walk out on to your balcony at 8am and see your neighbor bare-@ss naked sunning himself, you just have to laugh. I was just glad the kids weren't up that early to see old glory. All-in-all a great hotel and we'll be back next year, just hope we get a different neighbor. LOL.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Short Hills, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel S
Reviews.Content: We got an ocean view room with two double beds. It was one of the most SPACIOUS rooms we have gotten in an oceanfront hotel! You could easily fit a queen air mattress on the floor and have tons of space. There was also a kitchenette with a medium-sized fridge. Beds were comfortable, and on the main floor of the hotel were several shops and restaurants. Best of all, it was right on the beach and boardwalk! It is a bit away from the main attractions of the boardwalk, but there is a tram that comes every 15 mins for $3 a ride (exact change only). The outdoor pool was LOVELY, even though there were a LOT of small children. The staff sets up chairs for you, with towel service. There is also an indoor pool open till 11pm. They were also willing to give us as many parking passes as we needed. Great place to stay with friends!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest address, Great Service, Unforgetable views on the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: Maureen N
Reviews.Content: This absolutely the best kept secret. Most of their rooms have direct ocean view, right on the boardwalk. Ample and free parking right next door to the hotel and all the rooms have a microwave and refrigerator.The staff is great and professional, you have everything you would need to relax with sand sea and water just steps away! In my opinionm, best kept secret. With the the recent renovations the hotel is now 100% non-smoking! If the ocean tires you, they have a lovely swimming pool and game room on the second floor that is great for families. Will definitely return not only because of the great location but because of the attentive and great service of the team!

Reviews.Title: “An awesome week at the Grand Hotel & Spa”
Reviews.Author: ladyff22
Reviews.Content: My husband, granddaughter and I just spent a wonderful week at the Grand Hotel in Ocean City Maryland. We have been coming to Ocean City for the past 14 years for the Maryland State Fire Association Convention and I think this is the best place that we have stayed! Our room was very spacious and clean. The staff were very friendly and courteous. Our 6 year old granddaughter loved the indoor pool. We spent a lot of time at the outdoor pool which was very nice. Several of our friends who belong to our local fire department stayed at the Grand and they too were very satisfied. We will definitely be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: Positives: Our room was very clean, large, and the bed was comfortable. We had a small refrigerator in the room which was nice for snacks and leftovers. The staff was courteous and helpful. The spa was VERY nice to have right in the hotel (I had a pedicure). You literally walk out of the hotel onto the boardwalk, no steps to go up or down. There was a parking garage right next door so our car did not have to bake in the sun (which was appreciated during the nearly 100 degree days). Negatives: Breakfast in the restaurant was only ok and very over-priced. The walls were a bit thin and we could hear our neighbor's TV and could even hear them talking. The air conditioning unit was set to "auto" and was glued so it could not be changed. This caused the air to turn on and off constantly as the thermostat adjusted. Normally this would not be an issue, but the unit was so loud each time it turned on, that it sometimes woke us up during the night. Though there is direct boardwalk access, the hotel is located toward the upper end which makes for a LONG walk to any of the attractions. Overall: We were glad to have a clean and comfortable room on the boardwalk, but will probably try another hotel closer to the boardwalk attractions next time.

Reviews.Title: “Bad bad bad experience! Poor management! Never will come to This hotel again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shabi1978
Reviews.Content: Very bad experience! First off all for the amount of money you pay you get Zero customer service! The rooms are ok! Not that great. They charged us around $640.00 more than what we were suppose to pay just by "accident" thank God my husband noticed it and when we confronted the front desk not that she didnt apologize, she even gave us an attitute! It was so fraustrating! :( We went to let the manager "patrick" know and he took his employee's side and gave us a very cold apology that you could see he doesnt even mean it. He didn't even ask us if here is anything he could do for us or anyway we can leave with a good experience! Nothing!!!! Even when we asked for just a couple of hours of late check out he said no!!!! Never will book here again! They are so many nice hotels ocean front and so much cheaper! Do your research!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't listen to the few bad reviews ...”
Reviews.Author: SandyC51405
Reviews.Content: I read alot of the reviews of all the hotels in Ocean City before we booked for our vacation. We were pleasantly surprised to find a nice spacious room with a mini kitchen and a beautiful view. Everyone was pleasant, breakfast in the Grand Plaza dining room was really good as well. If I could wish for one thing different I think it would be a little softer bed. We will definately stay at the Grand Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Crowning Jewel of Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the Stowaway Grand Hotel? My son and I have been coming to the Grand for some years now. I t is our favorite hotel. Any time we come to the Grand we are met in a very professional and courteos manner. Since we have stayed there a number of times many of the staff remember us by name. I have to say the staff there is not a staff but a great team. They all work together. Nobody is above anybody else but just members of the team. We were just there for a few days in June. When we checked into the hotel we were met by Levi and Ryan at the front desk. Ryan remembered us from our last stay. In addition to Ryan we met some new team players Stephanie, Danni, and Levi. They checked us in in a very timely manner and checked to see if there was anything they could do for us. Mr. Patrick Staub also greeted us by name. He is a manager that likes to see and be seen by the guests.Housekeeping kept our room spotless. The only problem we had during our stay was being short changed in the Pizzaria twice. I brought this to the attention of Anna the director of Food and Beverage at the Grand. As soon as I informed her of the problem she snapped to and took care of the problem right quick and fast. It has always been a pleasure to stay at the Grand. We look foward to our next stay during Delmarva Bike Week. We already have reservations in for next summer and cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: bkb1964
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at Grand Hotel on June 14 so my daughter and her friend can go to H20 that night. The hotel was located right on the boardwalk and a walking distance to the main attractions of OC boardwalk as well as few steps to the beach. You also have the option to use the tram or bus. The hotel is near everything-food, shopping, mini golf etc. The room was spacious and clean. The balcony was also a plus-nice view of the ocean. The front desk staff were all helpful and very polite. I felt safe letting my teen & her friend do their own thing while me and my 11 yr old son did ours. We were even able to enjoy the beach the following day during our checkout date since we didn't have to move our car out of the parking garage till 2pm. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to couples, families with kids or teens and even seniors. I was also lucky to get the room at a great price since it was early June and I booked it a while ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tara J
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the stay at this hotel. My husband and I and our 2 children stayed June12-15, it was very enjoyable. We were on the 10th floor which has a beautiful view. It was senior week at that time but we had no problems. The hotels website doesn't tell you that there is an indoor pool, so we were very happy when we got there to find we had it! I was impressed with the staff and the cleanliness of our room. I will be staying at this hotel again next year!

Reviews.Title: “quality time”
Reviews.Author: Dawn H
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed June 13 -15. Yes it was senior week which we knew when we booked.Everyone who has ever had a senior knows what to expect. Our stay was very relaxing. Our room was very clean, we were on the 9th floor and our view of the ocean was great.The Hotel staff was friendly and helpful with everything we needed. Both pools were nice and much larger than some of the other hotels. The 24 hour coffee place in the lobby was nice. We would definately stay here again! Even on senior week!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: zombiegirl827
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, my husband and I took my little cousin and her friend june 11-15, it was senior week so at night it was VERY loud. That was no problem! The view was amazing from the 10th floor. Everyone there was super nice everything was clean and well taken care of. I am nothing bad to say about this hotel it was the best hotel we have stayed in so far in OCMD. Thanks everyone at the grand hotel for making our stay wonderful:-)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: TACGA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to everything which is nice, but having stayed here 2 Junes in a row 2011 and 2012, which is senior week. You should not stay here during this month. This hotel rents out rooms to underaged kids who are partying and loud and then do not do anything about it. If you are looking for quietness and relaxation you will not find it here. This a nice place to stay during the off season but not prime summer vacation time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised!! Staff was excellent, affordable, clean rooms, great pools! Can't beat the location!! Only drawback was you need cash for the coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Brandi W
Reviews.Content: Nina Railean was especially helpful at accomodating our needs, even when they seemed to be unpleasant in any circumstance. She went out of her way to ensure that we recieved quality assistance and accomodation in order to make our honeymoon an enjoyable one. We really appreciated her efforts and hope to return in the future. Thank you, Nina!

Reviews.Title: “Won's Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer V
Reviews.Content: I've been to Ocean City quite a few times and have stayed in a bunch of Hotels, lets just say I will never stay anywhere else. We will from now on stay at the Grand Hotel. The staff was very nice and very helpfull, they even helped me out when I needed holes drilled into my sons lacrosse helmet. The rooms are very big and very clean as far as the view, I loved waking up everyday and watching people on the boardwalk and ocean. Great Place!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Ocean City.”
Reviews.Author: levora
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay anywhere else on the boardwalk. The rooms are nice along with the helpful and friendly staff. My family each year just love love love staying at the Grand Hotel from the food to the cheapest shopping in their lovely shops. I would suggest this hotel to anyone that goes to Ocean City. This is one of the most clean hotels that I have stayed at thus far in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: jayrock958
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for the past 4 years. It hosts a covention that we attend every year. It has something for everyone, from the indoor and outdoor pool, to the arcade, to the spa, to the bar. The 24 hour cafe is also very convenient. It is close enough to all of the action, but far enough where you can enjoy some quiet time. The rooms are spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending an event at the convention center. The Grand Hotel is located nicely and my room (1105) had a wonderful southern view of the boardwalk and beach. The large room with two queen beds was comfortable and quiet. The refrigerator was convenient, and the hotel staff are very responsive. I booked anextra room for my hospitality suite one night and the staff cleared out the beds and replaced the beds with rounds and chairs for my guests. Even the California Cheesteak in the pizzaria on the gound floor was of special quality. I will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “check the sheets & bedspread!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunburywolfe
Reviews.Content: My first impression was that it was a very nice place. Faye at the front desk was very nice. The hotel grounds & building looked ok. As I was looking for the TV remote our 2nd day there, I pulled the bedspread completely off & found a stain on it that almost made me ill. Housekeeping took care of the problem but beware. Also, don't eat at the in house pizza place, I won't even comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: sca6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a meeting and the rooms were very large. We had a refrigerator and microwave with cupboards I could imagine would serve someone well who was staying for an extended visit. The staff were friendly and the boardwalk was right there at the back entrance. Very quiet. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Janet51912
Reviews.Content: I chose the Grand Hotel for my May 19th wedding and haven't a single regret or complaint! The ceremony was on the beach at 21st Street right in front of the hotel and the cocktail hour and reception followed in the Grand Terrace Restaurant. It was the perfect atmosphere with the sun setting beautifully in the background, the food was out of this world, and everything went off without a hitch. The block of rooms we reserved for our 60 guests were spacious and clean and everyone was comfortable. I have received so many compliments on our venue, on the food, on the waitstaff, etc. I've even gotten a few "best wedding I've ever been to!" comments! Robin and Anna were an absolute pleasure to work with and made it so simple to put this whole thing together from 3 hours away (we live in Philadelphia). We visited quite a few hotels last summer before deciding on the Grand and it turned out to be the right one! I would absolutely recommend the Grand Hotel for vacations and banquets and plan on staying again soon!

Reviews.Title: “hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Cherie K
Reviews.Content: breakfast restaurant very poor service. everything else-great.

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Carol B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the Memorial Day Weekend and it was very pleasant. We had a wonderful view of the ocean. The room was clean and our maid service was very good. It was nice being right there on the boardwalk, didn't need your car to get anywhere. The room was very large and the bed was comfortable. The staff was very helpful and I would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and near beach, but far from main area of boardwalk.”
Reviews.Author: Drummer7069
Reviews.Content: I thought that the hotel was great an all the staff was excellent! We had to go through a little trouble to get papers sign an stuff because we were under 21 but I appreciated them letting us stay there and not judging us because of our age. The location was far from the main shops and eating places on the boardwalk which was kind of a pain when we wanted to eat out and go shopping, but it's right on the beach which makes it nice because you can walk right from the hotel and the beach is right there. Overall the grand hotel was great and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a great location but is very filthy the lobby looks good but when you get into the rooms its disturbing.”
Reviews.Author: Rrsingh
Reviews.Content: Visited oc with my wife and daughter and the room didnt look clean bathroom had hair and stains in tub and sink. Sheet smelled and had hair we couldnt even unpack our luggages because the drawers we sticky and dirty. Its a good thing we walked with our own sheets towels and lots of disinfectant. I would recommend the owner spend some time and money on renovations because theres too much competition. Lets not forget the staff and their attitudes that makes you not want to go back and dont go to the coffee house they are extremely rude and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable”
Reviews.Author: goboroot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here maybe half a dozen times over the past several years. A great oceanfront stay that has only one problem...but I like it. They leave you have the run of the place. To all those who go to the ocean and want all the elements of being home, well, stay home. This is oceanfront. Subject to sand, moisture and screaming kids, and adults, having fun. Go chill.

Reviews.Title: “Mother Daughter Time”
Reviews.Author: Deb l
Reviews.Content: As my Mother's day gift my adult daughter and I decided to take a mini vacation and get away for a few days . It was great the hotel was exceptionally clean, front desk staff very helpful work out room very nice well maintained. If you go you have to visit the Spa the ladies there were so nice we really enjoyed chatting with them while being pampered they also recommended some great places to eat. Only problem we ran into was it was cruisers week we had a hard time finding a place to park late one eve. when we returned to the hotel and had to park way up in the parking garage(little scary) most spots were taken by cars and one beside by by a empty trailer that had hauled a classic car, they also took up all the front parking at the hotel leaving little room for guest who had arrived earlier in the week. :( next time we will check that out we enjoyed seeing the cars but the parking wasn't very good.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in OC!”
Reviews.Author: dkd_md
Reviews.Content: Over the years, we have stayed at numeous hotels when visiting Ocean City. Once we discovered the Grand Hotel, we don't even consider another location. The staff are very accommodating, clean rooms are in good repair, wireless Internet access is available, small stores on the boardwalk side offer a cafe, pizza shop and various small shops. When we visit during "Cruise-In" weekends, you can get a coffee and donut from the cafe and sit on the boardwalk in front of the hotel to watch the cruiser parade. We love it! The Grand Hotel's location close to the end of the boardwalk is perfect for us to walk to most of our favorite destinations. A parking garage offers plenty of parking space. Our only bad experience during the most recent trip was with the Terrace Restaurant; I don't know if it is managed by the hotel or an outside group but I wouldn't recommend going to the restaurant for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: greg r
Reviews.Content: Our association has been using the Grand for the past 4 years and we have had nothing but the best service. The staff are very friendly and caring, especially Robin, Nina, Anna and Erin. They made a point of going out of their way to accomodate our every needs. If there were any concerns, the staff immediately took care of them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mother's Day Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this hotel! It's on the quiet end of the boardwalk and an easy walk to all of the shops and activity on the busy end. We can throw the kids in the stroller without moving our car or dealing with carseats. Every room overlooks the ocean, so you are guaranteed a beautiful view. The rooms are attractive and updated. White comforters make it feel fresh and clean. This was our second Mother's Day weekend there and we hope to continue the tradition in the years to come. I have nothing but good to say about this hotel. Although I have not tried it, you can even order pizza and ice cream at good prices on the main floor. Beachfront shops are also convenient for when you left something at home.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Steve K
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at The Grand Hotel this past weekend and it couldn't have been better. Service was excellent, the room was very clean, the view was unbeatable, and the staff couldn't do enough for us. We will be staying there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Love S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Mothers Day weekend. The hotel is non smoking. Our room was good, GREEAAT VIEW of the beach! Great part of board walk as other end of board walk is waaay busier! Minute walk to beach! AHHH Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, but not a lost weekend!”
Reviews.Author: joeyc049
Reviews.Content: Just spent a volleyball weekend at the "Grand" with higher expectations than the place we stayed at last year. (Won't name the place). Very nice outside, but a somewhat hidden entrance. Upon check-in we were disappointed to receive the highest floor possible which was the 2nd floor. Way too high for us Not!!! Called earlier in the week with a higher floor request and was somewhat hopeful that our request would be granted. The disappointment regarding this manner was when I went to park the car and met with another person from our group and she told me that she was given a room on the 10th floor. So instead of pleading with the front desk about this, I just let it go because it was late and my wife and daughter were already settled in. The front desk/lobby area were nice but that is just a facade. Don't know how old the grand is, but it does need some "sprucing" up like carpeting in our "upper" 2nd floor. Why no carpets? The bed was harder than what I'm used to. Other than the sprucing up topic, I suppose it is a nice place to stay. Don't know if I would come back. Maybe after my review, maybe they'll entice is to give it another shot. BTW, was in room 212 and was there 5/11-5/13. Hope to hear bach from you guys soon. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpfull Staff”
Reviews.Author: mike c
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Grand 4 or 5 times a year over the past several years. Rooms clean and comfortable. Great location. Front desk friendly and helpfull especially Erin.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: JRA79
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at grand hotel. When I walked in I have no idea how she knew my name but Denise guessed who I was before I gave her my information. I felt like I mattered. Then she complimented my son on how cute he is which was sweet. Check in was fast and easy. Our room was bigger than I anticipated and clean. The next morning my son and I went out to grab breakfast and Erin was very helpful in directing us to locations we were interested in and again she said how cute my son is. These ladies went above and beyond each day, very professional and helpful. I will be staying here again. My only negative was that there was some construction happening below my room so that took away from some of my wanting to go on the balcony. However it will not change my mind on staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Finally - a heavenly massage right in a high-quality OC hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Candy M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand for our 30th anniversary last month and our experience could not have been better. For years, we have tried to include massages into our OC trips without success. When I saw the Romance Package (jacuzzi in the room, dinner voucher at choice of 4 restaurants and massages right in the hotel spa), we went for it. What a great deal!! Room was beautiful and squeaky clean. Staff was very courteous and helpful. They called our room approx. 2 hours after we checked in to ask if we had everything we needed. (That was a first for me!) The view from the room was stunning and you are right on the boardwalk. The spa staff was friendly & highly-skilled. The only negative for us was the fact that the restaurant is closed in the off-season. Overall, it was the weekend we have been trying to have for years. We have already booked our next trip for October.

Reviews.Title: “Fay-bu-lous Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maureen M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Grand Hotel this past weekend for Springfest and also to celebrate his birthday. We stay here often, several times a year, and once again had a fabulous experience. The hotel is so conveniently located, rooms are spacious and clean with fabulous views of the beach, great lobby area and coffee shop. The hotel staff is extremely friendly from the moment you call to make a reservation, during your stay, until the time you check out. The entire staff is always great to deal with, however, during this particular visit, Fay at the front desk went above and beyond to make our stay extra special. She was extremely friendly and accommodating. It was so nice to meet someone who really enjoys their job and does it well!!! When we checked out, Fay had a birthday card from the hotel and a piece of cake for my husband. Her kindness and thoughtfulness speaks volumes for the type of service you'll receive. The Grand is fortunate to have an employee as fantastic as she! You will enjoy staying here - and if you're lucky, Fay will greet you when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeding our expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Tim D
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff ( Front desk staff specifically) did a great job with accomadating us at the last minute on a weekend without even a reservation. Our room featured an ocean front view which was much more than we expected. This was a super overall stay and we plan on doing it again this Summer.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Jenbolee
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Ocean City for Springfest and this is my 2nd stay here at the Grand Hotel. Has a nice coffee/donut shop downstairs, bar/lounge, indoor and outdoor pool, smaller fitness area and it does have an arcade with a few games, 1 pinball machine and a pool table in which we couldn't find the pool sticks for but was ok. Clean place. Not 5 star top quality if thats what you must have but really not a bad place at all. Fresh towels, small fridge with coffee pot and counter area with sink in the rooms. Bathroom was clean. Nice and friendly staff behind the desk. Will definitely stay here again. Thanks for another nice trip!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place on the quiet end of the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: WalksSoftly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Grand almost every time we've gone to Ocean City (anywhere from 2-4 times a year for long weekends) for the past several years. Located at 21st and Boardwalk, the Grand is unusual for a beach hotel in its sheer size. It boasts a very large lobby and ground floor with several beach-type retail shops, a pizza place, and a 24 hour coffee shop. The lobby exits directly onto the Boardwalk, as well, which is extremely convenient. Only a few blocks from the north end of the Boardwalk, it's also quiet. The parties and crowds happen further south, but it's an easy walk to get there. The hotel is an ocean-facing semi-circle and all the rooms have balconies with ocean views, although the closer to the middle you are, the better. The rooms themselves are above-average for a beach hotel and feature microwaves and mini-fridges. The beds are comfortable and they give you plenty of pillows. The television is basic and does not feature any on-demand programming, which would be a nice addition. There's also no room service - again, not uncommon for these beach hotels in Ocean City. The only significant complaint I have about the rooms is that the sliding glass doors onto the balconies, while large enough to provide great views, are often covered by a salty film that results from condensation between the glass. There's no way to clean this, but it definitely detracts from the overall experience when you can't see the view you paid for without going outside. Some of the rooms are better than others and the last time we had a really bad one, they moved us without a problem. Otherwise, the only other complaint I've ever had there are that they frequently host large events in their ballroom and if you're actually staying on that floor, it can get noisy. Ice machines and soda/snack vending machines are on alternate floors, so you may have to take an elevator to get ice, but again, many smaller beach hotels may only have one ice machine in the lobby, so that's really not a big deal. If you're looking for a great place to stay on the Boardwalk, but not expecting a five star resort hotel, the Grand is excellent. It's definitely one of my top choices in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ladytee42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hotel April 20-22, 2012 for a Couples Retreat. The Hotel was very nice and the front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. We loved the view of the ocean, but it would be nice if they had a screen on the paito door. I just had one complaint, they really need to upgrade the beds!! We stayed in room 507 and we did not sleep well at all. The beds were very lumpy and I have back problems so it really made it worst. I hope one day they could upgrade their TV's to the flat TV and maybe have a DVD, that would really make it nice. I just wanted to say to the front dest clerk that suggested to me on Friday night about 9:30pm, we order from Pizza ToGO! IT WAS GREAT PIZZA AND HOT WINGS! It was at our door in 30 mins, really fast!! Overall it was a wonderful weekend spend at the Grand Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Don S
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Ocean City MD. My Fiance and I had a great weekend getaway at this hotel. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the boardwalk and the ocean this weekend the 21st -22nd of April. We fell asleep to the sound of the waves on a very comfortable bed. it was a great time. We even got up late, and this is an experience to remember. We played pool until the bar closed. I recommend this as a great place to stay in Ocean City, even at this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Tom F
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to the Grand Hotel for vacation in June of 2011 and we were so happy we got to stay on boardwalk beach side. But when we got our key and saw a 200 number we were disappointed that we were so close to the ground and din't get high up like we were hoping for. But we still had a great time there and the rooms were just awesome! Had a little kitchen and nice big king beds and lots of room with a walk out of your room pouch! We might give another stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Our grand trip to the Grand hotel =)”
Reviews.Author: JaysonsMommy
Reviews.Content: My fiance', son, and I decided to getaway to OC this past weekend, and wanted to try a hotel we haven't stayed in before. After checking the internet, I came across a great deal for a direct oceanfront room. We arrived Friday night to check in. Imagine my dismay when the front desk clerk informed me that my room was in fact NOT direct oceanfront, and they were completely booked and could not put me in such a room. However, before I could say anything, I was then told "I'm so sorry for this. Let me speak with my manager & see what we can do for you." Such FANTASTIC customer service!!!! I was told I could go up to the room, check out the view, and if I took it they would give me a 20% discount per night for my troubles. I must say again such WONDERFUL customer service!!! Both girls at check-in that night ROCK!!!! Our room (619) was just great for what we needed. The only "bumps" we ran into were: the water temperature in the shower (the water kept running way too hot), the game area (majority of the games kept eating our quarters ~ a HUGE dissapointment to our little one), and the indoor pool (really small for such a huge hotel; the water temperature the first day was too cold, 2nd was better... though it was the morning of check-out). The hotel has a 24 hour quick stop on-site where you can get a quickie breakfast or snack during the day, and a pizzeria (really yummy pizza), where we had lunch Saturday. I would've loved to use the spa amenities, but ran out of time. The location of the hotel is right on the beach, but away from all the hustle & bustle of the "main" boardwalk which is nice. As soon as we got home all my little guy kept saying was "(insert name) we stayed at a Grand Hotel! It was really cool! (HUGE smile on his face)" Music to this mommy's ears.......... We will be back =)

Reviews.Title: “Lacking Customer Service / Reservation system errors”
Reviews.Author: Tisha V
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand Hotel many times, in fact I was married on the beach there in 2008. On February 5th I booked an online reservation for 3 nights in July under a special promotion. On March 25 I received an email (Not even a phone call) stating that the reservation they accepted & charged my credit card 49 days earlier for, was being changed by $200.00! WHAT?!?!? When speaking to the "reservation manager" Nina four days later, after 3 phone calls & an email, I was told sorry that is the price & it didn't matter what I booked they weren't giving me that rate. What she could do is charge me the $200.00 more & give me a generous free upgrade..... Really? Free? I call it a $200.00 dollar upgrade and an injustice to consumers. How do you accept a 50% deposit & charge a credit card to decide your not giving the rate quoted because that wasn't supposed to be the rate? Sounds like issues in their system & not my fault! I should not be charged for their mistake! The Grand manager Patrick then called me patently dishonest for making very sad attempts to get the quoted rate. I was refunded my money so that they could say they offered every available option. This will cost the company thousands of dollars in return visits & I would beware just because it looks like your getting a deal doesn't mean you are! When I posted my original review, I was contacted by Patrick to tell me he was involving his legal department as a threat to take down my post. I removed the so called libelous content, but would like everyone to know this hotel does not offer customer service in any fashion. It has many terrible reviews on the internet for a reason and despite Patrick's belief that I am the only person in America not willing to pay an increased price because the law will not make him honor the original price given from his website directly, I am sure others value their hard earned money as well and deserve to know in advance the company they are dealing with before making binding decisions. I have had many pleasant stays in this hotel and truly feel it is a shame to have it ruined over a situation that could have been avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in OC”
Reviews.Author: Terry D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two kids stayed at the Grand for a quick family weekend in OC. The views of the ocean, boardwalk and bay were great (by the shape of the hotel it seems that all of the rooms would have a nice view). I also like the location, it is on the boardwalk so you can get to the pier easily but not too close to the craziness. Our room was clean and very spacious (ours had a nice counter/sink with fridge/etc and a large balcony). The front desk person was friendly and the kids enjoyed the arcade/indoor pool. It was in April so the outdoor pool was closed but it seemed like it would be nice place to hang out, there was a nice poolside bar. The rate was compettiive, everyone liked it, we will definately stay there next time we are in OC.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service??”
Reviews.Author: TopKat127
Reviews.Content: Had a block of rooms booked for my team for 3/30 to 4/1. Upon check in 6 rooms were together and 1 room was on a different floor. When we questioned how this could happen, front desk personnel told us they could see in the computer that our room had been given to someone else but couldn't tell us why and said there was nothing they could do about it! What happened to customer service?? I guess because I didn't complain long and loud enough it didn't matter to them. Some rooms were dirty, parents had to go out and BUY pillows because room didn't have any and the hotel said they had no more! Pool was dirty. Kitchenette had no utensils so heating and eating leftovers was not possible. Maid forgot a bottle of cleaning product in our bathroom. I was in room changing (literally caught with my pants down) when she just opened the door and walked in asking if she had left bottle there. I pointed it out and she took it and left. A little strange. Having never been to Ocean City in the summertime I want to go back to Ocean City this summer but the Grand is not even a hotel I would consider.

Reviews.Title: “Room to spread out!”
Reviews.Author: momoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hotel on 21st St on 3/29/2012. I had won a contest at the Grand and received a room upgrade as my gift, so when I booked the room, Matt Brown at the Grand gladly upgraded my room to direct oceanfront. I also had asked for a high floor and they again accomodated my request. When we checked in, we were greeted by Erin who was very sweet and competent, and she even called our room a short while later to see if we were satisfied and if there was anything we needed. Very few hotels do this any more, even the so called "upscale" hotels in OC. Our room was a 2 queen with efficiency kitchen, dining area, and bathroom. The room was very large, very clean and nicely kept up. The cabinets in the kitchen appeared to be new as well. My only issues were that the mattresses were a bit soft and had wells when we slept, and the bathroom was a bit smaller than we would have liked, but it was clean and satisfactory. The oceanfront balconies on all floors except the top three have open balconies so there is no privacy if that's important to you. I think the reason for this is to give everyone the best possible view considering that the hotel is basically a half circle. I didn't have the chance to try the spa or pools, but our stay was very nice and I would stay there again. Thank you Grand for such a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great spa!”
Reviews.Author: Julie M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the off season,but still plenty to do. Hotel was in a great location and the staff was very friendly. I would highly encourage a visit to the spa. We got massages from Karen and Sharon and they were excellent!! Definitely would come back....

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Wonderfulness!!”
Reviews.Author: dls1926
Reviews.Content: Another fabulous stay at the Grand. My 7 year old and our family y got to celebrate together at the wonderful indoor pool and gaming area ! Shuffle board, games, pool bean bag game, huge and really cool floor chess, just couldn't find better place to enjoy time together ! Thanks to the helpful friendly staff!!

Reviews.Title: “reservation”
Reviews.Author: cwetzel1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and i made reservations to stay at this hotel this past saturday night the 10 of march for our nightly getaway for our anniversary. and we was looking forward to it. However we got a call a few hours prior to out arrival and was told that we was not able to have the king spa suite we reserved due to the jacuzzi not working but they could have put us in a premier room with out a jacuzzi. so we had to find another hotel which cost us more money. i wasnt at all satisfied with how the lady dealt with this situation cause having found out that she wasnted to still charge us 89.99 for a premier room stating it was a discount which it wasnt at all. I was really dissapointed that our weekend had to be ruined and so was my anniversary as well. i dont think i will be making any reservations at this hotwl anytime soon unless it is a really good deal and they can make up for what happened...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in stay”
Reviews.Author: jrboct24
Reviews.Content: We stayed with this hotel for the first time this past Saturday 2/25/2012-2/26/2012 and was very disappointed. Upon checking into our room #206 there was an immediate problem with the television. The picture continually rolled and at times jumped. We immediately contacted the front desk and maintenance was sent to our room. Unfortunately after switching out two additional television sets, the problem remained the same. We were told that there was nothing else they could do and we were basically stuck with the picture the way it was. My husband is a light sleeper and wakes several times during the night and watches television so this was a big problem for us. On another note, this is not the quietest hotel room we every slept in. The walls were very thin and ever noise could be heard. We were not aware there was a cheerleading rally occurring during our stay and there were young individuals running up and down the hall to go to the pool or game room. This went on until after midnight. As far as we know, management did nothing to stop this because it continues through the evening. Lastly when I walked into the bathroom I noticed a half bottle of shampoo resting on a washcloth on the edge of the bathtub. This is not acceptable at all. The only plus to this hotel is the location and the courtesy of the front desk. The televisions should be replaced with flat screen sets. My husband and I travel frequently and were very disappointed in our stay, to say the least. The price of the room was a bit steep for this time of year in Ocean City, which we don’t mind paying, if the value is there also. In the future we will not be staying at this hotel as there are so many other nicer choices in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: 613GeoK
Reviews.Content: Booked a New Year's weekend package for my wife and me. We added a third night in advance. The room was great, on the 9th floor,oceanfront,spacious,very clean compared to a lot of hotels we have stayed at in OC.Convenient coffee shop downstairs. Couldn't get wifi. The first night at about 6:30 AM the fire alarms went off so we rushed out and down the stairs. Everyone was orderly and there seemed to be no fire but I noticed that until we got down to the lobby I didn't see a single employee of the hotel and down there I only noticed one woman at the desk on the phone. I'm not complaining about the alarm (happy they work) but wondering how many employees are actually on duty for safety and security purposes in a relatively large hotel. We told the housekeeper we didn't need our room cleaned that first morning. The second morning I was concerned about our reservation because when I reserved they insisted on doing two transactions because of the package we took. We had to recheck in and actually have our room key cards changed. Went to the brunch that was part of the package and returned in the afternoon to find that our room was not cleaned. Found the housekeeper later in the afternoon who apologized and said that she thought we had checked out. No tip for her. The package deal we received and the oceanfront room were a great value . No kudos for management in dealing with our reservation details and communication with and supervision of housekeeping. And some concern about safety considering that if there had been an actual fire and the seemingly large number of guests needed assistance and direction in evacuating who was there to provide it?

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: EaglesFanCharlestown
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 9th floor for a long weekend in January. The hotel was clean, the room was clean and we had a great view of the ocean. We loved the extra features of the hotel, like the Shipwreck Lounge, Ice Cream/Coffee Shop, pool and the other shops. Staying here is like staying at a mini all inclusive hotel. Ideas for improvements would be: It would have been nice to have a couch in our room so that we could sit and drink coffee while viewing the ocean (we had dbl queen beds and a small table with chairs. There is 1 other chair (at the desk) in the room. The room sleeps 4 but only has 3 chairs, so someone had to sit on the bed to eat, talk, relax, etc. Couch and cozy chair would have made it much nicer. Another suggestion would be to upgrade to a flat screen tv. Our tv was small and the picture is not as clear as HD. Also, it would have been nice to have some basic dishes, silverware and napkins in the kitchen area. When we went to get ice cream, almost all of the flavors were empty, so we really only had a choice of 3 flavors. Hand lotion would be a great plus in the ladies room! Also, the stores were not open during our stay. It was super nice having the parking garage!!! We enjoyed not having to worry about parking. We do plan on coming back, but would love to see some upgrades as this could really be a SUPER hotel. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “No services or WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Diana W
Reviews.Content: They advertise in-room WiFi but I could only use my laptop in the lobby. When I called the desk they said they would look into it. That was two days ago. Restaurants and lounge aren't open and there is NO satisfactory food on site. Spa was never open as advertised. I know it's off-season, but there are lots of people here. Staff also sneak into the closed jewelry store and out of the way hallways to smoke. Very unpleasant. The view is beautiful, but that's not worth the complete absence of amenities. House-keeping is the only group that was consistently competent and professional. Next time, I'm heading down the way to Marriott. My rate was very, very low...got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend at the Grand!”
Reviews.Author: PuffinEllis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a family beach weekend this summer. It will be our new home for trips to OCMD. The hotel is located on the boardwalk but, unlike other hotels closer to the attractions, it's not like playing a game of Frogger to cross to the beach. It was within easy walking distance to everything we needed - restaurants, snacks, miniature golf - and a very doable walk down to the end of the boardwalk. A bonus is that it's the only round hotel so it's easy to spot when walking the beach or boards. Our room was clean and spacious with a great ocean view. There's no privacy between balconies on the lower floors so sitting outside can be awkward. The upper floors appeared to have screens to remedy that. The 2nd floor rooftop pool was fantastic with a full bar and towel service. We were there several times each day for a dip. See you next summer, Grand Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “New Years Day 2012”
Reviews.Author: loverat
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here, New Years Day to Tuesday. The hotel is beautifully decorated and clean, check in was very easy and parking was convenient to hotel. We had a double-queen room on the 8th floor with a beautiful ocean view. Our room was spacious and very clean. The only negative we had was that while the hotel was virtually empty, we were sandwiched between two very, very loud rooms. To our right were the 'door slammers' and to our left were the 'clueless family.' The door slammers were just annoying for a little while, but clueless was annoying for hours. The first night we arrived, they came home after we did and proceeded to yell and scream at their already screaming bratty child. A screaming child is bad enough, but two out-of-control parents were too much. After about an hour though, they all calmed down and it was peaceful. The next morning, at 6:30 AM, the screaming began again, this time 10x worse than the night before. After about an hour and a half of this, I called the front desk to complain. I asked if the screamers were checking out (we had one more night here) and if not we wished to be moved. A very friendly front desk clerk assured me that they were leaving and said she would call them. Unfortunately, I heard the phone ring next door after the screamers had left, but at least they tried. The only other downside was that there was boardwalk construction going on and that was a bit loud and disruptive. Overall, our stay at the Grand was great for the money, but with the paper-thin walls, I don't think we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the beach in the winter, too!”
Reviews.Author: hillsfolly
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Grand Hotel several times. I love staying here because of the day spa conveniently located in the lobby. Each visit I stayed in the king/jacuzzi tub room - oceanfront, of course. I love going downstairs and getting a massage by Karen. She is GREAT! She remembers me each visit and welcomes me with a warm smile. I have been all over town getting massages and she is the BEST! I highly recommend a stay here and a visit to the salon/day spa!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for the money, on the beach and the boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: ZivB80
Reviews.Content: I was gobsmacked by the value this hotel gives for a traveler in the off season. They staff down a bit, and OC isn't as packed as during the season, but October and November are beautiful months at the beach with the water staying warm til late. December it gets a bit chilly, but the beach is if anything even more beautiful and the pubs and cafes frequently have special that are worth searching for. The prime rib competition between the pubs and the cafes is something that is worth checking out, since most of them are under $10 one night of the week. Anyway, the Grand is a large highrise hotel on the top of the boardwalk, which is being gutted and replaced in December of 2011. The staff is attentive and fun, albeit thin on the ground in December. The eating options are limited, but almost all the rooms have some sort of ocean view. The hotel is shaped like the letter C, with the open part facing back to Coastal Highway. There are 25 rooms on each floor, with the 13 tier having the most direct view of the beach, and the 01 and 25 tiers having the worst, look to the side and you can see some waves, sort of view. BUT, I stayed in the 06 tier and it was a rather good ocean view, good enough to spot a pod of dolphins and to enjoy the ocean sunrises. So anything from 06 to 20 is good, but the ones between 08 and 18 have phenomenal ocean views.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: banderson220
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel has always been my favorite hotel in Ocean City. It's right on the boardwalk and near everything. I went in November alone and still had a great time. (Me Time). The spa is right in the hotel and the massage I had was just what the doctor order. You really didn't have to venture out if you didn't want to. Everything you need is in the hotel. (Spa. restaurant, lounge, indoor pool & game room along with an excerise room.) You even can do minor shopping without going outside. The rooms and views are great!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: dls1926
Reviews.Content: Once again another fab weekend here !! The storm came through and was wonderful to see from the amazing view point of the 8th floor. And the next day glorious sunshine, blue skys and sea !! Just breath taking. Service was impeccable as always !! The kids had such fun at the pool !! And they were tuckered out after so weactually got some rest ;) Thanks to the Grand Family !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: roxi06
Reviews.Content: Went for a quick weekend away. Spent a few extra dollars for the signature room. Great view of the ocean and the room was very clean. The upgrade included different linens and blanket which were very comfortable. The store downstairs in the lobby had good coffee, but the lines in the morning were pretty long and moved slowly. The pizza restaurant was average at best. There is a small game room but you have to sign the equipment out for the shuffle board, pool table, and bean bag toss at the front desk then bring it to and from the game room which is on a different floor, kind of a hassle, and not worth the effort. There is a nice pool with outdoor bar, but being the offseason and a little cool it was open but not appropriate. The staff is very friendly, I called about the TV not working properly and someone was at my door in minutes, had a new one in the room within an hour of my call, so I would say the service was excellent. The location can't be beat, it's right on the Ocean City Boardwalk with plenty of places to eat, shop, and the beach feet away. My wife and I really liked Fish Tales, walk right down the street to the bayside marina, great food and atmosphere. All in all I would say the the friendly and efficient staff, clean rooms, and location (right on the Ocean City Boardwalk) make this one of the better places to stay in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 'N Easy”
Reviews.Author: dcoldsmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a quick girls weekend at the Grand. It had all the amenities you could ask for, shopping, coffee shop, spa, bar/lounge, pizza, work out room, indoor and outdoor pool. It was also conveniently located on the boardwalk. Not the most luxurious place but clean, comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Escape Package”
Reviews.Author: angelflygirl
Reviews.Content: I really loved "The Grand"! My boyfriend and I got the Weekend Escape Package and had a wonderful time. We didn't like the location of the room because it was on the outter side of the building so we asked from another room with a better view. Kyle had no problem accommodating us within our package's terms. The room was clean, beds were very comfortable and the price was well worth it. Arlene was also very helpful. The bartender was very sweet and personable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nikkifreebird
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand (room 1114) for one night on Sep. 24th during Sunfest. It was our first time in OC in about 10 years and this was the only place allowing me to make a one night reservation during this event. Other hotels wanted 2-3 nights. Check-in was supposed to be 4:00, but we arrived about 1:00, and was told our room was ready. By the way, the young ladies at the front desk were courteous and friendly. Our son and his girlfriend were with us--they had reservations elsewhere, which they much regretted later on,--so they went with us up to our room. We had a Signature direct oceanfront room on the 11th floor, and upon entering, we were all impressed with the large area, beautifully made beds, and WONDERFUL view from our balcony! The metal dividers on the balcony between the rooms also had a section of lattice on the lower half that made it feel a little more private, although you could still see through it. Everything was clean--although I do think the bathtub was not freshly cleaned because the tub and faucet looked dull instead of shiny like a just-cleaned tub should look. Apart from that, everything else in the room and bathroom were fine; there were no odd smells like I've read about in some reviews. Two bottles of water were on the table, but no robes like I read were supposed to be included, although that didn't matter to us. There were a couple of coffee cups available for the coffee pot, as well as some styrofoam cups in the cubboard, but no other dishes of any sort . Small bottles of toiletries, including mouthwash, were in the bathroom, too. I've also read complaints about the "loudness" of the AC; yes, you can hear it cycle on and off, but it was nothing to keep you awake at night, that's for sure. I don't understand why some people are just so picky about small things like that! Our only regret was that the weather was very cloudy and even foggy at times, so our view from our balcony was not as clear out over the ocean as it would have been otherwise. To sum it all up, the whole hotel was very clean and attractive, as well as our room. It was very quiet, so we had a peaceful night's sleep. We are hoping to return for another weekend next month, and we will request another Signature room for sure. Our son and his girlfriend did not fare nearly as well where they stayed outside of OC. They want to stay at this hotel on their next visit, too. We really enjoyed our stay at the Grand, and will definitely return. We will tell our friends about it, as well. I gave "sleep quality" a 3 because the beds were quite firm, and I'm used to a softer mattress, which I prefer for myself, so this is just my personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Lots of Work”
Reviews.Author: LocusPointBaltimore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when it was new a few years ago and it was OK. I just checked out after and I must tell you that this hotel is in need of a major overhaul. The beds were in bad shape, the carpet did not adhere to the floor, and the bathroom was horrible. There are several better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “worst experiment ever!”
Reviews.Author: ki1983
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were checked in on sat of Sep 24 2011.As Soon as I try to check in, they didnt even had my reservation untill I show my paper comfirmation. Front desk guest service were horrible, well They don’t even say word “sorry”! it’s not that hard to say it word sorry Also, AC sound like having a big problem~ B/c I thought it was airplane engine was turned on, I could't even sleep well...personally, it was my first time staying in OC with Grand hotel, but it will be my last time...BTW... I will say one good thing is Ocean View...

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Time”
Reviews.Author: IgotBeads
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week and was treated like a king. Staff was friendly and the location was excellent, close to all the main attractions within walking distance. Rooms were clean and the ocean view was remarkable. I will definately come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: gma6times
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Hotel in mid-September. It is in the perfect location. It's at the quiet end of the boardwalk at 21st street. (The busy end of the boardwalk is the lower-numbered streets.) We were still able to enjoy a nice walk on the boardwalk without all of the commotion. Although, in September, there are mostly just adults and families with small children there. The hotel is large and we had a very nice ocean view room, complete with a balcony. It was very clean and equipped with a microwave and refrigerator. Beds were very comfortable. There is also an indoor and outdoor pool, fitness center, coffee shop, and some shops right outside of the lower entrance (pizza place, ice cream, boutiques.) It is also within walking distance to some of Ocean City's most popular restaurants. We liked being right on the beach; didn't want to have to cross any highways. Staff was very helpful and courteous. No complaints about this place at all. We'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “worst stay in OC Md!”
Reviews.Author: guest038
Reviews.Content: Had many issues with the property and staff! Door key not working properly,had batteries replaced after they said we had additional guests in room with dead bolt locked. Next morning door lock was messed up again! Services that they told us about when making reservation not available at time of stay.The restaurant only served breakfast and it was buffet style. We planned on eating all meals on site.The room carpet was damp to the feet,bottoms of feet left dirty with no shoes on.Had to close balcony door many times due to smokers on their balconies smoking when it is a smoke free property!Balcony door was like opening a cement door.Lots of drag,dirt in track. Not to mention you cant look thru the door the galss for so much crap in between the door galss.Mattresses worn out from prior guests sitting on sides of beds.Made very hard to get a good nights rest.I tried to hold my tongue,when we had the door fixed on the first morning the maint. man said it's not their fault.Then the security guy the next morning said the same.When we checked out I showed my anger and got basicaly the same not their fault!I know for sure it was not my fault,and we will never go back!OC was fine the hotel was a big downer!

Reviews.Title: “Okay but if you are paying more than off season prices it is not worth it just for the view.”
Reviews.Author: Grayhare
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the room was okay but nothing specail. the indoor pool was small. The lobby is plain and seemed empty. The View from the 10th floor was spectacular as we were near the middle of the hotel. I would give this place an average rating. Worth it if you get a deal if not there are others that are a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “It Has Some Perks”
Reviews.Author: sandyg47
