Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "Direct Ocean Front" on the 7th floor. The view was the boardwalk going North and the beach. We arrived at Monday, Labor Day about 3pm. They said our room was not ready and would call us when it was. The regualr time for check in is 4pm. We decided to take a walk down the boards. Received a call about 4:10pm and checked in. When we opened the door it was an oder like bad feet. The room was tidy and clean but the carpet was all lumpy. We're not sure where the oder was coming from but I thought it had to be the carpet. The room was large and had a balcony that is not private. So, when I went out to read there was someone else out on their balcony. The bathroom was small but clean. They had toiletries if needed. They had a restaurant for breakfast and lunch. We ate breakfast and it was good. The 24 hour coffee cafe has donuts and all kinds of bakery goods and will make breakfast and lunch sandwhiches any time of the day or night. Their coffee wasn't Starbucks or Ducan Donuts but was drinkable. Philips Seafood restaurant was across the street and liquor store and Dairy Queen also. They have a nice beach. They have a safe, and micro kitchen also. We asked for a late check out and there was no problem. I would stay there again but I hope they freshen the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Some reviews and suggestions”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen W
Reviews.Content: We just returned today from a 6 night stay at The Grand. We had a very pleasant vacation and were glad that the weather wasn't what it was forecast to be. 1) The bathroom was really small. They could use a foot or 2 from the safe/closet area to expand the bathroom, or a corner sink with shelves for your toiletries would help. It's very hard to give a child a bath with that door. Even a pocket door, or the door opening the opposite way would help. There was a fan vent, but it didn't seem hooked up. 2) Internet access STUNK! This was really disappointing, as I had to check in with work and had a very hard time doing so. I was told it was because we were on 11, but I've stayed at the Holiday Inn Suites 3 blocks down on a high floor and their access was great. 3) They could use a higher chest of drawers. All our clothes didn't fit in the 6 they had. 4) The desk and other furniture is old/outdated. The room was certainly big enough for a 1 1/2 chair by the balcony window, or a small loveseat. The eating table could be larger. They should have 3 chairs on the balcony and a small table. 5) TVs were very disappointing. While the stations they had were ample, flat screens are very cheap now, and they could use some. Even if in the signature rooms. I paid for a signature room, but didn't get a robe. 6) The soda machines on each floor were nice, but I put my money in for diet coke and got reg coke out twice. The refrigerator in the room froze and exploded 4 cans that I brought, even after we turned it down. 7) There was an emergency evac at 11pm ish on Sat night. My daughter is disabled and autistic and had a very difficult time with the sound and flashing lights going down 11 stories on the steps. They should have policy in place for disabled people and contact them only if it's an emergency to evacuate. I saw 2 older people with walkers/oxygen and couldn't believe they had to go down all those steps. I felt worse for them than us. Overall, I was happy with the room, the view was fantastic....but there could be things done to make the stay better....how about a USA today at the door in the am?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ~ We Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: golden1212
Reviews.Content: This is a great oceanfront hotel. Location is perfect. Staff is very nice and helpful. Rooms are clean and roomy. Everything you could possibly need is right there. I booked 2 rooms for 5 days. No complaints. This was my second stay at this hotel and I will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: rufus4926
Reviews.Content: Check in on Saturday, left on Monday - questioned the fee for the room, I was charged $309.00 per night, and the room beside me was charged $ 75.00 per night. I questioned front desk staff, was told manager did not come in until 10 am, so I asked for contact information, was then told to see the manger in the office to my right ( what the heck?) He was very cold and non caring and might as well have said "you were ripped off"..... and now it's too late for any explanation. When I told him I would never stay here again, he made no comment, so obviously he could have cared less. The room odor was horrible, good thing I brought the Lysol can, the hallway was very noisy at night, random knocking on the door, etc. the fitness area was a joke, the outdoor pool was full of loud and obnoxious people getting intoxicated, and the indoor pool was full of sand, dirty and no venting. The staff did not speak or understand English very much, best advice - stay away from here, not worth it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Grand”
Reviews.Author: Thorster01
Reviews.Content: We came after Irene had blown in and out. We were on the 3rd floor...always ask for a higher room, because we had a view of the roof above the shops. The bathroom had no fan and the ceiling tile above the lights were melting, which could have led to a fire. The coffee pot was a 12 cup one, with 4 cup coffee given...weird and made for very weak coffee the first morning. The doors going out to the patio were very cloudy, so the only way to see the ocean was to keep the doors open...but there was no screen. A bird decided to hop in one day....fortunately, we chased him out before he started flying around. The cleaning service was not good...the bathroom sink was never wiped...the soap ring was there from day 1. Small kitchenette, but nice. Needs a toaster. The folks were all nice, but AAA said that they give a discount, which they would not honor until October......REALLY? Parking garage has lots of room, but someone opened their door onto mine and left a big white dent on my car door, which I did not notice until I left. Coffee shop had great coffee and open 24 hours. Fitness room was worthless, the treadmills were broken and only a few other machines.

Reviews.Title: “IF IT WEREN'T FOR IRENE”
Reviews.Author: LISA D
Reviews.Content: This would have been a perfect vacation. Unfortunately, our vacation was cut short ( checked in on Wednesday and had to leave by 9:00 PM on Thursday), because of the hurricane that was due to hit on Saturday. My family fell in love with the hotel and the staff. The room was perfect and very, very clean. Needless to say we were very disappointed that we had to leave so soon. Knowing that this was the one and only shot at a mini vacation this year and having it ruined by mother nature was heartbreaking. I know where I am going to stay next year---The Grand Hotel

Reviews.Title: “What More Could You Ask For - It's Grand”
Reviews.Author: loriweitz6
Reviews.Content: Once again The Grand was perfect!!! Year after year we go to Ocean City and year after year we are never disappointed. This year the Grand added a new feature to the outdoor pool - full chair covers (which I might add are extremely comfortable). Along with the pool staff, every person (Management, Front Desk, Housekeeping, etc.) you come in contact with goes above and beyond to make your stay a memorable one. Management and staff are always available to answer any questions or concerns you may have. There is no other place I would stay!!!!! THANK YOU GRAND - YOU REALLY ARE GRAND!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Rooms Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: al b b
Reviews.Content: We were not happy with our small but clean hotel room at a different location in Ocean City. This hotel had a room available so we wanted to check the room first before we switched and my husband checked the bed. Pulled off the sheets to find BED BUGS. We were Mortified. This hotel LOOKS very clean. The room looked very clean but bed bugs i was so disgusted we all ran out of that room so fast. I was Hysterical We did not want to start a panic at the front desk so i called the hotel to let them know . Bed Bugs in room # 826 This is an out rage for $259 per night. I cant Believe that Hotels do not check for this Problem. This Hotel Needs to Be Shut Down . SO GROSS.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean , Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hurricane74
Reviews.Content: We came to Ocean City to celebrate our sons 4th birthday. We are true beach lovers and have stayed at many places in OC. Our main concern was clean, comfortable place to stay that is close to the beach. The hotel was very clean, beds were pretty comfortable, and the view was so so.The rooms are huge but bathrooms very small. We had a grandview room (sort of on the side) but it is not private from your neighbors at all. Probably the only complaint was the elavators. There were only 2 of the 4 working so it made for alot of rude behavior because everyone wanted to go and they werent willing to compromise. Typical! Overall a very nice trip. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “"See ya next year!"”
Reviews.Author: mimiv39
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Grand Hotel, OC MD from 08/19/2011 to 08/22/2011. This hotel, although some reviews were unfavorable, was wonderful! The view from our 6th floor room was of both the ocean and the bayside. Beautiful! The staff was friendly, the room was clean and the ammenities left nothing to be desired. Both indoor and outdoor pool, game room, spa, and the beach was steps away! You could access every store and restaurant from the inside of the hotel so the one night it rained for a while was no problem. Our balcony was large and morning coffee, listening to the waves was very relaxing. Being right on the boardwalk in OC made our stay perfect. The lobby was large- no crowds to be avoided. For those who have had complaints, I think that you should consider the value of a place that puts you in the heart of everything and offers a great nights rest in rooms that are comfortable and clean. We walked around and looked at other hotels to see up close what we had seen online....we were glad we chose the Grand Hotel. No loud parties and very family friendly if traveling with kids. We will definately stay at The Grand again and hope to return with family next year. Thanks to everyone at The Grand for a weekend getaway worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barnone80
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel (also called the Stowaway Grand Hotel) is a fantastic hotel by Ocean City standards. It is right on the Boardwalk and the beach. Every room is ocean front or view and has a beautiful view of the beach and boardwalk. There are beach shops and a pizza place and ice cream parlor on the ground floor which are accessible from the hotel or the boardwalk. The hotel also has a bay view restaurant which has a nice breakfast. There are inexpensive places to eat and attractions very close by and within walking distance. There is also a motor trolley service which will take you along the boardwalk for a reasonable price. The pool and pool bar have a good view of the bay and the town. The rooms are spacious and clean. Every room has a huge balcony. There is always someone vacuuming the common areas so there is no sand all over the floors. The personnel is friendly and accommodating. They even called our room half way through our trip to make sure we were enjoying ourselves and to ask if there was anything they could do for us!! My daughter accidentally left her digital camera when we checked out which housekeeping recovered and sent back to us. Honest and efficient! Ocean City is not a luxury destination, but it is a nice place for a beach getaway. The Grand Hotel is one of the nicest accommodations you will find in Ocean City (and I have been to many.) This is our second year staying there and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, appears nice but not entirely impressed.”
Reviews.Author: bgarner68
Reviews.Content: We stayed this past week and I was a little disappointed in the hotel. I've been to Ocean City many times and have stayed at the Rodeway Oceanfront, Quality Inn Boardwalk and the Dunes Manor Hotel. I have always thought the Grand looked so nice so I decided to book it for a friend weekend getaway. I was disapponted in a few things - the ice machines are every other floor and we had to go to 5 different floors before we could fill our very small cooler to take onto the beach, the air conditioning kicked off and on which kept us awake, there is no ventilation in the bathroom such as a fan to remove steam after a shower - which I would think that would cause alot of mold in their walls but who knows...there was constant noise from people opening and closing their sliding glass doors above or beside us, noise from people closing hallway doors, people being loud on the patios - the patios are not private from on another, the elevators didn't work so well and you had to wait forever. I dealt with a person at the front desk who was very nice the first day and the rest of the time the staff wasn't so nice. For what we paid here, I was a little disappointed. Overall it was OK but I think that it looked so much better than what I experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Grand continues to be great!”
Reviews.Author: KMate
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand for two years in a row. The service continues to be excellent! We called for extra towels a few times during our stay; they were delivered promptly with a follow up call from the front desk to ensure we received our towels. We stayed on the third floor this time in an ocean front room. The view was great, although you could not see as far down the beach as from a higher floor - we were there to see the ocean anyway, so this was not a bad thing. There were signs requesting only handicapped and oversize vehicles use the parking lot in front of the hotel, and the lot was usually full of oversize vehicles. (We have a minivan which was no problem to park in the ramp garage - there were always spaces available.) Very conveniently, there is a pizza/sub/burger shop located in the hotel and a 24 hour Java Cafe which offers panninis, fruit, yogurt, desserts and toiletries in addition the coffee. The rooms are large and clean, and the location is great. Our only complaint was that we could hear a man hollering at the top of his voice at 7 AM "Owen, when are you going to get out of bed?!!" This, however, is not the hotel's fault; we just happened to be in a room next to an insensitive loudmouth! Overall, we continue to love the Grand and will return next summer!

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Margie31167
Reviews.Content: 21st Street, front of hotel right on boardwalk, ocean can be pretty much seen by all rooms. Hotel does need updating but not a bad stay. We needed more towels called downstair within minutes had more towels, same with a heavy blanket that night within minutes we had one. Hotel has coffee shop open 24 in lobby. Outside pool & pool bar, indoor pool. Six floor has a restuarant serves breakfast very reasonable. Big parking garage. Lobby has plenty sitting area and sitting area outside. Would stay again. The only problem with this entire trip was all the broadwalk stores had many people working from other countries and it was difficult to understand them, and you had a hard time understanding them. These stores should have at least one american person working in their stores or at least people who understand and you can understand them. All in all great them would go again and stay at The Grands.

Reviews.Title: “double book rooms, take forever to clean, DON'T GO HERE.”
Reviews.Author: jessicahandy
Reviews.Content: the service blew. i went with my family for my birthday and not only did we have to wait to be sent to our room, but once we got up there the cleaning people JUST started cleaning it. when they finished we had to wait another ten minutes for "billy" to come inspect it. PLUS they gave our room to another family, luckily we ran into each right before they were going into our room. the hotel looks nice & the rooms are fine, but i would never go again.

Reviews.Title: “COULD NOT HAVE BEEN ANY BETTER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robin H
Reviews.Content: I traveled to The Grand Hotel recently with my family and was more than satisfied with my stay. Everything....the entrance, the lobby, the staff, the pools, the on-site spa, the shops,the comfort of the rooms, the restaurant/bar ..... everything was amazing. Every person we encountered delivered exceptional service - the type of service that sets The Grand Hotel aside from any other hotel in Ocean City...the type of service that will keep us coming back for years to come, as well as everyone else we tell! This hotel is Top Notch.... Do not look any further.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Proudmams
Reviews.Content: We decided last minute to go to Ocean City for a last minute vacation. Once there, many of the hotels were booked so we decided to give Grand Hotel a shot. Right from the get go they treated us very well..even giving my husband the opportunity to check the room out before we checked in. Stayed on the bay side...great view. Nice being directly on the beach especially with a young child. The front desk employees were always very friendly!! My only complaint was the wifi did not work in our room but no big deal as there was so many other things to do. Will come back again in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: IndyTourist068
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, but unfortunately that's the only thing good I can say about it. We paid for a "side view," and were disappointed to learn that beyond our balcony rail, was the roof, which had yet another fence (barrier) around it, so our view was quite distant and obstructed. When I asked the woman at the front desk why I had to pay the same for a side view that was obstructed as someone in the same room on the 10th floor who, her responde was, "We only have 7 floors." Then, she proceeded to tell me that it's "First come, first served." So, I would advise that you specifically ask for a high floor when making your reservation. Also, on day one, we had coffee but no cups in our room, so I had to go on a search for a housekeeper Saturday morning before I could have cup of coffee to drink our our balcony with the view of two fences. Then, the next day, there were plenty of cups, but no coffee. This isn't what I expected for $320 a night. I have had MUCH better rooms, views, and service in much less expensive hotels. I will say they let me check out at 1:30 after I complained, but it took a lot of fast talking to get the late check out!

Reviews.Title: “Still A Good Hotel But Other Guests Can Be An Issue........”
Reviews.Author: keyser777
Reviews.Content: I last stayed at The Grand in Aug of 2009. The last time I stayed, I booked an ocean front room. I like to look out of the balcony and people watch or listen to the waves crash at night. This time around I booked my vacation late and there weren't any ocean front rooms available. We had an ocean view room which you can still see the ocean and the boardwalk from. Everything was pretty much the same as last time. The rooms clean, the staff is friendly, the pool is a little on the smaller side but the outside pool bar is fantastic. The one issue I had was some of the other guest. On both sides of our room we had loud quest. They came in at night at very early hours, obviously drunk and rowdy. Two doors down, a guest had passed out drunk in his chair on the balcony. The ocean front rooms are only about $10 more a night and I would of gladly spent the extra money to not have to deal with that nonsense. My assumption is that a better class of people would stay at the ocean front rooms. Its not something that the hotel can really control (who stays there) and it was just a minor annoyance. Not something I would hold against the hotel itself. Its still a pretty good hotel situated right on the boardwalk, great location, fairly clean rooms, friendly staff and awesome pool bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Gary G
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice. Staff were very accommodating. Check-in process was exceptional. Clean room with excellent cleaning staff/service. View of Ocean & Bay from Grand Room was very nice. Outdoor pool & pool bar were nice. Parking was sufficient & safe. Overall great experience! 2 upgrades to Balcony would make things even better: Get better chairs to sit on; have better privacy between rooms (eliminate the metal posts with solid barriers which would provide better privacy & safety).

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: superzuber
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and comfortable, however the bathroom was very small. The views were great. Plenty of parking in garage. There is no privacy on the balcony because there is only metal bars between them.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Grand for saving our Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Clark244
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say Thank you to The Grand and Christina at the front desk. We booked at another hotel and it was awful but when we went to the Grand we were able to save our week vacation. Christina at the front desk was so helpful and friendly. We will definitely be back. The room was nice, clean and spacious. The view was beautiful it was great to see the bay and the ocean. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it...can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Mayzee61
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Grand last week. Best customer service we have ever had, !everyone from front desk to house keeping.staff. We did not have a ocean front room but we had a great view of both the ocean and the bay. The parking garage was great was nice to go out and be able to come back and not have to fight for parking. I have been telling everyone to check this place out.....WE WILL BE BACK

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: 1982nova05
Reviews.Content: My husband, two kids (ages 9 and 11) and Iarrived at this hotel last minute without a reservation at 7am on a Friday morning. We were very fortunate to find this place during the weekend of the Dew Tour. The lady at the front desk was very kind and there were plenty of staff available to help with people checking in and out. The lady helping us provided us with a reservation for that day (checkin at 4pm) but allowed us to checkin at 7am so my husband and I could get some rest since we had been driving all night. The room was very clean! Spacious bathroom and plenty of clean towels for all of us. We did not have an ocean view room, but with the way the hotel is designed we could still see the ocean from our room. There was a refrigerator in the room along with a coffee maker and a variety of coffee packets and vending machines on each floor. The kids loved the arcade and the indoor and outdoor pool. The staff at the pool was excellent providing us with towels so we did not have to take our beach towels from the beach to the pool and treck all the sand back to the pool with us - which we thought was great! We would def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveEurope411
Reviews.Content: Right on the boardwalk. Easy access to the sand and surf. Large clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of our stay and will book it again next year!”
Reviews.Author: DianeD123123
Reviews.Content: Just got home from staying at the Grand Hotel in O.C. and can't wait to go back! The staff from front desk to maids to pool attendants to GM-Patrick were awesome. The rooms are very spacious and the kitchenette was perfect. The view from the room was beautiful even though we didn't have a "direct view" room. We lost our car keys on the second day there and General Manager Patrick went above and beyond to get us a replacement key from a dealership 30 minutes away. I highly recommend staying here and if I could I would give them 6 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: jblifeguard
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year in a row that I stayed at the Grand Hotel for The Mid-Atlantic Regional Lifeguard Tournament. For the 2nd year in a row they were welcoming and helpful. It's never easy to deal with a large group of lifeguards, but the Grand does it with class. The rooms are large, the beds comfortable, the towels plentiful, and the air conditioning cold. They don't question why we need an extra set of blankets and a pillow (hey, we're lifeguards, we don't make a lot of money!). The staff is friendly, helpful, and always smiling. I think every room has a balcony with an ocean view (which could be part of the reason everyone there is so happy). The hotel is perfectly positioned too. The boardwalk, shops, restaurants, easy access to the bus (which is a dollar - how amazing is that???). So, why 4 stars instead of 5? Well, like every beach front hotel it's probably impossible to keep up with the maintenance. Everything is a tad downtrodden, and there was sand all over the floor in our bedroom when we got there, the screen door was a little hard to open, the color on the walls a little faded. But hey, what do you expect? IT'S THE BEACH!!!! Thank you to the Grand. See you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great this time.”
Reviews.Author: ElleKo
Reviews.Content: I've been going to this hotel since I was 10, 40 years ago..... and it was called The Stowaway . I've always loved the location. The rooms are nice and the views are great. My only real complaint this time was that I couldn't sleep. There were 2 reasons for this. One was that there was a dip in the bed that was uncomfortable. The other was that every time I did doze off, the air conditioning system kicked in with a boooooommmmmmmoooooooshhhhhhhhhhh.......and jerked me awake! I could only handle that one night and left. When I checked out, no one even asked me how everything was. Plus when I checked in, they told me they would call me when my room was ready. We hung out at the pool and waited 3 hours. When I went back to the desk, they said they tried to call me, but hey......I didn't even have 1 missed call! So much for customer service. lol

Reviews.Title: “Avg hotel; Great view & location”
Reviews.Author: TeamRoberts2011
Reviews.Content: Rolled into town the morning of 7/16 and The Grand gave us a room for $330 (including tax); 11th floor (room 1107 to be exact) with 2 queen beds and great parking. We arrived about 10am and our room was ready by 11:30am Room 1107 offered great oceanfront views AND we could see the bay. Room was clean but outdated. Carpet wasnt well layed but it was clean (& burgandy, but what'chu gon do?), bathroom was clean. Bed was very comfortable! Room had small frig, sink, and microwave but no plates/utensils. Vending was down the hall. Balcony was large and again view was fantastic!! Breakfast was also great--the S1 (2 pancakes,1egg, ur choice of meet w/ oj is about $7) is better than the Holiday Inn. Staff was very friendly. Hotel opens up to great spot right on the boardwalk w/pizza, coffee, beach gear shoppes right there! Perfect! Again, not as plush as the Holiday Inn or Comfort Inn, but what they lack in fancy, updated trimmings is made up in a fantastic view, great balcony, and great location on the beach. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel but it really needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: AnnMaryland
Reviews.Content: Every July my family and I go to Ocean City and stay at the Grand Hotel. We love the location, the spacious rooms and the ocean front balconies. We have been staying at the Grand since the early 2000s. The rooms have had some updates like new sliding glass doors which are much quieter than the older ones. However, the furniture is really getting in bad shape, new tvs are needed as well as new mattresses and carpeting. It is sad to say but the Grand is sliding out of its "Grand" description. The rooms were fairly clean. It would be nice if the cleaning staff would vacuum next to the walls. Since the carpet is burgundy, the build up of sand next to the wall is really noticeable. I would love to know where to buy one of the white seersucker coverlets that cover the beds - Very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Many great stays for almost 10 years!”
Reviews.Author: mal
Reviews.Content: I'm pleased to finally get a chance to write a review for the Grand, as we've had *many* great stays there starting back in 2002. The staff is always friendly, courteous, and goes out of their way to make your stay pleasant--in fact, on our most recent trip I mentioned it was our anniversary and the next thing you know we ended up with a cabana out at the pool! The rooms are always clean, the bathroom is always stocked with pretty decent toiletries, and the views from the balconies are awesome! TV's could use a bit of an upgrade, but hey, you're not there to watch TV! Overall, I would highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 DIAMONDS with 4 STARS AMENITIES”
Reviews.Author: tantam0unt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated ON the boardwalk between 21st & North Baltimore Ave, near the Phillip's Seafood. The hotels does have shops/cafe/eateries in front of the boardwalk, but the heavy foot traffics does't start until after like 9th street. You can access the FREE beach right in front of the hotel and the hotel does offer places to rinse the sands off. Greg from the front desk helped us enjoyed our stay! He accommodated our early check in request and kept his words and followed up when the room was available. Room #407- 2 Queen Beds, Non-Smoking, Microwave, Mini Frig, Sink, Cabinets, Tube TV, Computer Desk, Dining Table for 2, Coffee Maker,Safe, Iron/Ironing Board, Closet, Standard size bath tub, Big balcony The hotel- they have more (COMP) amenities than a 4 diamonds hotels! 1. FREE Parking- never change this Mr. Mr. Patrick Staib !! 2. Good size lobby area 3. Entertainment (2nd Fl)-Good size outdoor pool with lounge chairs, bar, game room, gym, indoor pool, fitness center, sauna in the bathroom. 4. Bellmen Carts Available free of charge 5. Complimentary Wireless Internet 6. There are A LOT of other amenities that I didn't use, so I can't comment on that. Where's the other star? This really didn't affect our stay, but a good review must includes all aspects, so here are the bad part: 1. The ceiling wall paper in the bathroom are peeling off. 2. There's no screen door for the balcony. 3. There are stains on the ironing board and a lot of residue on the iron 4. The carpet feel and smells damped 5. Linens could use some update, it's look like it could be for a motel in 1960s 6. Elevators are very slow during the peak hours-check out time/check in time :( Overall, great location with a lot of amenities= good value. I would it recommend to friends/family. Virtual Tour- http://www.easyviewmedia.com/grand/index.htm Tips- If the hotel is sold out, try other sites (i.e. Entertainment Card, AAA, Third Parties-Expedia, Travelocity, Orbitz), they may have room allotments on these sites. Stay away from the "12" room if you don't like vending/ice machine. Stay away from the "13-15" room if you don't want to be near the elevator. I don't know if there are sleeping rooms on the 2nd/3rd floor, but if you're on that floor, you might see the rooftop of the retail shops. Btw, Mr. Staib, why do the complainers gets free stuff ? How about the ones that enjoyed their stay? Don't we get some loyalty discount for the future? ;P Also, please give my compliments to Greg again, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: usanewfie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the Sand Duels soccer tournament with the U-11 and U-9 girls teams. We typically stay at the Hilton in OC but The Grand Hotel is a better deal. The only downside is that they don't have room service, but the deliver services in OC are great, and you are right on the boardwalk so finding a decent place to eat is EASY. The rooms are clean and spacious, and all have great views. Definitely returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel right on the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: FerrariFanNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel for 3 nights. The room was big and clean. We also liked the outdoor pool, which was really great after our days on the beach. The hotel was in the quiet section of the boardwalk. We ate breakfast in the hotel. What i found odd was that our server told us that they did not take credit cards and I couldn't charge the breakfast to my room. Nothing against rap music, but I dont like listening to it while I am eating breakfast at 8:00 am in the morning. Even the pool bar, pizza joint, and the coffee shop only took cash. All of the hotel workers were great; very courteous and helpful. The hotel should consider replacing the plastic Kmart balcony furniture with some real outdoor furniture. But overall, i would recommend the hotel to familes, who want to be on the boardwalk and close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: SweetAngel03
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and friendly people. Nice and clean rooms. The bathrooms however, are SO tiny it is very hard to get around in them. The one thing I very much dislike are the balconies. There is absolutely no privacy on them. They have bars up that separates them and they do that so you get the most out of your view but like i said, there is just no privacy. I don't want to go out and sit there with my neighbors looking right at me!! That is my one major complaint about this hotel. Everything else was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal on the boards!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle20113006
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I spent a few nights recently and were impressed with the entire experience. The room was not ready when we arrived,although we were early. The front desk checked us in and took our cell number to call when the room was ready. Within 1/2 we were called. Our room was on the 8th floor . It was clean and comfortable. The view amazing. The hotel is right on the boardwalk and a few steps to the beach. There is a 24 hour coffeeshop. There is an indoor game area-with life size chess to play too.The beds were comfortable. Although the sheets a little worn. There is a nice pool but we did not use it on this trip. The only thing was we could hear noise on the boards until after midnight and the ice machine was right outside our room. I can't wait to go back! I hate to say to many good things I do not want the price to go up!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, Beautiful hotel, Beautiful PRICE!!”
Reviews.Author: cynsmith61
Reviews.Content: This is one of the view luxury hotels in Ocean City that has remained affordable to the average traveler. The hotel is upscale and extremely well maintained, which is so difficult in the beach environment. The rooms are large and well appointed. The beds are sooooo comfortable. And the views from the Oceanfront rooms are amazing. It is right on the boardwalk, so it is so convenient. Yet it is a very quiet property, which surprised me. The shops are nice and it is great that the Java Shop is open 24 hours a day. I highly recommend this hotel. Great for couples for a weekend getaway or family stays for a week. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tracieze
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from Ocean City yesterday. This was our first trip to Ocean City and we stayed at the Grand based on a recommendation from a family friends. I must say, the Grand did not disappoint. I must admit, I was very nervous to stay in a hotel, verses a beach house with my children. However, We were impressed from the moment we arrived. The man at the check in was very friendly and helpful. Our room was exactly what we had requested, direct ocean view. The room was very clean and housekeeping was very helpful and kind. We had a small kitchen area in our room (microwave, sink, refrigerator, counter area, cabinets, coffee maker) which was fantastic with two children. We had a nice sized balcony with a fantastic view. Our only complaint is that the balcony’s are not private and you are only provided two plastic chairs. Four chairs would have been nice and maybe a table for morning coffee. Privacy was an issue, as we had a "neighbor" who enjoyed smoking on their balcony despite the fact that we were on a "no smoking" floor. Plus, it is vacation...privacy is nice. Perhaps privacy screens could be added at some point. I am a bit surprised with some of the complaints that others have posted. It was "Senior Week" this past week, which we found out a few days before our arrival. Despite this, the hotel was very quiet and the beaches and boardwalk were not crowded or noisy. My children loved the hotel's outdoor pool, especially for night swimming. It would be nice if the pool overlooked the ocean, verses the parking lot. It is a nice and clean pool. There is also a pool bar open during the day hours, but not at night. The hotel has a pizza shop hat is beach front, a few surf shops, ice cream shop and a 24 hour cafe. They were a little pricey and only accepted cash, however, the convenience was well worth it. The icecream shop was not impressive, it was warm inside and the employees were not as friendly as all the other shops associated iwth the hotel. But, my kids were very happy with their icecream selections. Overall, we were VERY pleased with the Grand Hotel and plan to return for next year's family vacation. You cannot beat the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL OF ALL TIME”
Reviews.Author: KriMariNYC
Reviews.Content: Never in my life have I experienced such rude and ignorant service but any member in the hospitality industry - especially by the front desk Manager - Nina. The hotel booked my reservation for the wrong date, refused to give me a refund, and made my group pay full price for an extra night. The staff at this hotel cannot be trusted and are borderline scam artists. They are rude and do not understand any aspect of the hospitality industry. Also, if you are looking to stay at a hotel close to Seacrets - this is not it. I will never stay at this hotel again and I urge you to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Dont get Cheated on the views”
Reviews.Author: likedabeach
Reviews.Content: We booked an oceanfront view on Travelocity and we reached there they gave us a room with a city view and partial ocean side view. Though the hotel is clean, right on the boadwalk the staff Receptionist named Nina did not give us the room that we were promised by Travelocity and Travelocity could not do anything about it. They gave us a lame excuse of no rooms available, but we saw there were so many rooms available during our stay. Good indoor pool, out pool, mins to the beach but if you are booking a view dont be surprised. We have stayed here couple of times, but we will not stay here again. We saw many issues like this at the reception. Travelocity gurantee screwed up big time....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you are a High School Senior”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: Our family returned to the Grand Hotel after staying at the Hilton and the Holiday Inn the past two years. As in the past, the Grand Hotel was overrun with high school seniors. The excellent boardwalk location and reasonable rates, along with the hotel's insistence that they cannot refuse to rent rooms to teenagers like most of the other hotels do, makes it a popular choice with teenagers. As such, it is party central. Since our last stay, the luxurious dark green carpeting in the rooms has been replaced with ceramic tile. It made the rooms seem less cozy and increased the noise level from the room upstairs and the room with an adjoining door next door. We could hear every word they said as well as their TV. Large portions of the wall paper were peeling off of the walls. We stayed on the second floor for the first time and you could not see the boardwalk at all due to the first floor roof jutting outward and the view of the beach and ocean was through the fence surrounding the roof. Our TV reception was horrible (imagine the era of TVs with rabbit ear antennas...but without the rabbit ear antennas.) Called to have someone check the TV but no one ever did. Had Showtime for parts of two days, but no Showtime the rest of the week. Wireless internet access was only available about half of the time. Never saw any security personnel. On the positive side, in addition to the location and price, the maid service was excellent, the rooms were clean and they added video arcade machines, a pool table, a bean bag toss game and an oversized chess set to the empty area between the indoor and outdoor pools (although as I suggested to them in the past, the location was perfect for a hot tub or tubs).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BVnLJ
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel right on the boardwalk. We had a room on the top floor and could see everything. BVnLJ

Reviews.Title: “Leave the laptop at home!”
Reviews.Author: dilbertrocks
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at The Grand Hotel in Ocean City, MD was good but not exceptional. The big plus was that the room was ocean front. In fact, all of the rooms are ocean front so if this is something that it important to you, than this is the place. The price was definitely reasonable for an ocean front stay. However, the ad on their website did promise free Wi-Fi and that was pretty much non existent unless of course you wanted to spend your time in the lobby. The rooms were decent but it would have been nice if they had at the very least a larger refrigerator. The food choice at the Terrace Restaurant was breakfast only and it was only an option Thurs-Sun which was a bit strange. The lounge, pool bar and exercise room were fairly nice and easily accessible. The front desk staff were rather uninformed which wasn't helpful when spending a vacation in a tourist city. Overall, the experience at The Grand was good but when we go back next time, I think we'll give another hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: Josie4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a two-night stay at the Grand to celebrate our anniversary. Very nice entrance way and roomy lobby. Right away, I was happy to see all the comfortable seating areas -- after all, we go to the beach to relax, right? Check in was mostly perfect -- just a little glitch with my Expedia reservation. After about 5 minutes, all was worked out. The parking garage is located just across the street - very convenient. When we entered our room, first think I noticed was the view -- beautiful ocean view. But, when I pulled the curtain aside to see the full width of the view, I was disappointed to see that something was wrong with the second sliding glass door -- some type of oxidation/cloudiness was in-between the panes of glass - completely maring the view. I was disappointed because the view was so amazing. I'm not sure if any other rooms had the same issue (we were in 619). Fortunately, we could just step outside to get the full view. The room was quite spacious, and the bathroom was fine as well. We had breakfast in the restaurant one morning - excellent service and food and located on the same floor as our room. Great bay view from the restaurant. We also had coffee from the 24-hour coffee shop - very nice and ultra convenient. Our room also included a coffee maker, microwave, small fridge. The outdoor pool was very clean and there were plenty of loungers. Leading to the outdoor and indoor pools is a game room and a workout room. Also liked that the hotel is located on the quiet end of the boardwalk. All in all, great stay -- but please fix the sliding glass door!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are Big - Staff Friendly - Crowd So-So - Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: lacdf
Reviews.Content: We stayed for Memorial Weekend and we must say that we arrived early in the morning and we got our bedroom without a problem. The Room is big with Ocean View and a balcony. It was Clean OK as it was the Bathroom. We had a bikers and a church convention so the crowd was interesting for say the least at least visually. Must say that every one was respectful and we did not have any complains. The noise at night was loud, but then again it was Memorial Weekend so we were expecting it. At Check Out we had a Complimentary hour and a half so our check out was at 12:30 instead of 11:00 am. The staff told us that we could use the 2ND floor restrooms and locker to change if needed. So, we did, it was useful not extremely clean but in good shape and super useful. As mentioned before mixed feelings. The hotel was not that bad, it is outdated but then again Ocean City seems out dated as a whole! Staff was willing to accommodate and the rooms were OK.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wickhammaureen
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay in OC that has your best interests at heart, don't stay at the Grand Hotel on 21 street. We stayed there for Memorial weekend and it was a disaster! A motorcycle association and church group were staying there at the same time. Don't mind bikers, don't mind churches, do mind loud music 24-7 and the all night party the hotel and city aloud in their garage parking, by-the-way, can't park out front of the hotel. Woudl NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone! Would only give a "below expectations" rating if there were one. I hope everyone reads my review before they book here!

Reviews.Title: “The internet here blows and the staff uninterested in getting it fixed”
Reviews.Author: jasonblu
Reviews.Content: We are still here, on a one week stay and have about had it with the terrible internet connectivity in our room and thus this hotel. Its 2011 folks - internet is an essential commodity now a days. It would be like having a scratchy phone connection that cuts in and out back in the 70's and thinking thats ok to provided for your customers. When we called to have it fixed all we got was that we could come down to the lobby to connect. seriously? again, thats like telling someone to 'come down to the lobby' every time they want to make a phone call. Kyle at the front desk said that he could call maintenence. When I asked him if maintenance was also IT dept, he said "no - but maintenance knows the guy to call for IT help.' Wow. The front desk doesnt even know how to call for help with the internet. I asked for management. Its 0645, they arent in yet. I asked for them to have mgmt call me when they get in. We will see what happens with that. to be continued...

Reviews.Title: “Another year, another great time!”
Reviews.Author: MdVacation
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last May and just got back this May. What a great time yet again. Things I like: great communication let me know right at check in that I could have a late check out for $45 bucks, called the room to see how we are doing a few hours after checking in, quick room service, great working A/C and Heat unit, indoor and outdoor pool, 24 hr. cafe, right on the boardwalk, parking garage, comfortable beds, nice layout of rooms, wet bar/sink, nice bathroom / shower, balcony. Things that need some help: TV needs updating to plasma/lcd/led they said they were updating them this year but still the same one, balcony door was very hard to open and close, maybe add in a screen door in front of the glass door so bugs cant fly in, indoor pool should be heated. They really need to upgrade their wireless internet especially in the rooms. They should offer free wireless in all rooms/levels and have it on a secure locked network meaning at time of check-n they provide you with the password to access the wireless. This way it keeps anyone from using it plus its way more secure than an open network. I will stay here again since prices are very decent for what they offer, I always tend to book earlier as well. I hope they offer repeat customer discounts, I will check into that the next time I plan to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience . Blood found on the wall of our room !”
Reviews.Author: FreqFlyr63
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy having your family exposed to BLOOD on the wall of your hotel room, then this is the place for you. Ocean City P.D. responded & confirmed blood presence. Of course, in the presence of the P.D., hotel management assured us General Manager was aware, he would address the situation promptly, & an incident report would be provided to us. Well, you guessed it folks, empty promises all. We arrived @ front desk, after transferring OURSELVES to a tired replacement room, only to be informed by "Director of Security" it was "His Call", and no acknowledgement /incident report would be provided. Nice right ? We are STILL waiting for your return call Patrick S. You have our contact #'s & E-mail. Why the delay ? Should I post the pictures ?

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: saltemps
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here, I was probably more likely to be on the lookout for negatives. That said, our stay was perfectly comfortable. We booked a month in advance for a wedding and were given a rate of around $120 for an ocean view room (I believe all the rooms are ocean view). When we checked in, I noticed what some of the reviews have complained about: a faint smoke smell, some older furnishings, etc. We were next to a standard room that seemed to be filled with about a dozen guys in their 20s who were partying in their room and on the balcony. We wanted a quiet night, so we called down for a room change. At first the clerk wanted to charge us $75 to downgrade to a room with a worse view (we didn't really care about the view at this point), but after speaking to his manager, he upgraded us to non-smelly, recently updated room on the 11th floor. And it was quiet! After the room change we were much happier. The only negatives were that the a/c was very loud when it cycled on and that light fixture in the bathroom seemed to be causing the paint to melt, which seemed like a safety concern. All in all we had a comfortable stay, but if we had stayed in the original room or had to pay $75 for a quiet room, I would probably be writing a negative review.

Reviews.Title: “Take the chance! The Grand is still the grand lady on the boardwalk.”
Reviews.Author: fulghie
Reviews.Content: At this very moment I'm in my king jacuzzi room in a snuggly hotel-provided robe, watching the sun rise over the Atlantic, and life is good. With some trepidation we booked 2 nights here during the off season for a peaceful retreat, and we're not disappointed. Not saying the reviews aren't true-- the smoke smell hit us as we opened the door, the jacuzzi is a squeeze for 2, and the carpet ripples like the ocean, but it's minor. The room is huge (all the more puzzling that I can't sit in a nice chair to read my book, but must opt for this desk chair), it's spotless, the employees are sweet, and our view is outstanding. The easy access beach and boardwalk are directly below me. The building exudes spaciousness and encourages relaxation. And wi-fi works in the room! No dreaded fire alarm roused us during the night, but we did fearfully decline to use the provided candles around our tub to prevent $250 from being tacked on to our room charge! I'm guessing that helps keep the trouble away, because the staff informs us that alarms now are few and far between. Our disappointments? The pool is too cold for swimming (a major reason we booked here, sadly) and even the hotel restaurant is closed. We expected the strip to be largely shuttered until June, but the ads promised a restaurant on site. Since we called here directly, we should've been warned we'd need to drive around to find an open place to dine. It's nice, though, to have a 24 hour coffee shop in the lobby. Would we come back? Yes, if after pricing similar locations we found that the price was competitive. WIth its boardwalk access, outdoor pool and various dining and entertainment options during the open season, it appears to have it all.

Reviews.Title: “A few deficiencies but an incredible bargain.”
Reviews.Author: pamnbrie
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Orbitz, mostly because of the location. We wanted ocean front and close to the boardwalk. The original price was 80.00 per night including tax, imagine our surprise when the final bill was received and the price was actually 65.00 including tax! The front desk staff was friendly and responsive the few times we interacted. We were disappointed that the kitchenette had absolutely nothing in the cabinets. No plates, cups, eating utensils, or toaster. The room definitely needs a couch or sitting chairs. Carpet was a little lumpy and our first full day there we had to inquire about housekeeping since by 3:30pm our room was still not "made" up. When we returned at 8:00pm the room was done, but much to our surprise one comforter was thrown on the floor next to the bed. No big deal since I generally don't use the comforter anyway, but a little comical to say the least. The coffee/bagel shop downstairs is open 24 hrs. and the coffee was always fresh. My 14 year old daughter and I visited the spa, but didn't have the time to use the services. The listed prices were reasonable and the receptionist was friendly. Parking was on site and convenient. Balcony could use a good cleaning but functional. Four available elevators made our trek to the 9th floor fast. WiFi only worked in the lobby which was fine. There is a computer with internet access in the lobby for quests to use. Very good location, right on the boardwalk, close to many restaurants, mini golf, shopping. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “major problem with fire alarm!”
Reviews.Author: dlfb
Reviews.Content: I Understand that fire alarms are there to protect us but we have stayed here for the past six or seven years and have been evacuated every year. Some years more than once. For me its an inconvience and annoying. For my kids its scarey. My seven year old is scared to go back. Last year he couldnt sleep and grinded his teeth all night long. The fire alarm went off of course and then the rest of our vacation he wanted to go home! It was a nightmare. Its a shame because we like everything else about this hotel. Nice hotel with a major fire alarm problem!

Reviews.Title: “Not one problem with my stay!”
Reviews.Author: ginafrye22
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at The Grand in the middle of march! We went for a weekend and had a great time! The rooms were excellent with cleanliness! Our room was right on the water and the view was great! We stayed on the 11th floor and had no problems getting to the room. The parking was right next to the hotel and very convenient. The rooms were very large and also very private, we could not hear anyone around us! The room was equipped with a kitchen that had a microwave, mini fridge, and a sink as well! Also there was plenty cabinet space available too! The location of the hotel was perfect, there are plenty and i mean plenty of restaurants near the hotel as well as mini-golfing and the amusement park too. During the weekend we traveled to Assateague Island. The island was only a short 15 minute drive from the hotel and I definately recommend it! The ponies were everywhere and the beach was perfect! I loved everything about this hotel and I would stay there a million more times. The front desk was very friendly and willing to help and give recommendations for places to eat and places to have fun! There is nothing that I can complain about the hotel! I'd recommend this hotel to families with children as the board walk is right in front of the hotel. I'd recommend it to couples as well as we had gotten a bottle of champagne and roses on the bed! The Grand Hotel definitely lives up to its name!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing home away from home”
Reviews.Author: DatroPavis
Reviews.Content: When visiting the grand with my spouse, I had a fantastic time. The decor was very inviting, and the rooms were spacious. The rooms have kitchenettes, including a fridge, microwave and sink, which proved very convenient. We had a beachside room, which provided a picturesque view of the ocean. The hotel amenities include a pool, an exercise room, a game room, a spa, restaurants, 24-hour cafe, and a conveniently located ATM. The staff was very accommodating and courteous with all of our requests. The stay was very enjoyable, and we look forward to returning to the Grand.

Reviews.Title: “A grand time, at a Grand Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rvtripad
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary in Ocean City Md., and had a grand time at the “Grand Hotel”. At first we weren’t sure about a January getaway to the shore, but we were enticed by the great getaway package and the amenities the hotel had to offer. We were very pleased to find how beautiful the hotel was and that they had everything we needed, from a gourmet coffee shop in the lobby for mourning latte’s, to a great lounge with live music at night. In between there was the indoor pool and sauna with a second floor view of the Bay, and a pizza shop for lunch with a view of the ocean. What more could you ask for? Even the room had everything we needed, complete with a kitchenette, refrigerator and microwave. The room was very clean and service was great. We really wanted to have massages at their spa, because the price was very reasonable and they offered ½ hour sections for two but alas our beautiful room, with personal Jacuzzi was so tantalizing we sent a lot of our time there. Who says you can’t have fun after 40 years of marriage. Over all we would rate our trip to the “Grand Hotel” as “Excellent” and I can’t wait to go back. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great getaway location. Check out their package deals.

Reviews.Title: “We have had enough!”
Reviews.Author: Dad088
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand at least three or four times a year for many years. Originally, it was the best place to stay in Ocean City. It was clean, quiet and a good value. However, starting last year (2010) things started going downhill, and this truly saddens us. The rooms are no longer as clean e.g. ... dirty bathrooms.. roaches. Also, twice we experienced bogus fire alarms and had to leave the hotel, I was in the shower during the last one . Additionally, I know that a hotel cannot be responsible for the behavior of its guests, however, occasionally the noise can only be described as ridiculous. On one occasion, at 3:00am in the morning a noisy meeting was being held in the hall right outside my room! I opened the door and 10 to 15 adults were sitting on the floor with papers all about. I later found out it was people from an AMWAY convention. Needless to say, we have found another place to stay when we visit Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “the Perfect wedding”
Reviews.Author: miketerri034
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff and catering staff were incredible .The ballroom was absolutly outstanding . We had over 70 guests all were from out of town all had a wonderful time . The wedding was perfect will absolutely be back. I would like to thank all for a wonderful time

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME TY TY TY”
Reviews.Author: dls1926
Reviews.Content: This is the most wonderful sunrise! And from the fabulous view of our room !! Had a newly renovated room! What a great hotel to stay at, the view, the people that work there and the surroundings are great! Couldn't have asked for a better time!! Thanks to The Grand !!! DLS

Reviews.Title: “Loved it last year - roaches this year!”
Reviews.Author: MDBarbara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel last year and loved it. This year was different. We checked in, unpacked, saw a roach crawling up the wall and checked out! The hotel staff was very apologetic however, and did not hesitate to refund our money. I'm going to have a hard time considering the hotel in the future unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, good value”
Reviews.Author: joeleonee
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights. Staff was pleasant and very helpful. View from the 10th floor was awesome. The room was one of the recently refurbished rooms and was really nice, however, it had a handicapped bath ( did not know this) which made the bath a little tight. But overall, the hotel was clean, nice and with a cafe open 24 hours. Would deffinitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: MdVacation
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Rooms are great layout and size wise. They were clean and comfortable with nice views and balcony. Swimming pools (indoor and outdoor) were nice and clean. Fitness center could use some updating but still was very usable. The bathroom was nice with decent space and had a decent layout. The hotel was clean inside and out, and even the parking garage. Always had plenty of parking for me and my friends' car. Perfect location on the boardwalk, you can walk right out onto it and walk all the way up and down. Will stay there again, I had no problems what so ever and I must say the A/C and Heat worked great! I had a mini fridge and microwave with a wet bar / sink. If they could improve it would be better tv's like plasma or lcd, but the size was good.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up :)”
Reviews.Author: reportingmom
Reviews.Content: Planned a last-minute quick weekend to OC and were pleasantly surprised. Okay, turned out it was Bike Week, which the possibility hadn't occurred to me, but it's all good. We usually stay around 5th Street, and our girls (12 and 9) were like, 21st Street?! But it was lovely. The hotel lobby was very clean and nicely appointed, and the 24-hour coffee shop was so convenient. We didn't use the indoor pool on the 2nd floor, or the outdoor pool, for that matter (although it was open), but they looked fine, and also the video games, etc, in the atrium by the pool were "cool" according to the girls. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean. The decor could use a little updating, in my opinion, but I don't go to the beach for an updated room. We go for the beach and the room views, which were both excellent. The mini-kitchen was convenient, with cupboards, microwave and coffeemaker, but there were no utensils or plates, pans, etc., so be aware you need to bring your own. I'm not about cooking on a weekend jaunt, so no worries there. Customer service was absolutely stellar. The first evening I realized rollaways were available, so after calling for one, it was delivered with five minutes, no exaggeration, by a very sweet girl. The next night we called for an extra blanket, and two were delivered in less than five minutes again. I realize it is off season and they're not quite as busy, but under any circumstances, that's great service. My husband was having a muscle problem in his neck, and I had read great reviews about the spa/salon in the hotel. Didn't take much arm-twisting to get him to go down for a massage, and they did not disappoint. He's not a massage kind of guy, but that neck massage saved our little weekend. We saw the masseuse later in the lobby and he thanked her again, and she was just as nice as could be and genuinely appreciated his thank you. (and mine, believe me) We did eat in the restaurant on the 5th floor, and the food was really good. TVs had good channel selection, housekeeping even made up our 9 year old's bed with her little bear all tucked in cute. Noise was okay, but it WAS Bike Week. I'm an ear-plug kind of gal on vacation anyway, so slept like a baby. The beds were okay as far as comfort. I like really soft beds, but my husband was fine with it. The girls gave two thumbs up, so we'll be back. Even if we weren't staying at the Grand, though, I have no doubt my husband would be a repeat customer for that neck massage, though.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty Salon”
Reviews.Author: Beachyogi50
Reviews.Content: I am a local and visit the salon regularly for massage and hair cuts. Great services! Great people! Lots of fun, have been a regular for 6 years.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CHLOEHANOVERPA
Reviews.Content: Just got back from oc. I really liked this hotel the rooms and hotel were very clean and the staff very friendly and nice. We had a room on the side and still had a great view of the ocean. I also liked the 24 hour coffee shop. What i did not like is that you could not bring your own drinks and snacks to the pool they did have a bar at the pool which was way overpriced after all you are on vacation you should be able to relax and enjoy yourself at the pool. the only other thing i wish they had was a hot tub that would be perfect

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Salon!”
Reviews.Author: Mieko K
Reviews.Content: The Grand Salon is the place I always stop by and make an appointment whenever I am in Ocean City. I usually receive an hour body massage from Karen who is an excelleent massage therapist. She understands exactly what my complain is and ease my tense. It is so relaxing at the end of the session and have to make another appointment. Shiela, the manager is also excellent hair stylist. Her technique is like a magician who can create wonderful hair to suite for you. The salon is clean and all staff are freindly. This place was my secret place before but decided to share with others because we all deserve to be relaxed when we are in OC.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: CTYankee66
Reviews.Content: it's got it all...pool, shops, restaurant, coffee shop, quiet end of boardwalk location, great views from oceanfront rooms. Rooms on 11th Fl were clean and very comfy. Oh, they have a pool bar too. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Some minor negatives, but overall great experience!”
Reviews.Author: BeachFamilyVaca2010
Reviews.Content: We were able to book this place online at www.ococean.com for a better rate than walk-in. The hotel is in a good location. We were initially concerned with it being on the boardwalk, but it is towards the end and this was not a problem. The decor is nice and hotel is clean. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a sideview room which still had a good view of the ocean and the bay. The negatives- the bathroom was extremely small and awkward; beds were okay but pillows terrible; housekeeping was not the best--there was a table in the room which we had eaten breakfast on that had crumbs that were never cleaned the entire stay; the pools were "eh"--not that great and they should really have a hottub available; charging for internet is ridiculous, especially since there is only one computer available downstairs which is either occupied or interminably slow; and probably my biggest pet peeve--there are numerous 15 minute parking spots in front of the hotel w/ absolutely no enforcement. We saw the same cars parked there for days! I mentioned it to the manager at the front desk, but nothing was done about it. As a result, when we were checking in/out, we had to haul our bags from the adjoining lot. Other than these items, we were very pleased with our stay, as the value, location and service seemed to outweigh any negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Worse experience I've had at a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kdbar
Reviews.Content: Used to stay here when my kids were younger. This was the first amd last time back. The room wasn't on the floor discribed when I booked it. Smelled like cigarettes even though it said non smoking. The wallpaper was peeling off and the phone in the room didn't work. We had several fire alarms and had to leave the building until the fire department checked it out. One was at 1AM and pepole had to wake their children to stand outside until it was cleared. Find another hotel and don't waste your money staying here!

Reviews.Title: “The Grand was Great!”
Reviews.Author: KMate
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in a Premier view room which they told me was a sideview, unobstructed. If I didn't know any better, I would have thought we were in an oceanfront room. The view of the ocean was great. The hotel sits right on the board walk, but not in a crazy busy section - perfect for families. The ocean was so close; it was amazing. Every staff member was professional and courteous. Check in was fast and easy. We could usually park right in the front parking lot; but there is also a ramp garage right next to the hotel that always had plenty of spots. The room was larger than most hotel rooms. Two queen beds and plenty of room for a roll-a-way ($10 per nite) and plenty of room to walk around. Good kitchen space - microwave, sink, plenty of cupboards, refridgerator, coffee maker. Bathroom was a bit small but had plenty of counterspace and a large mirror. We had a bit of a problem opening the sliding door to the balcony. We called the front desk, and somebody was there within 5 minutes. He stated they were in the process of replacing all the sliding doors (3 floors had already been completed) and showed us some tricks to make sliding the door open easier (the track was bent), For the price, location, cleanliness, convenience of being right on the boardwalk and having both an indoor and outdoor pool plus the shops and restaurants right there in the hotel, the Grand cannot be beat! We would definitely stay here again! Can't wait for next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: OnMyJob
Reviews.Content: OMG! I just checked into the Grand Hotel. Got to my room and the bathroom had not been cleaned. I mean - there were spots on the toilet seat! Hotel management was reluctant to move me into another room but finally moved me next door. Guess what? There were a pair of ladies underwear right outside my balcony on the rooftop - which my balcony sits on! And then, moments later, someone tries to get into my room! Why? Because the hotel had checked them into the same room that I am occupying! Mind you, this all happened within a 10-minute time frame! Stay away!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Grand is Grand”
Reviews.Author: loriweitz6
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Grand for many years and there is no other hotel my family would stay at. The location is perfect, the service wonderful and so very clean. From check-in to check-out the staff could not do enough for you. After reading some of the negative reviews on this hotel, it seems nobody contacted management while they were staying at the hotel. The staff is always so willing to help out and have always addressed concerns anyone has. Thank you for a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean place”
Reviews.Author: Marisa69
Reviews.Content: I was sort of skeptical booking this hotel after reading some of the reviews. However, we had a wonderful, large, clean, ocean view room with 2 dbl beds with a refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave oven. The balcony isn't real private and you can see your neighbors on both sides but we really didn't care and nobody was really out there when we were out on our balcony. The only negative was that the bathrooms were quite small. The pools were clean and there were always towels on hand to use in the pool areas. Check in/out was a breeze. Also, we had no problems with parking. Most of the time we could park along the hotel and only once did we have to park in the parking garage adjacent to the hotel. The hotel is situated on 21st so we were at a perfect location on the boardwalk where there wasn't alot of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: KrisLyons
Reviews.Content: Grand View Room.Needs cosmetic work.Housekeeping is great.Hate that we are right on the shops roof.Guests upstairs throw ice and beer cans onto the roof.2yr old was eating cheerios and seagulls starting flocking onto our balcony pecking at the door. Restaurant needs a lot of work. 2 guys running it seems like they make the food themselves. Skip it and head to the Sahara Cafe. pools are great.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with excellent cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: bustertheboa
Reviews.Content: We travel to Ocean City, Maryland almost every summer and definitely prefer the Boardwalk hotels. This past time was the first we ever stayed at the Grand Stowaway Hotel. All in all we had a positive and pleasant experience. The lobby is spacious and offers direct access to the Boardwalk. At 21st Street the hotel is not completely central, but it is still an excellent location and everything on the Boardwalk is within fairly easy walking distance. The 24 hour cafe is a very nice touch. The breakfast sandwiches and bagels were only so so, but the muffins, brownies, and pound cake were all very good. One minor gripe is that the Grand Terrace restaurant was only open from 7 am til noon. It seems to me that an in-hotel restaurant should be open for all 3 meals and offer room service, but perhaps that is just I. We had a room with an excellent view of the ocean, two queen beds, mini fridge, and microwave. The cleaning service was superlative -- not just for our room, but the entire hotel. It was very clear that they expend a great deal of time and effort keeping the place free of sand (as much as can be for a beach hotel during peak tourism, anyway). I was impressed by how cool and clean the halls, lobby, and elevators were. The outdoor pool was very nice, but the indoor pool seemed to be over-chlorinated and was too warm. The fitness center and gameroom were nice plusses; although I think they should have had more than 2 treadmills, especially since one was quite rough over about 5 mph. In general the room was comfortable and spacious with a nice balcony, but the mattresses were a bit firm for my wife and daughters. I was also disappointed that high speed internet access was only in the lobby. For me this was inconvenient. I definitely prefer to have in-room high speed internet access. Also the A/C was fairly loud. There was no high/medium/low control for the fan... just a thermostat. Whenever the A/C kicked on it would seemingly jar the entire room. We ended up just shutting it off at night. Even so, our stay there was pleasurable and I would recommend the Grand Hotel to others... just with the above caveats. It definitely holds its own (at least) as compared to other Boardwalk hotels. For not quite $300 a night (room and all applicable taxes and fees), it is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Self serve”
Reviews.Author: Dlr35
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at grand at was disappointed with the service of employees. Compared to previous years of staying at the hotel the staff does not speak english nor understand very well. Lazy staff and incompetent. This is my last stay here at the grand I will go to another hotel. I would pass on this hotel if you are thinking about staying here because other hotels offer better amenties than this one for the price

Reviews.Title: “Good to be back”
Reviews.Author: ThePrincessPa
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our Ocean Ciy vacation today. We stayed at the Grand this year. After having a less than grand time there in 2008 (anyone who has read my tirade after our July '08 vacation knows what I'm talking about) we took a break and stayed somewhere else last year. We came back to the Grand because the location is perfect. I must say that I am glad we did!!! Check in was a breeze, we got the floor we wanted, the view was FANTASTIC (we had more of an ocean view than we ever had before). How lovley to lay in bed and see the ocean!! The hotel was clean, staff was very friendly and helpful. There MUST have been a change of management. A change for the good!!! I will be happy to again recommend The Grand!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: JackieSteve
Reviews.Content: I relied on this site to see what others thought about the hotel. I was nervous because I was taking a 9 month old to this hotel and wanted something nice and clean. And this hotel was just that. We got a direct oceanview room and it was definately worth the extra money. The views were breathtaking. The room was clean and huge!! We had a lot of stuff to take along and they have a kitchenette area with plenty of storage so nothing was sitting out. My daughter had plenty of room to crawl around. The carpet was a little wrinkled, but that didn't matter to us. Everybody was very helpful at the front desk. The only bad thing was the bathroom was tiny, but the size of the room made up for it! The room was relatively quiet except at the kithcen area where we could hear people out in the hallways! It was a fantastic vacation at a fantastic hotel! We'll definately be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for the location and price.”
Reviews.Author: cyclone2164
Reviews.Content: I've been going to OC now for over 30 years. First with my parents and now with my kids, so I've stayed in my share of hotels...both dumps and up-scale places. I'd have to stay that the Grand is above average. We stayed in the Signature Series rooms on the 11th floor (#1114) and I must say the view is amazing. The beds, pillows and linens in the were very comfortable and the 4 of us sleep very well (for the most-part) in the 2 queen beds. The furnishing are a bit worn and our carpeting too was a bit bumpy. Now, I cannot say that our stay was perfect, because on our first night a group of teens a few doors down were partying and making a ton of noise, then the second night the single guy in room 1115 comes in at 4:30am with a couple of LOUD women and kept us up for hours. We did turn him into the front desk that morning. The nice woman manager said the hotel has a 3 strike policy. After that, all was well until the weekend when some idiot at 1:30am decided to set off the fire alarm. Nothing like getting your 9 and 5 year olds down 11 flights of steps. Worse than that was the 80+ year old woman in front of us being basically carried down by her family. There were 2 days that our room was never made-up. we were out of our room by 9am and returned at 3 or 4 and can back to unmade beds. Those days, my wife made the beds and went to the maid's cart to get towels, soap and shampoo. Also, if you have an over-height vehicle (like we do), you cannot park in the garage. Even though there are signs telling people to park their cars in the garage, they still insist on parking in the lot out front of the hotel. After a few days, I finally told the front desk and they let me park in the 15 minute loading/unloading spaces. Finally, while these things sound terrible our stay was one of the better ones, compared to some of the other places that I've stayed at in OC. Being on the Boards is a plus and having a huge beach, an indoor and outdoor pool, mini-golf, fine dining, amusements and other entertainment within walking distant is a big plus with a family of 4. This hotel is a very nice place and we'd have no problem staying here again...just fix that fire alarm system.

Reviews.Title: “Still "Grand"”
Reviews.Author: AnnMaryland
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Hotel for 6 years in a row. We love the ocean view. The place is clean and the rooms are very nice and big. The location is great because it is close to all the things my family likes to do at the beach. Phillips restaurant is only a half block away. Right across the street is a new Dairy Queen and Candy Kitchen. Miniature golf is only about a block away. And our favorite breakfast place, Happy Jacks, is only about 2 blocks away.
