We did notice this year that it is getting time for remodeling. A hotel of this type asking around $300 a night should try to stay fresh and new. (Hopefully the owners and managers read these reviews.) The furnishing are starting to look dated. They need to upgrade to flat screen TVs. The furniture, since it is laminate and not real wood, is really starting to show wear. The bar on the sliding door was broken and missing pieces. When my husband sat in one of the green plastic chairs on the balcony, it broke. They are getting weather worn and brittle and in need of replacing. We love the Grand Hotel. We recommend it to family and friends and will return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: TerryandKathy
Reviews.Content: I loved your hotel! We still talk about it. We have reccomended it to several friends. i have been going to OC for years and haven't stayed in a nicer room. We had an Oceanfront room and it was clean and the bed was comfortable. The room was not your usual beach hotel room, it was much fancier. We got a really good rate because of it being Thanksgiving week, and for $10 more we were able to upgrade. Location was awesome. Lobby was beautiful, with Christmas music playing and everyone was friendly including the front desk staff and the bartender. Would consider going back this Thanksgiving and staying with you again. Do you offer any packages for Thanksgiving?

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: WestRiverCmore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand with my wife and two kids. Our room was extremely large and comfortable compared to most hotels in the area. We were able to thrown down a blow up mattress and still have plenty of room to move around. The ice machine was right outside my door and I never heard a peep late at night. The rooms seem to be very quite and soundproof compared to other hotels I have stayed in. We did not use the pools, but they seemed well maintained to me. The beach outside of the hotel is the best selling point - it's GRAND!!! When compared to staying in other locations in Ocean City, the beach at this location is very large and accommodates large crowds without making you feel like a sardine. The front desk staff was very friendly and helped with any issues and/or questions we had. Yes, I'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “Not so "Grand"”
Reviews.Author: 44x
Reviews.Content: Great hotel layout and a great location. Other than that the Hotel is horrible. Our room was musty, the bed was terrible, had wrinkled carpet, ripped wallpaper, stains on the ceiling, broken tile in the bathroom, and a sliding door to the balcony that could only be unlocked and locked with much effort. This was the upgraded room that we were given after refusing to stay in the second floor room that we were given at check-in. It appears that there is no form of maintenance at all in the rooms. There are two pools that are nice other than they are used by anyone (not hotel guests) that wants to use them. The hotel restrooms and exterior showers are also used by anyone and everyone in the area. This would not be a problem if the hotel guests were not impacted by "public" use of all of the amenities that we paid for. There was never a hotel employee around at the pools, restrooms, or showers to check to see who was a guest and who was not. If you want to wait by the outside shower to clean off your feet after being at the beach while a family of 10 showers (soap and shampoo included) this is the place for you. I took my son to the game room and we could only find two out of the many games available that would actually work. I would not be so disappointed by the condition of the hotel if I had pulled off of 95 and got a $59.00 room. We paid well over $200.00 per night. I would not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME VACATION!”
Reviews.Author: pfranklin
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I came to Grand Hotel for a long weekend vacation. I'm not sure what other people experienced that caused them to write bad reviews because we found the hotel to be fantastic. We loved everything about it. The view from our room on the 8th floor of the ocean and bay was fantastic!! The convenience of the hotel to the beach and boardwalk was great! The rooms were clean and very large. It was one of the nicest places we have ever stayed! The only issue we had was some loud men in the room nextdoor who decided to stay up all night. They would slam the door as they came in and then when they left, but we heard nothing once they got in the room. We will definitely vacation here again, and I'm hoping to book a trip with my husband for a romantic getaway this fall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bleemarvin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you want on the boardwalk but away from all the noise with beautiful views. Room was nice size and clean, although the carpet could use an update. Hotel offers many things to keeps kids busy with a game room and indoor/outdoor pools. The coffee shop is nice and offers a variety of eats and drinks if your in a pinch for something quick. Front desk staff very helpful. We will return to this hotel in furture stays at Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “SENIOR WEEK”
Reviews.Author: 316dude
Reviews.Content: What a true disappointment!!! Our kids could not check in the hotel without a parent's signature on a paper stating we would take responsibility. My child was over the age of 18 (isn't that still considered an adult???). During check-in several seniors had to wait for their parents to fax or email this paper. Of course, the hotel was happy to take our child's money before this paper was received. When speaking to the manager, he acted as if he didn't care and basically stated we could find somewhere else. Not very good customer service. Good luck Seniors!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: First19
Reviews.Content: Actually I'm here right now and all I can say is do not come here memorial weekend it's gang weekend and not a place for young kids we haven't sleep in two days cause they take over the whole hotel wit there loud music and there loins bikes and I guess the managment doesn't care cause they rent out like 50 rooms first time here n probably last such a shame'!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice perks, but they need to update the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: blondie0088
Reviews.Content: Although I personally thought this was a nice hotel in a great location I can see how some people would be a bit dissapointed. We paid for an Oceanveiw room and were placed on the ground floor with a veiw of the roof. (Why dont they put a pool here?) We couldnt really see the ocean from our room but it was something we could deal with. Although the rooms seemed clean they were very dark and frankly depressing. When you go to a beach hotel, you want light and color! I liked the indoor and outdoor pool area and the pool bar. I would stay here agian if they lowered the rates. For what you get I dont think its worth the inflated prices they try to charge. If you are coming with family rent a condo at the Ocean hideaway or seagate instead and save $$$!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stressful Wedding... =(”
Reviews.Author: kindaconfuzed
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I decided that we wanted to do a beach wedding so we decided on this hotel because it is right on the boardwalk on the beach. The hotel itself is very nice and clean...exactly what i wanted in a hotel.. EXCEPT for the catering. The caterer (Anna) is the hardest person in the world to get a hold of. She never returns calls, says shes going to send info to your email and mail and does neither. She has been dodging my phone calls for 2 months!!!! I'm really frustrated and unfortunately I have to go w her because you have to use the hotels caterer. I'm so disappointed. If you have any sort of event that needs catering DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL!!!!! Extremely unprofessional. Less than two months til my wedding and we aren't sure what's going on with our caterer.... =( Also we drove all the way there from PA for a meeting with her and she never showed up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time around not so bad..and no fire alarms thankfully!”
Reviews.Author: thinkbigger
Reviews.Content: This second trip to the stowaway grand was a comp from the staff for last years 3 early morning wake-ups to fire alarms, evacuations and loss of elevator service which sent us flying down the steps from the 6th floor at 5am...3 times in 2 days. This time around the stay was very pleasant and we were given a nice direct ocean front room that was clean and quiet. This location really is a great spot on the boardwalk and I feel is the reason to stay there coupled with the price. It is still an outdated room with old carpets, linens, popcorn ceilings and small old fashion TVs into an over-sized armoire but again it does the trick and we didnt spend time there as the location is so great. It did have a nice little fridge with microwave and all in all its an OK room that is totally doable and stayable. They keep the lobby and common areas nice and clean and they have a good staff roaming around most of the time we noticed cleaning and asking if you need help. We would stay here again and appreciate the comped room to give them another try. If this hotel were to get a makeover it would be a real treat as it would be an amazing location with a great modern room but until then I suggest enjoy the fair off season pricing and great location! I would recommend staying here to a friend or family member.

Reviews.Title: “Looks better on the outside.”
Reviews.Author: heysoulsister
Reviews.Content: It was okay. I was honestly expecting more.. We always used to walk by this hotel on the boardwalk and thought it looked amazing, but then when we finally stayed there it wasn't really that "grand". I liked the bakery, the ice cream place, and the bar with the pool tables. It was a great vacation, but an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME”
Reviews.Author: toogood83
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Grand Hotel and loved it! We got a package which included a jacuzzi room with a balcony looking right over the ocean... can't get better than that. They had the best deal for the weekend, so I figured it would be a bit of a dive, but it was very nicely kept up and provided excellent service! We'll definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Been staying there for six years, and never had a problem”
Reviews.Author: Net212
Reviews.Content: I've been reading a lot of reviews on this site, that said the Grand Hotel was horrible, and to steer clear of it, but I've been staying there for six years, and never once had a problem with it. The rooms are nice, the hotel seems clean and the staff is friendly. There are two pools, which is good since neither pool is ever too crowded. I will admit the rooms are a bit dark (nothing that can't be fixed with a flip of a few switches), and the balcony isn't too private, however, it's a great location and the balcony has ample room to sit any sandy beach toys. The absolute best thing about the Grand is the parking garage, which has quite a lot of space, and is perfect, since finding parking in Ocean City, without having to walk a few blocks and crossing the busy highway isn't exactly easy. Sure, the Grand isn't anything overly special, but it's a great hotel for its price. I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal for the winter beach bum”
Reviews.Author: Roonwit
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay in January - cold beach weather - but a good deal for a top floor, king sized bed, jaccuzzi bath, beachfront room. I would not pay the summer rate for this room. Many reviewers state the hotel is running down, and it seems to be. Small things in my room could be fixed, some areas of the hotel smell (an old hotel smell - maybe old smoke smell as well). Yet, for a winter get away, the price is write and the room is still more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “You Call That Grand?”
Reviews.Author: daybreakartist
Reviews.Content: why is there not an email address on your Grand Hotel website? We stayed for 3 hours last night, and it was the worst stay we have had in OC . We go every year to celebrate "our christmas" with a jaccuzzi room in Ocean City and to see the lights.. There were no lights at the inlet , and the room was horrible. Do you really think two Adults can fit in the jaccuzzi you have there? It would MAYBE fit two 8 year olds... all crammed up and no where to put your shoulderblades when in the tub.. who wants feet in eachothers face? what a joke! And you advertise PEPPERMINT MOCHA all over the place, but no peppermint at the shop.. what gives? nonetheless, its false advertising to say its a jaccuzzi when its a WHIRLPOOL.. HUGE difference. We hated every second and left after we ate the delivery pizza and decided this year was a bust.. thanks for ruining christmas, and taking our money. We will stick to Princess Bayside.. thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Ocean City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YoungBuckTravel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Hotel in Ocean City several times our a numerous annual trips to OCMD. The Grand is basically your average hotel within the area. It is nice and it is clean. The hotel is also in a great location on the quiet end of the boardwalk. This area is nice as it isn't as busy nor loud versus the lower end of the boardwalk with all the games and stores. The beds are comfortable and there is somewhat of a view from any of the rooms. There is also a parking garage which is nice to hopefully keep your car safe from the elements and others. The staff are nice but not unforgetable. It can be a bit pricey in the high season but is a steal in the winter time when you just need a quiet break. To put it in frank terms. This hotel is nice and comfortable. It will meet and exceed your basic needs for a room but if you are looking for something more upscale than I would recommend looking at the hilton or renting a private condo.

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast!!!”
Reviews.Author: belleno
Reviews.Content: This place was great! My husband and I stayed here at the end of September on a mid-week madness special. It was worth the drive! Our room had a great view, we got a dinner coupon worth $60. The coffee shop was open all night, which was perfect for us night owls. The girls at the front desk were so much fun. They let us know about all the spots locals go to have fun. We can not wait to come back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Sofa, No Chair??”
Reviews.Author: RayfromCarrollCounty
Reviews.Content: Good staff, lots of amenities. B U T... Where there would normally be a sofa or an easy chair with a lamp, there was a great big space! I went to the desk to inquire about the policy of no comfortable chair. She said each room was the same. I found that hard to believe. I told her that I have been all over the world and have never seen a hotel room without some kind of chair to relax and read the paper. Next day, I peeked in some other rooms being cleaned. She was right. This may be a petty nit pick but I was very dissatisfied. These folks charge up to $329 per night for the room I was in. Disclaimer, I stayed off season rate of $100. My bottom line, never again

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand!”
Reviews.Author: SBethOfPenna
Reviews.Content: This past summer my boyfriend and I stayed at the Grand for the first time. When we arrived it was such a relief to see how great the hotel was. It was really clean and had a beautiful lobby (Last year we stayed at the Howard Johnson oceanfront which was awful, this is why I said that the Grand was a relief). The hotel room was recently updated and had a huge Jacuzzi which was a great way to relax at night from the busy boardwalk. The hotel had great views not matter where u were. Although the rooms were a bit pricey, it is very typical for any hotel in Ocean City in the summer. Having stayed at a few different hotels in Ocean City, I'd have to say the Grand is the best yet. My ONLY complaint was the hotel's breakfast place. They advertised it as a buffet but it wasn't and it was very over-priced with a small selection. However, there are so many restaurants nearby so it was really no big deal. I would definitely recommend the Grand to anyone, and we are already starting to talk about next year's trip to Ocean City and the Grand!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel at this price - Ocean City is EXTREMELY Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: kittenjd2b
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, however, it has undergone a renovation. I've stayed at this hotel three years in a row now, mostly because of the price. Nice hotels in Ocean City are just TOO EXPENSIVE! This hotel is somewhat over priced as well. But it is the nicest hotel in its price range in Ocean City. Everything about this hotel is average. In past years, it was not as clean as my stay this past summer. But is was very clean this summer. The rooms are okay. Almost all have ocean views. They are also a nice size. The balconies are very old. The internet service was SHOTTY at best.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be grand”
Reviews.Author: MsFinley
Reviews.Content: This place has gone down hill seen opening. I have stayed a few times and this one will probably be the last. Our 11th floor room with a great view smelled a lot like shunk and the open closet floor was wet. After telling the staff twice with any response, one of the workers told us the roof leaks. It was presented to me as one of the best and newly renovated rooms. Oh, well... We moved to the smoking floor. That room had no classes or coffee cups or extra pillow like the first room. The kitchen lighting was dim and the balony door was a best to open. Both rooms need a good vacuuming.

Reviews.Title: “Not so "Grand"”
Reviews.Author: daisy20071960
Reviews.Content: This hotel has seen better days. It sits on prime beachfront property, yet no money has been put back into the building itself. The rooms are large, very DARK, so dark it was hard to see to iron my clothing. Dark red carpet (stained), very dark furniture (from the 80's) and dark red and green comforters on the beds, makes it so gloomy! The price refects the shape of the property. There is a new Hilton right down the road that was 289.00 per night during this same week and the rate here was about 100 bucks, my vote, pay the extra for the name brand hotel. This property is in sad shape, I just went to the 6th floor to check out the "shipwreck" restaurant, it was closed, and through the door, I could see dirt on the floor and a broken glass window inside, yes, a shipwreck.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: chestertaffy
Reviews.Content: We spent $550 for a two night stay at the hotel. We had paid for a ocean view hotel i.e grand view and got the room on 2nd floor of the hotel that has the worse view possible. The hotel design is such that the room has two balconies to the rooms on the 2nd floor. The extended balcony is not reachable and has basketballs, old shoes, beer cans, old towels on it. In addition, hunderds of sea gulls have made the extended balcony area their home for food that is thrown from upper floors of the hotel. One cannot sit on the balcony to enjoy the beach. The hotel staff is not helpful and have a standard reply that the hotel is sold out. The hotel staff including the manager needs extensive training in Customer service. Had to wake up in the middle of the night due to fire alarms. As others have described the fire alarms seem to be a regular occurence. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What Customer Service?”
Reviews.Author: krinkle77
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Ocean City Maryland in August 09. We had made reservations, 2 rooms in the middle of July to stay at the Grand Hotel towards the end of August. When we came checked in we asked for adjoining rooms, which they were not able to do, so we got our room keys & headed to our floor. Both rooms reeked like smoke. I went downstairs to ask for new rooms, was completely polite and the girl working immediately got rude & snappy & informed me that was all that was available. I showed her my reservation where we had requested non-smoking rooms with a "premier" ocean view, and told what we got. She proceeded to get even more rude, told me she couldn't do anything & walked away. I asked to speak to manager, and though the manager was more polite, he still didn't do or attempt to do one thing to remedy the situation. Also the "premier" ocean view at this hotel overlooks parking lots- u can see the ocean but their is nothing premier about it. Overall shape of hotel is like an aging grand hotel that has seen it's better days. It's not dirty or disgusting, just starting to be rundown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pahunting
Reviews.Content: Just finished another family vacation at the Grand Hotel in Ocean City. We always have a great time at this hotel, it is right on the boardwalk, 12 floors, all rooms are oceanfront with balconies. We also stayed a Tuesday night when the hotel had a private event, we actually didn't even hear anything until we stopped on the floor the event was being held, when the doormen opened the doors you could hear the music, they shut the doors and the sound was muffled again. Looked like a fun time. Actually the sound of the ice machine, elevator, and noise going on on the boardwalk, outside my room was louder, but we are in Ocean City for vacation so you have to enjoy all the sights and sounds. The lounge is decent, pizzeria has good pizza & breakfast. The best thing about hotel is the 24hour Coffee Shop. Coffee, bagels donuts, panini, everything, always a line in the morning but worth it. Hotel service is decent, once again you have to realize where you are at: a loud busy tourist town with a foreign workforce, so be patient.

Reviews.Title: “I like the Hotel, would like to give it a better rating but...”
Reviews.Author: schooner427
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, most of the rooms have a good to exellent view of the ocean, well located. The rooms themselves will need an upgrade soon. it sems as the sliding doors to the balcony all need to be serviced or repaired. My biggest problem with the Stowaway Grand is tuesday nights when they rent out the meeting room and turn it into a nightclub with extremly loud Bass that reverberates thru the hotel into all the adjoing floors until 3 am. if for any reason you wake up ,its enough to keep most people awake until they are done. the staff is very apologetic and claim there is nothing that can be done. The manager reduced my rate for that nite because I complained. I believe that if the hotel continually loses money on tues nites the management may finally get rid of the tues nite loudness. My belief is that waking guests up for something like this is one of the cardinal sins of the hotel business. We were woken up at other times the same week by the fire alarm, twice in one nite. this not being the hotels fault. once was someone smoking ciggarettes in the room. I believe they recieved a 500 dollar fine and the major cause of fire alarm emergencies would be improper use of the microwave ovens. it seems to me that someone would really have to be a bad cook to set off the fire alarm with a microwave but they claim thats there number 1 problem. Other than these problems the hotel has the potential to be real nice place, I just wish they could fix those problems and this could be a real top notch hotel in Ocean City Md.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time around, still not a good one!”
Reviews.Author: NYCMTAJOHN
Reviews.Content: 3 months ago, i booked my vacation with the grand. i originally wanted a regular room with direct ocean view. i later found out that one was available, but jacuzzi suits had direct ocean view. so i spent the extra money and booked that room. when i had checked in i had their first room, all the way to the right. barely any view, most of the view was there parking lot. i called front desk and they changed me over 6 rooms? why couldn't that be done earlier? .. note (this happened the previous year as well). after one night at the hotel we find out that the plumbing in the room was not working, then later found out the whole 12th floor had a problem, water had no pressure to make it to the 12th floor, water toilets would just stop. General Manager, told me they would fix it. 5 days 4 nights later same problem was happening, water would stop for up to 30 sec. He sent me a bottle of Champagne that i spit out because it was probably a $3.99 bottle. No refund, no refund/partial discount, nothing. Is this normal did i pay more for this? Not to mention the staff are all college/ foreign exchange students who barely speak the language. This will be my last time at this hotel, i have been going to ocean city for 15 yrs. now and will try the Marriot (brand new ), Hilton (expensive but worth it) or the Holiday in Suit (which is in- between the two). P.S. not to mention the complimentary FIRE ALARM EVACUATION AT 10:30 p.m., looks like another reoccurring problem the "GRAND" has put aside to fix.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; reviews are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: natalielovex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stowaway Grand Hotel for the fifth time this past week, and had not experienced any prior problems. The rooms have always been nice and clean; the beds always extremely comfortable, and the view impeccable for the price, this time wasn't any different. We arrived early on Sunday, and showed up at our hotel at two-thirty. Our room was not ready, which is fine, since check in time is not until four anyway. A lot of people have commented that they've showed up before four, and were not able to get in, this frustrated and "apalled" them, however, four is check in time, and I'm sure it's somewhat late since check out time isn't until 11, and I'm sure if it was any earlier, people would complain about that as well. Moving on, we went back to check out 3:00 and were able to get in. The staff was friendly, as usual, and checked us in quickly and orderly. We were able to park in a free parking lot, and there was never a lack of parking, so it was easy to get to and from the lot. Both elevators and stairs were easily accessible. The elevator was never too slow, and big enough to fit our beach cart, and luggage later on. We were on the third floor, so we just walked down the steps usually, which were as clean as a stairwell could be. The pool was nice, but unfortunately was always crowded, due to a full house the entire stay, however it was often evened out by the indoor pool. There was a huge game room, which is garenteed to keep kids happy, there is also a work out room, and stores at the bottom of the hotel, which were good if we needed supplies, or wanted to shop for beach equipment, or souvenir. The location was excellent, and directly on the Boardwalk. The one problem we had was the alarm. Around eleven, after I had already gone to bed, a fire alarm went off. My sister, who was about to fall asleep, jumped up and screamed, my mom, quickly changed and woke me up. I have to admit I didn't even hear the alarm, so have it not been for my mom and sister, I would probably not of gotten up. We were directed to go outside, our room was right across from the stairwell, which was easy, and stand outside the hotel. Police, ambulances, etc. arrived on the scene, and a few hundred hotel guests covered the parking lot and Boardwalk. Other than the alarm, the hotel was great. The staff was friendly and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Ten minutes after we checked in, we realised why we usually go to Myrtle Beach”
Reviews.Author: pkwyvet
Reviews.Content: We usually go to Myrtle Beach every year and this year we thought we would try something different. What a mistake that was. When we made reservations, we asked about their entertainment and we were told that "there is something going on here every night". They ACTUALLY had entertainment on Friday and Saturday nights only. The restraunt was closed for 2 days for a private party. Just as well though because the doors to it were filthy with fingerprints all week long so we wouldnt have eaten there anyway. The lounges, restraunts, pool bar, pizza parlor and the shops were all owned by a third party and you could not charge food or drinks to your room. (I guess they thought people go swimming with their cash and credit cards in their pockets). I asked about smoking in the lounge and instead of saying "I'm sorry sir but Maryland state law prohibits smoking inside" The bartender instead said "If you want to smoke, go outside". There were kids skateboarding in the parking garage all day Thursday, .although there was a sign saying NO SKATEBOARDING. My concern was one of them losing control and hitting my motorcycle. We also looked for the hot tub as we thought for sure that a place that called themselves a resort would have one. We were wrong. It seemed to me as if after we checked in and they billed my charge card, that's all they cared about. For over 250.00 per night, the management team should visit Myrtle Beach resorts and learn customer relations from them.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great location - great time!”
Reviews.Author: karoseyn
Reviews.Content: We called this hotel a few days before we planned our one-day trip to Ocean City. I was pleased that they did not require a minimum stay, and the woman on the phone was very pleasant while booking our reservation. We arrived hours before check-in and the woman at the desk was happy to check if our room was ready - multiple times and invited us to use the pool and facilities while we waited. The location was great - towards the end of the busier part of the boardwalk, so it was active, but not chaotic. The only thing I would change, is that the balconies had no privacy - we could see right to our neighbor's balcony and while there was a minimal barrier, someone could've walked through to ours if they really wanted to. (So, I wouldn't reccomend sleeping with the door open so you can hear the ocean) Other than that, I was very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: keyser777
Reviews.Content: I have been going to OC for over 20 years and have stayed at several different hotels. I would rank this one as one of the best values in OC. I don't really have anything negative to report regarding my stay here. If I wanted to be nit picky, there are only 4 elevators and they're not the fastest moving. Other then that, no other complaint. This hotel is a little further down (21st Street) but right on the boardwalk. It's further away from the action so its a bit more quiet. I had an ocean front view which was great. Our room was cleaned very well every day. We made some special cleaning request and our attendant, I think his name was Lazaro, handled them fine. They have an indoor pool in case it rains or if you want to get out of the sun. The outdoor pool was big enough to accommodate a lot of people and it was clean. They also had an outside pool bar. It was a bit more expensive for drinks there but about what you would expect to pay. They have a 24 hour cafe on the first floor for any late night snackers. There is a bar on the first floor for some night time entertainment. We had to call maintenance because our toilet backed up. They were there in about 5 minutes. We tipped the guy and had to call him back again about a half hour later. Tried to tip him again and he wouldn't take it. The issue was our fault - tried flushing baby wipes and they backed up. The maintenance guy was super friendly. We asked for extra pillows and got them with no issue. Probably more I could write but I would have no problem recommending this place and I'm certain next years vacation with be booked here.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaStarwolf
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from my room on the 12th floor. I love The Stowaway Grand. The views are wonderful. This is my third time back and it want be my last. The only other place I would think of staying at would be a ocean front condo with a complete kitchen. Who ever wrote the review about their rooms being smelly like cigarette and cigar smoke must have stayed on the smoking floor. My room was every clean and the bed was very comfortable. We also had high-speed wireless internet on the 12th floor for free. All-in-all our trip was the best thank you Grand. Erma

Reviews.Title: “Family-friendly hotel on the ocean with reasonable rates.”
Reviews.Author: MarcDV
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a family and kids who wanted to see the ocean, this hotel seemed reasonable and had oceanfront rooms available. Our rate was very good compared to other hotels offering the same amenities and rooms on "the strip". Although it's a little old, it was clean and kept up nicely. It's directly on the boardwalk/beach, it has indoor and outdoor pools, and it has several stores in it -- containing beachgear, clothes, souvenirs, etc. at decent prices. Our kids loved it. We would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnMaryland
Reviews.Content: For the 5th year in a row we have stayed at the Stowaway Grand Hotel. It is a great place to stay. The design of the hotel is such that almost every room has a wonderful ocean view. The only down sides are that it is very pricey and the cleaning service could do a little better job. Here's a tip..instead of getting reservations - just show up. We did and saved $100.00 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent rooms, but staff needs more training.”
Reviews.Author: dzturtle
Reviews.Content: My in-laws booked the family 4 rooms to stay for while in June. Although it rained a good portion of the time, we had plenty to do in the hotel (pool, games, pizzaria, lounge). The giant Wii screen was great, but the Wii remote bar was set so high (about 7 feet) that the kids couldn't play it (they couldn't reach their arms high enough in the air to get the remotes to work, so "family" Wii was out). The rooms were clean. Beds were fine. TV was old. Balcony was far from private (just "prison bars" to break up the balconies, you could see your neighbor and kids could squeeze through) and although it's a non-smoking hotel, the guests on the left of us smoked constantly all day long, so we smelled it indoors and out. Ug. The bathrooms were clean, but one day the maids definitely didn't clean the toilet. Sliding glass door locks didn't work on 3 out of 4 of our doors, but they had installed lock bars to use, I guess because they didn't want to replace the doors? The microwave/fridge/sink area is nice. Worst problem? The pools. The indoor pool was frigid, sort of grimy and mildewy. I watched one girl slip on the wet tile. It's like they didn't consider that large tile would get slippery when wet. The supplied towels were hard to come by. The wi-fi was non-existent on the 9th floor, something that made it very difficult for my husband who was trying to do an online class. He had to get up at 5 a.m. to go to the lobby to use the wi-fi in quiet. If your mini-van has a storage case on top, you won't fit in the garage. You have to hope there are spaces out front. If not, you have to find other parking on the street. But, the staff did allow us to use the 15 minute spaces when the garage was full one time. The outdoor pool was absolutely freezing! The ocean was warmer than this pool. The worst part? The pool deck is dangerous. If it's wet, it's a hazard. Case in point, my daughter slipped forward, pushed her two front teeth through her lower lip and split her chin open. When I realized what happened (there are no guards), I picked her up and put a towel to her face while I tried to check the damage. Another guest ran to get ice for her. Clearly the bartender knew what he was getting ice for, but never called security or risk management or anyone to assist. We finally realized she needed stitches. We asked the front desk on the way out where the nearest clinic was, and that was the only reason they knew she was injured. When we returned with 7 stitches later, security took a report. They said they would try to find the tapes, and that was that. It's a week later, and no one has called us to see how she's doing, nothing. I'm surprised at the lack of hospitality. After going to Ocean City for many, many years, we thought we had found our new hotel home. However, after this incident, we aren't sure we can trust that the amenities are safe. It seems to me that pool deck safety is hotel maintenance 101. Latex paint covered cement isn't safe to me.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good year at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: cruzans
Reviews.Content: We visit Ocean City every Summer at least once, and have found the Stoaway Grand to be the best bang for the buck. Great location - on the boardwalk away from main traffic, but close enough for easy walk to amusement area. Always pretty clean and convenient inc. a 24 hour coffee shop downstairs. Although It is nice to see new top end hotels going in like the Hilton and Marriott - I just can't justify spending $ 429.00 and up to stay at one of them at Ocean City ! We payed $ 200 a night this week - it goes up a bit in July and August., but not much. Great parking too, a huge parking garage just steps away from front door, something many don't have. We will continue to go to the Grand every time !

Reviews.Title: “Good Moderate location -three stars for location”
Reviews.Author: ctaneka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for someone who wants to be close to the action but not in the action . You can walk right to the beach and if it is raining there is the option of the indoor pool. The hotel has lots to offer such as a 24hr sweet eatery and there is a bar and spa. Where the hotel lacks is the actual room. The room is clean but not updated. So a little bit of a renovation is due. They room needs new curtains, carpet and the mattress was just ok...my husband did not get a good sleep but I slept ok. My 15yr old son snored loudly and slept as if he was home. The service was good. The front dest was friendly and helpful. It gets three stars for location if it was not for that it would have been two stars. More than likely this family would not return. We will ttry another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room was great, service left something to be desired...”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyLa
Reviews.Content: When we first got there we were pretty impressed for being Ocean City. We usually stay wherever we can get a room cheapest. When we checked in the girl behind the counter was sweet and helpful. We made it to our room and got comfy. The room was clean and neat and the view was decent (even though it was a "side-view"). The location was AWESOME! We decided to stay in the first night because we checked in late (9pm). We went down to the bar to get a couple of 6packs of beer to take to the room and the bartender barely understood what we were asking for. We even pointed out what we wanted from a printed list, and he still brought us the wrong beer. We are not the arguing type so we just shrugged it off and took what he gave us back to the room to enjoy our evening. The first morning we were there we decided to get breakfast from their resturaunt. This was a HUGE mistake. The website says they offer a buffet, which was not true. After struggling with the waiter who didn't understand much English we decided to just order breakfast and deal with it. We finally got our food and it was GROSS! the eggs were rubbery, the cheese was shrink wrapped stuff, it was all just very icky. We had originally ordered an extra side of home fries and when it didn't come with the rest of the food we inquired about it. The waiter looked at us like we were crazy then had to go get someone else to come talk to us because he didn't understand what we were asking. When we finally got it, it was the only decent thing I had from that whole breakfast. After having to get up to find our waiter to get our bill we paid and headed out for a day at the beach. The service at this hotel became the joke of the weekend and we ate all of our meals and drinks elsewhere the rest of the weekend. Overall, aside from the INCREDIBLE location, nothing else was worth the money. Next weekend we decide to hit the beach, we will probably be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Of all places I have stayed in Ocean City, THE GRAND HOTEL is my favorite!”
Reviews.Author: psmelrose92
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Ocean City, Maryland since 1979 and there were some years I went 2-3 times and some years I did not go at all. But of ALL the hotels/motels I have stayed at, the GRAND HOTEL has been my favorite and we DEFINITELY will book it on our next visit. We LOVED the whirlpool, and for the small price difference, that is something we plan to always get in the future too. The view is spectacular since all rooms with the whirlpools are on the 12th floor. Sitting out on the balcony was just awesome! Even though I would prefer it more private so that the balconies to the left & right of us were not in view, that didn't bother me too much. The big thing I really liked is how clean the room was, especially the bathroom. That is a BIG deal to me and usually rooms at the beach, or on the boardwalk seem to have almost a slight type of mildew in the room's air, but ours didn't at THE GRAND HOTEL which I again just loved!! And what a nice bathroom too. Plenty of shelf space to put all your personal products during your stay. King size bed AND very comfy! They use the plushest types of quilts that seem like they are filled with down feathers, they're just so soft. Naturally all the other little extras were there too that most places have, refrigerator, wetbar, microwave, roomsafe (we didnt use it though). Hubby & I were tickled that their coffee shop was open 24 hrs because at 2am we had a sweet craving so we went down and they have delicious pastries to choose from. Their prices are a bit high in my opinion though. Two med coffees & 4 pastries cost us $15. But it was convenient. We didn't realize until the night before we left that they also have a nice exercise room, a big game room which included shuffleboard and floor chess.........too cool!! I have no clue why someone else commented they couldn't get the internet in their room because I did the entire time I was there. The connection was Low speed, but it worked just fine for my needs, checking email and information on surrounding areas there at OC is what I used it for. I was so glad I didn't have to go to the lobby to use the internet. Just another of many reasons why we enjoyed our stay there. After telling my girlfriend about it, her & her husband plan to go in August. Yes, two thumbs up from my husband & I. Attached are some photos

Reviews.Title: “it was a great weekend”
Reviews.Author: acountsreFUNdable
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to the Grand Hotel on Memorial day weekend and had a blast! I read another review about this same weekend and I must disagree with everything said. I too had a room without carpet (2nd floor?) the room was perfectly clean and the houskeeping staff was very friendly when I asked for extra towels and blankets. My family and I interacted with other guests ( at the outdoor pool and cocktail lounge) and found everyone to be friendly. I must say that the staff at the desk was very helpful in finding us great places to eat and had a great attitude. I have to just say ITS A HOLIDAY WEEKEND PEOPLE!!! when you come down the town is going to be packed with all types of people....pull the stick out of your you know what and have a bit of fun! The grand hotel was great and we will be back....infact we booked for 4th of july when we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Lack luster effort by management to control hotel guests”
Reviews.Author: Marylandvacationer54
Reviews.Content: We made reservations at the Grand Hotel five or six months prior to staying here for Memorial Day weekend. We wanted a hotel which was on the boardwalk, and close to shoppes and restaurants. Upon arriving at the hotel, we realized that there were multiple "biker clubs" staying at the hotel, as evident of the 50+ sport bikes parked directly outside of the lobby. It was obvious this almost immediately spelled disaster, as the bikers were loud from the get-go, and one could tell they were ready to let loose. When we checked into the hotel, the front desk personnel was polite and allowed us to check into our room a few hours early, which we found convenient. However, the room we stayed in was something to be desired, as there was no carpet in the room at all, instead ceramic tile floors. The balcony doors lock was broken, so we were forced to use the safety beam against the door frames for security. The outside balcony was dirty and unclean. There were plastic bags, cigarette butts, old cigars, and miscellaneous trash scattered around the outside of our room. Needless to say, we wasn't going to take advantage of sitting on the balcony. ( 2nd floor ) Getting past the dirty balcony and the odd tiled room floor, we did enjoy the options the hotel had to offer, such as the downstairs cafe, and the shoppes directly underneath the hotel. In addition, we had hot water throughout the stay, which is always a positive. The over-all cleanliness of the room *inside* was good, as was the bathroom. However, out stay was cut 1 day/1 night short due to the rowdiness of other hotel guests. As mentioned earlier, there were apparently many "biker clubs " ( I mention biker clubs loosely, most likely closer to gangs ) staying in this hotel, which had 0 respect for other people or families staying in the hotel, or visiting Ocean City Maryland. During the day, some of the younger biker members were hanging off the balcony throwing objects, and yelling loudly at other "bikers" at a hotel across the street. They were also practicing burnouts on their bikes, blasting profane music, and simply being an annoyance to vacationers. If one were to want a good idea of what this was like, look no further than a typical frat party at a large university. (minus the kegs of beer and nudity-at least I did not witness ) There were also many annoyances of car alarms constantly going off, and horns being blown, which almost seemed to be done on purpose, just to disturb the peace of people around the area. I therefore consider it the hotels responsibility to keep this type of behavior to a minimum, either by hotel security, or by getting the Ocean City Police involved. Neither happened. The best part of our stay happened during the nights, typically from the hours of 10pm-4am. The first nights stay consisted of random noise outside; bike motors revving, music blaring, and car alarms going off. The second night however, was much worse. There was consistent noise from 12:30am, till 4am. Not only was there motorcycles doing burnouts, revving their motors outside of our room on the public street, but there were also multiple vehicles parked in the hotel parking lot blasting bass music, setting off alarms, and blowing their horns, up until 4am. We called the front office twice, asking them to take care of the situation. Each time, they apologized, stating they have called the police. After waiting for an hour and a half for the situation to die down, we decided to call the police ourselves. Longer story short; nothing was ever done to minimize the noise, or childish behavior by these bikers. This left us with the following options: 1) stay put for another evening, and put up with the "hands off" approach by the hotel and police or 2) leave a day early and get a decent nights sleep at home. We took option 2. We were hoping to obtain a refund or rain check for the one night early departure by the hotel, after telling them our experience, and how we called the front desk twice, however, their policy did not cover this. Apparently, there were at least four other couples who were complaining around the same time we were there, who were also requesting their money back for an early departure, however the hotel would have none of it. With all of the above stated, I would come to the following conclusions: 1) the hotel management was not as concerned about other customers, compared to the needs of the bikers. The bikers took up at least 50 rooms in the hotel, and I believe the hotel wants "return customers," even if it is thugs such as these. After all, what are five or six rented rooms compared to 50 bikers? 2) the hotel and/or OC police don't have the courage to uphold the law when it comes to disturbing the peace, and noise ordinances. 3) the hotel obviously went against their own policies for not enforcing policies for noise, however, they would not take consideration for the displeasure of our stay, and several complaints to the front desk. Again, the hotel management catered to the "outlaw" thuggish behavior of the bikers, rather than family oriented travelers. All in all, the only way I would recommend this hotel, is if there aren't any special events happening in the hotel, and if you as a guest are willing to take a chance of not needing anything but a hotel room to stay in, with no expectations of hotel security or catering to you as a guest. I would also recommend not staying in some of the 2nd floor rooms, unless the hotel decides to clean up the balconies, and does something about the room flooring.

Reviews.Title: “not a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: kris123Maryland
Reviews.Content: we went to oc for the easter holiday. It was fine to start. But. the it went down hiil. the rooms need a to be fixed up. Wallpaper coming off the wall. we had had to a broken shower. we called down to the front desk. they said they would send someone up to fix it. but the never did come. when we called a second time they said they said they came up. but no one was there. Why they just did not fix it then i will never know. should we have waited there all night . they then said we could change rooms but with 2 young kids sleeping and alot of stuff that would not be easy. when we talked to the front desk when we left. they said to call our charge card and let them deal with it. no sorry or would you like to see my manager. i still think that they never did come up to the room to fix the shower. When we asked if they knew any place that would have easter dinner the gave us a paper with a list . but had no clue if they were open on easter. If you want people to stay there on easter weekend i think you should know things like that for your guests that are staying there. so i will be staying at another hotel next year. the have bad service. and the rooms are not that clean. unless you complain ,.oh and if you want the internet they say they have it but you can not get a signal in your room. so you will have to go down to the lobby. just to get one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CheerFan
Reviews.Content: Came in for the Cheerleading Competition. Great rates, beautiful room with oceanview, quiet, great parking, right on the ocean/boardwalk. Coming back for the Competition in 2009!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place, never again, Bug in coffee, No hot water all Weekend”
Reviews.Author: dpascoe
Reviews.Content: We had two room the weekend of January 16-18th, for a baby shower we were giving for our neice who lives in DE for 20 yrs and works in OC 20 yrs , WHOM IS SHARING OUR EXPERIENCE WITH HER CLIENTS, HOTEL OWNERS, MANAGERS, and RESTURANT OWNERS, ETC. and we travel to OC and stay in hotels in OC quite frequently, we live near the Baltimore area, AA co. We have stayed in many OC hotels, Princess Royale, Carousel, Fenwick, HoJo's Oceanfront Plaza, Quality Inn Boardwalk, Holiday Inn Oceanfront, Dunes Manor, Cayman Suites, Bonita Beach, Econo-Lodge Oceanblock, Sahara, Flamingo, Comfort Inn, Best Western Flagship, I mean many hotels this is just some,and this was the WORST BY FAR. I had a bug in my coffee when we finally got service in the resturant, they said, Oh, sorry. They said we had no hot water the whole stay because everyone was using it at the same time in the mornings, so I was ill during the night and had to take a bath at 3:00 a.m.and NOT HOT WATER THEN EITHER, I am positive the whole hotel was not using hot water at 3:00 am. JUST A HORRIBLE PLACE, DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand”
Reviews.Author: mimi598
Reviews.Content: I am surprised to see some of the bad reviews written on this page! My wife and I (and our neighbors... we talked to them in the elevator) had an excellent stay. We stayed on a busy weekend, when the hotel was booked to capacity with a bunch of screaming kids. I was concerned about getting sleep, but the hotel staff had it under control. They implemented a curfew for the kids and we slept peacefully. We had a nice ocean view at a reasonable price. We loved the 24 hour coffee shop and the lounge on the first floor! Even though we came in January, the staff knew what to do and where we should go. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Horrible Beds”
Reviews.Author: acmomo
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the hotel last weekend. The hotel location is great and ocean view from the room was awesome. The room was clean and spacious; but with older bedding / furnishings. The major downside was that the beds were uncomfortable and pillows hard -- ended up with back pains each day.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edgeduller
Reviews.Content: Positives: Room was a nice size. View was exceptional Great Location Negatives: Outdated interiors and linens Bathrooms need renovations Below avarage and expensive food Carpet near balcony got wet from rain

Reviews.Title: “Way Outdated”
Reviews.Author: TaxChick
Reviews.Content: This hotel may have once been "grand" but the time has passed. The rooms are large but lacking in amenities. The mattress feels old and the pillows flat. Instead of sitting at the desk to work, I had to hover by the door to my room to connect to the Internet. The balconies do not have solid dividers so you are looking into your neighbor's space and the "furniture" on the balconies consists of cheap plastic chairs. The view of the ocean is beautiful but, unfortunately, I couldn't see it because there was condesation trapped inside the sliding door and blocking any view out. There was even an envelope requesting a tip for the maids! I'm not sure about the value for the money issue as I was not paying for the room but the hotel left much to be desired. I have to believe there are better places to stay in OC.

Reviews.Title: “RUN THE OTHER WAY!”
Reviews.Author: ThePrincessPa
Reviews.Content: Actually, my husband and I have stayed at the Grand for the last six years-due to the location. As the years have gone by, the Grand has started to go downhill. WAY DOWNHILL!! This year we made our reservations SIX MONTHS in advance. We requested a certain room. After being a hotel guest for five years I didn't think that was unreasonable. We also sent a letter a month prior to vacation-again requesting the room. We also called a week prior-again making sure our request was noted and also to find out what our FINAL balance was.So to make a very long story short-we did not get the requested room, we had to stay in one room one night and then move. We paid our balance(which was the SAME AMOUNT we were told it would be when we spoke to them a week earlier). But the next day were told they "didn't think they charged us enough". Yet after the girl at the desk had three tries with a calculator and still couldn't come up with the same amount twice, she said "we'll get back to you". So we went on to enjoy our vacation, and at no time did anyone from the hotel ATTEMPT to contact us regarding any rate dispute. But when we got our credit card bill the next month-they had placed an additional $178 on our card. Management at the Grand had more than suffecient time to let us know of any "undercharge" Like the six months from the time we booked our vacation up to our arrival. Or the WEEK we were there. Yet they chose not to say a word-just put the charge on our card. I feel this is inexcusable and unprofessional! Perhaps they need to get new management, or desk clerks that actually speak and understand english! Also the day we were checking in there were two women there who could not get into their rooms. Turns out THEY WERE BOTH BOOKED INTO THE SAME ROOM!! To top it off THERE WAS SOMEONE ALREADY IN THE ROOM!! I hope the Grand enjoyed that extra $178 cause it's the last money they'll ever get from us! Next year you'll find us at the Princess Royale:)

Reviews.Title: “Better check-in without reservation”
Reviews.Author: iam4pennst8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand Hotel on 2 prior occasions, due to the convenient location. I am sorry to say that, on this trip, I have explored alternative accommodations, as the service on this particular vacation were at an all-time low. First, we arrived at OC,MD around 2:00pm and was told that our room was not ready. So, I suited up my young kids and we all trekked to the beach while my Mother stayed back waiting the official word that our room was ready. She asked the reception desk for status updates on our room and was repeatedly told, "Maam, It's not ready yet." Suddenly, a gentleman from NY walked in asking if the hotel had any vacancy. The receptionist confirmed that there was vacancy and the gentleman was told that the room was ready for immediate check-in. Unbelievable!!! So, does the Grand Hotel inconvenience their reservation guests, knowing that we are a "sure-thing." I think it should be the other way around! Immediate check-in granted for those with reservations---for those without reservations, if you get lucky enough to find a hotel with vacancy then you should expect to wait. Good grief!! This was enough to deter me from ever returning here in the future. My second disappointment was the housekeeping service. No housekeeper touched our room until after 4:00pm, so we simply helped ourselves to clean towels from the housekeeping cart on a daily basis. We never had our carpets vaccumed or our beds changed the whole time, yet we saw 3-4 non-English speaking housekeepers conversing in the hallways routinely. Lastly, while trying to get ready for dinner and sweating profusely in our room, we discovered that the A/C was not working. We called the front desk and was told that the entire building's A/C system was not working. We were so uncomfortable since we were unable to come back to our room to cool off after a day in the sun, that we left 2 days earlier than anticipated. The girl at check-out was wonderful and granted us full refund on the 2 days that we intended to stay & even gave us a full refund on the previous day for having to sleep in an sweaty room. This was much appreciated, but I am sad to report that this whole experience resulted in the Grand losing me as a loyal patron. I know good help is hard to find, but something must be done to turn things around.

Reviews.Title: “No 'WOW" factor”
Reviews.Author: loveisbliss
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to OC. It is a very expensive destination in comparison to Virginia Beach or Myrtle Beach, but we wanted to give it a second try. We travel extensively and I always research hotels prior to making my decision. Because I felt that I had "did my homework" before choosing our hotel, I really want to share our experience. Upon check-in, the level of customer service was poor. Only 1 of 3 agents understood English and their computer system. This made for an extremely long line at 3:00. Our room was very average. It was a decent size, however the bathroom was extremely small. The door had no hooks on the back so there was no place to put your clothes. The mini-kitchen in the room was very handy; although this is standard in most beach hotel rooms. The balcony came with two chairs BUT no table. Very inconvenient. Our room was cleaned very late in the day every day but once, I had to call for housecleaning because at 5:30 they still have not come. Pros of the facility: Common areas very clean Location on boardwalk; ample parking Cons of the facility: Poor customer service No tables in pool area or on balconies Disgusting indoor pool On our third night there, the fire alarm went off at 2am and again at 7am. Is this the fault of their system, or of a stupid individual. Who knows? BUT it sure was annoying. Would we return again to OC? Definately not. The boardwalk games and rides were extremely expensive. You definately get "more for your buck" at VA Beach or Myrtle. If we were to return, my #1 choice for accommodations would be The Breaker's Hotel. We went and looked at that hotel and the staff was most pleasant and the rooms were really nice. Good luck in your vacation planning!!

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else - Book Earlier Than I Did”
Reviews.Author: kaaala
Reviews.Content: we booked at last minute and paid a large amount of money for a room with just two queen beds. Pros -- location - right on boardwalk and ocean -- shops right there and good pizza place Cons- many -- first and foremost I paid extra for an oceanfront room with large balcony -- ONLY to find that the balconies were all adjoining and you can see your neighbors on either side. I like my privacy! that is why I paid more money to have oceanfront -- the view was beautiful, but totally ruined by the fact that EVERY time we went out on to the balcony there were people to our right and left - would not stay there again - I had wanted to stay at the Commander on 14th, but it was booked, that I would recommend having stayed there two years ago NEXT - I agree about the internet service - we had to sit in the lobby with the computer to be able to get service!!! BIg negative - maid totally forgot a couple days to clean our room! The front desk is an absolutely mess - there are not enough people there at all times to wait on guests and DON'T check in around 4PM it will take you probably 45 mintues to get upstairs with your luggage due to the back up at the elevators My suggestion is to go elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: scooper0221
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from several days & nights at the Grand. We got a great rate from discounted website. Initially were disappointed that we were unable to get an non-smoking room but we understood that upon booking thru the discounted service that room type was not guaranteed. (NOTE to Management : Please consider converting additional rooms to non-smoking. While we were checking in, we saw & heard 3 other parties also request non-smoking but were total the Grand had "run out.") Despite having a smoking room, there was only a trace of lingering smoke smell. Plus the manager quickly sent up 8 new pillows to replace the bed pillows which also freshened up the room. Didn't even notice the hallway being smokey -- maybe the floor was full of other non-smokers like us who were also stuck in smoking rooms. The room was generous in size, with 2 queen beds. The beds were very comfortable, complete with double sheeting. I think I read that the mattresses were replaced this summer, it seemed so to me. Minor flaw was no fan in bathroom, it got rather hot/stuffy in there after 4 showers. There were plentiful thick cotton towels which also seemed new. The room and common areas were very clean, I'm always impressed when a beach hotel does this good of job keeping the sand out. The mini-kitchen area was handy, plenty of counter space and separate sink area. While we were mostly on the beach, we went to the outdoor pool a couple of times. The pool was very clean, with lots of available seating and pool towels. It was not very crowded while we were there. The kids enjoyed game room but said that 2 or 3 games were not working. We only ate at the coffee shop and pizza shop on the 1st floor. Both are very convenient. I thought the coffee shop was reasonably priced and the coffee/pastries were fresh and tasty. The pizza place was a bit overpriced and the food typical -- I guess you are paying for the boardwalk location. Staff were pleasant and helpful when asked any questions. When we needed extra shampoo and coffee, it was quickly brought up to our room and we were given extra. Minor complaint about non-working room key cards, we had to have them replaced at least 4 times in 4 days. Again, the staff was helpful and very quick to replace the keys but maybe they should change or upgrade their system? Overall, our stay was excellent. We had stayed here about 4 or 5 years ago and I was a little concerned beforehand based on some of the more recent reviews on this site. But overall we were very pleased -- I would still put the Grand in the top 10 of Ocean City hotels based on location, cleanliness & comfort, service and amenities. We have stayed practically everywhere nice in OC (except at the Hilton) and would gladly return to the Grand especially with the competitive pricing they offered. For comparison, the Days Inn next door quoted rates that were over $100 greater than what we paid at the Grand.

Reviews.Title: “WAS A NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: tomdebcait
Reviews.Content: We planned a quick vacation for 3 days, we came across The Grand Hotel thur ocean city's website.The rooms were very clean, they had everything that you needed in the room. the rooms were very nice. Every room in the hotel has a view of the boardwalk and the ocean. (side view or ocean front) There were 2 pool 1 outside and 1 inside. The outside pool was very nice it had a pool bar. they say that you could also order food there but the 2 diffrent days that we tried we were told that they were too busie to order (overpriced)food. The inside pool was nice but smelled too much like bleach. They have a breakfast buffet on the six floor, Pass it up the food is awful (my kids would not eat it the food was not hot, luke warm) also when you walked out side of the hotel (entrance from parking lot) the smell of trash was overwellming. They keep ther dumpsters inside two overhead doors.

Reviews.Title: “loved it here!!!”
Reviews.Author: nj2oc
Reviews.Content: this was a wonderful and clean hotel to stay at! i would recommend getting a room with tile floors. that is what we had and i found it much cleaner then having a carpet! we had a great view of the ocean and the staff was helpful and friendly! i didn't try any of the restaurants at the hotel but the bar had a good selection!!! i got the mudslide super good! needless to say me and my boyfriend had a great time here good location! oh one more thing there is this breakfast place called The ------ Skillet i can't remember the first part of it but we had the best breakfast ever!!! try the strawberry blitz it was excellent!!! hope this helped!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “The Grand”
Reviews.Author: jmo488
Reviews.Content: My family and I come to ocean city every year for a family vacation. We decided on the grand because we have stayed here before and loved it. The first kink was when we called for extra pillows and they said they ran out of extra pillows...which i find very hard to believe. I think they just did not want to bring them to us. Then, the first night we where there the fire alarm rung at about 1:30 a.m. We all left our room and waited outside with the other hotel guests for about 15 minutes. We received no apology, and continued to be awoken by false alarms twice again throughout the night. This hotel has gone down hill, the staff is not friendly, and the money would be better spent somewhere else. The only good thing is the location on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - But could be better!”
Reviews.Author: fun41
Reviews.Content: Positives - Clean room. Great location on the boardwalk and Near Phillips crab house which has a grat buffet. Million dollar view from Premeire Oceanfront Room. Kids loved Indoor/Outdoor Pool (although short on Towels, Chairs and could use Umbrellas) . Ample parking and luggage carts. Cons - Late check in (4:00). Tried to check in early but rooms not ready. The pool is open to the public, and advertised on the front and back as such. You pay big money for your room, but anyone can use the pool - Boo!. Whatever you do don't get the breakfast buffet. You will be bitter if you do. Lastly, stores located in the building are a little shady. The beach shop would not do a return on a broken umbrella ($45.00) the day earlier. I asked the manager at the hotel if they could help. He said he would see what he could do, but never go t back to me. Lastly, Pizza place in hotel dosen't take credit cards and does not serve free water with meals. You have to by bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Experience”
Reviews.Author: edwoodCalifornia
Reviews.Content: An extremely dissapointing experience. The hotel lounge/bar was showing xxx pornography during evening hours. When asked to change the programming, our requests were denied. The hotel manager claimed no responsibility or authority to aid in the situation. We do not recommend any families to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place ... with some concerns”
Reviews.Author: lasoul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Grand Hotel on 21st St. & Boardwalk, OC, Maryland over the July 4 holiday. We booked last minute thru Expedia.com and save over $60/nite over booking with the hotel directly. My husband and his work crew lived at The Grand for 3 months in 2005 and we visited often. Took a few mini trips after that so we knew what to expect. For those who complain "oceanfront is not oceanfront", oh yes it is. If you look at my two pics and the photos of the hotel on it's own website and those of other travelers, you'll see that all rooms are oceanfront but some are more oceanfront than others. Since we arrived late we were given probably the worst view in the place, near the end on the side on the 5th floor and the view was still wonderful. "Grand View" rooms are cheaper and "Premier View" rooms are full front facing and higher floors. If you have a balcony, you have a nice view of the beach. Good points: The view. This hotel sits directly on the boardwalk at 21st Street. Not too busy and noisy. Rooms start on the 2nd floor so no street noise really. Unless you have a king suite, the beds are queen-size, perfect for those with kids who don't like to sleep together. Rooms are roomy with 2 queen beds, a kitchenette, table for 2, a desk and a large balcony. Baths are small and the vanity is inside the bath. Hotel has indoor pool and outdoor pool with a bar. Restaurants and shops downstairs and another lounge. BEST PART: a parking garage. No hunting for parking spots so you don't have to worry about leaving the place in your vehicle. Bad Points: The outdoor pools is advertised with signs several areas on The Grand property as being "open to the public". Yep, you pay all that money and have to hob-knob with locals off the beach. Outdoor pool doesn't have enough chaise lounges and you have to walk thru the bar area to get to the pool. I had to take my two kids thru a sea of "guys" who were drinking and smoking. I can't take my kids into the lounge downstairs but must take my kids thru a bar to get to the pool. The indoor pool, which has always been very nice in the past, was a dump. We visited only one evening. Chairs were all over the place, dirty towels all over the chairs, trash on the floor and big puddles of water on the floor. Water was very cloudy and "icky" looking I didn't get in and washed my kids' suits after we got back to the room. The security camera probably filmed me straightening the chairs. I moved the chairs back into place while my husband asked someone to get clean towels (there were none). Towels came quickly but nobody made an attempt to clean the area. Gross. Yes it was a holiday weekend, but The Grand should have made arrangements for proper staff to maintain it's image. The room: We were in a nice room, but the wooden furnishings were a bit banged up. A can of Min-Wax stain would turn the knicks in the cabinets, chairs and dresses looking like new. Beds were very comfy. The carpet was "wavy", probably just needed restretched. The patio doors were huge but one was either dirty or it's seal was broken because it had a big cloud on it. You pay for the view, right? Housekeeping: Minimal. Someone could have cleaned the patio doors. We were there 3 nights and the girl never once cleaned the sink bowls in our bathroom or the kitchenette. Yeah, it was our toothpaste but isn't that her job? Also, bottled water is supposed to be left every day - it never was. My husband left a tip one day, just as a test, to see if the service would get better. Nope. Finally, at 4:30 A.M. on our check out date, we received a phone call from The Grand. It was a recording of the services and ammenities offered by The Grand. The same recording you might expect if you were placed on hold when calling the hotel. At 4:30 in the morning? Did I complain about these things while I was actually at The Grand? No, I did not. Why? Because in this world today, you never know who will retaliate. Like many hotels these days, The Grand has taken to hiring from overseas. Sometimes when you complain that someone doesn't do their job, they retaliate. Sounds crazy, but it's true. Today I sent my customer survey to The Grand, along with a letter explaining my position on thier hotel. I would stay there again, but during off-season. Never again at full/fool price. By the way .... July is a great time to visit Ocean City. Never EVER visit OC in June. The high school seniors take over and those immature drunk people will ruin your vacation. I highly recommend PGN Crab House on 30th Street across from Jolly Rogers. It's a hole in the wall if there ever was one but their all-you-can-eat crabs are DEE-licious! Have a great time wherever you stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jazzyjess816
Reviews.Content: For the time being, the car ride wasn't that bad...but as for the hotel, i would give it a 2/10 ( 2 out of 10).. so we get in around check in time..and there is a huge line..you need your car to be registered too (don't forget)...nobody at the checkin desk spoke english...so it took forever...finally we got our room, and it wasn't even clean...ok so this really nice maid comes and cleans the room when it is not even her room to clean, and then this guy comes up and is like yelling at us to get out of the room...and then he got on his hands and knees, and was like begging for us to forgive him..hahaha... it was halarious you had to of been there...thats not all though...he tells us that we didn't check in yet, but we did cause my dad just paid $2,000 to rent this room for my sisters softball tornament...we asked that all the softball teams girls rooms would be next or even close to each other, but that didn't happen either...different floors, once we got setteled we wanted to go onto the balcony, because...like who wouldn't..and then the dor wouldn't open..so we called the front desk and they called maintnence, well 2 days later my dad gets it open, and the next day maintnence comes and he doesn't speak english, so we didn't need him any more, he didn't understand ..ohh well..it was a terriblre experience.. if you go....then HAVE FUN....You'll want your money back...

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ncvikings
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Grand the week of June 9-12, 2008 and we were very impressed. First of all, the room rate was an unheard of $109 per night!! I saw this price advertised online and thought it was a mistake, so I called the hotel directly. No mistake -- and no hesitation to book the room either!! I am so glad we did. Even at the regular rates, this place is worth the money. The hotel is beautiful, very clean and I was told it's only about 8 years old. A large, open, luxurious lobby greets you. Check/in went very smoothly. Our large, nicely appointed room was located on the 5th floor and had a beautiful ocean view from the balcony, two queen beds, and a kitchenette. The bathroom was a bit cramped but clean. Two pools, a salon, a workout room, 24 hour coffee shop, several little stores and an ice cream place were all right there at the hotel or right outside the doors. A few short steps from the elevator and your feet hit the boardwalk and beach, which was one of the cleanest we've seen. There was limited parking right outside the hotel and a huge parking garage just steps away from the front door. The only negatives that I can mention are few and wouldn't deter us from booking there again. We had asked for fresh towels and never got them, so I had to go to the front desk for those. Also, after the second day of our stay, we had put the maid service sign on the door but no one ever came for that either. Not sure what the deal with that was. Also, the restaurant in the hotel seemed to never be open. Overlooking this beautiful hotel would be a mistake if you are searching for comfort, cleanliness and the desire to be close to everything. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Was Very Happy with Stay”
Reviews.Author: stavos
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that for a 3 star hotel I was very happy. My friend and I went on a golf vacation weekend and stayed in adjoining rooms. The rooms were big. clean and they all seem to have a great view. More then I have hoped for. I have stayed at 4 and 5 star hotels all over the world and this place was very comfortable. They have a nice restaurant for breakfast on the 6th floor were we stayed and had a great sports bar downstairs that we both had many beers in while shooting pool and waching Flyer/Caps game. The location of hotel is great being on the boardwalk and check in is super easy. We also went to Fagers Island for food and party and the bands there were really good. I gave this place 5 stars because for a 3 star hotel it was perfect. Will be back with my wife next time. ( Maybe ) :)

Reviews.Title: “Great fun in Ocean City, Maryland”
Reviews.Author: MoJo10
Reviews.Content: Every summer, my husband and I stay at the Grand Hotel in Ocean City, Maryland. We have been going there for five years in a row and will continue to in the future! Our favorite part of the hotel is the pool bar along with the convenience of walking to some of the night life's hot spots! I would HIGHLY recommend going to Fishtales and Seacrets if you visit Ocean City, Maryland. Fishtales is within walking distance of the hotel and to get to Seacrets you can either take the "drunk bus" or drive the short distance. The Grand Hotel offers a very family friendly atmosphere and is on the boardwalk. Each year, we end up getting rooms with ocean view balconies although we’ve never asked for one – very nice surprise! Parking is free and is in a parking garage next to the hotel. There are tons of restaurants to eat at along the main strip and Philip’s Buffet is right next to the hotel. Seacrets is arguably the best bar/night club on the East Coast! Drink and float on a water tube during the day and dance your shoes off at night! I would recommend this hotel for bachelor and/or bachelorette parties, too. I would also recommend this hotel for families since there seem to be a lot of them during the summer months. There is definitely something for everyone between the beach, the boardwalk, golf, mini-golf, bars, pool, and so much more! I also would like to mention that each room has a microwave and refrigerator that is very convenient. I have to confess that the Hilton in Ocean City is probably the BEST HOTEL THERE!.... if you can afford it!!!
