But if you can’t afford the $400 a night with a 3 night minimum….then settle for the Grand Hotel. You won’t be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “If I had to pay, I wouldn't stay”
Reviews.Author: Jinxs-Mom
Reviews.Content: I cannot comment on the price because the company paid for it. Wireless Internet - Connecting to it depends on where you are. I was on the 10th floor, did not get it. Another conference attendee was on the 5th floor & could not connect. Another conference attendee was on the 7th floor & COULD get it. You can receive the connection in the lobby areas, but then you deal with the traffic in the lobby. Room - The bathroom and kitchen area were clean. The remainder of the room was average in cleanliness. Sleeping on the beds was awful! Our daughter tosses a lot. We knew every turn by the sound of the bedsprings. Luckily we had a sound machine and cranked the volume up! Hotel staff at desk was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vaiil01
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. Great value with very clean and well kept rooms and facilities.Couldn't ask for much better at the beach. Coffee shop open 24hrs where you can get just about anything to eat such as bagels, donuts, pizza, ice cream, sandwiches, drinks,etc.Good accomodations in the room but could use one more lamp and a comfortable lounging chair. Had one problem with teenagers at 3:00AM which took Security too long to respond. Aside from that problem I would definitely stay there again. Very nice and on the beach. Good parking in front of building and with an undercover dropoff area. Parking garage only a short walk across street. Courteous workers.

Reviews.Title: “everything that we needed and more”
Reviews.Author: fvalenches
Reviews.Content: When my group arrived to start our golf vacation, we were thoroughly impressed. The rooms were beautiful, the staff was great, and the ammenities were spectacular. I booked this hotel since it was on the boardwalk. I never realized all that the Grand Hotel had to offer. We enjoyed the nightclub, which made it alot safer for us to enjoy a few cocktails after our rounds of golf. The 24 hour coffee shop was a delight all by itself. This is the place that we all would gather in the morning get a cup of coffee and then get on the road to our golf course destination. Iwould strongly recommend the Grand Hotel to everyone I know and any and all who ask me where to stay while in Ocean City. I am putting together another golf trip for my gang of misfits and the Grand Hotel is at the top of the list for accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dfs567
Reviews.Content: Every year my family goes to OC in January and again in March for the children's birthdays. We always book two rooms for my sister's family and my own. We had just checked into the Grand, with minor problems, we always request adjoining rooms and that seems to be a small problem for this hotel, but, the fire alarm and sprinkler system had gone off on our floor and to be precise in the room right next to mine and my sisters, we waited patiently while the staff was in the room where the sprinkler originally went off, the carpeting in our rooms were soaked as was some of our luggage and kids toys, etc. We waited about 1/2 hour and I finally went and asked one of the staff what to do about our rooms, they barely made eye contact as they sent me to the front desk. Once at the front desk, they acted as though it was my problem, after some convincing they gave us two new rooms, but, made no gesture to help us move our luggage or belongings, When I told the manager it would be nice to be comped an additional nights stay either during this stay or for our stay that was pending for March. They told me that they could not do that. We booked two rooms at the very least (4) times a year and they could not offer any compensation for our inconvenience. I was very very disappointed in management at that point and we have begun staying at a different resort at the Ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: melace112
Reviews.Content: Great deal for the money. This hotel is comperable to a nicer holiday inn. I would reccomend this to someone who does not want to spend the money to stay at the Hilton, but doesnt want to stay at a local hotel because you don't know what you will get. Hotel is round which is nice because everyone has some sort of view. Clean carpets, new bathrooms, and fresh linens make this a place worth staying. Nice size rooms and internet access in most rooms. Nice Coffee shop and gift shop in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: mistressm_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely a two-star hotel, but having spent almost $300 per night, I expected more. We had to clean the room a bit before settling in- table was never wiped off and had food and stains on it; floor was a bit dirty and if you walked barefoot on it, your feet turned black, one bed's bedding was stained. Kitchen area was good though. The condition of the room needs improvement. Unfortunately, we were located on the second floor near the pools and there was an extended roof by our balcony where guests continually threw food that the seagulls would fight over. Every morning we were woken to the loud sounds of twenty or so birds fighting. We couldn't even leave our balcony door open or they could come in. We had a lovely view of the ocean, but couldn't step out onto our balcony for fear of food dropping on us. Guests were throwing everything from chips to salad for the birds. Called the front desk and they said they would send someone out to take care of it, but they never did. The guests in the rooms near us were partying and smoking in the hallways at all hours, had to step over them in the hall to get to our room a few times. They would bring their chairs and bedding from their rooms and set up their party in the hallway. Guests were walking around the hotel drunk and naked. This would have been extremely annoying if we had spent any real time in our room, but since we were hardly there it was only mildly so. Besides the front desk, there is no hotel personnel anywhere. The beds are most uncomfortable. The good thing about the hotel is the location. This hotel needs to seriously lower their prices to reflect the service you receive.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Catny
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in Ocean City, Maryland where we stayed at The Grand hotel. The hotel itself was very nice. The rooms were clean and were kept clean while we stayed there. The room had a nice view and met our needs as far as the kitchen area. When I booked the hotel I had requested a non smoking room, but when we arrived I was given a smoking room. When I told the girl at the desk that I had requested a non smoking room, she advised me that it was just that a request and was not guaranteed . I was a little taken by that, but she then gave me a non smoking room. So why the hard time, I wondered!! Our second night in the hotel we were woken to a fire alarm and had to leave the hotel....pj's and all. Only to find it was a false alarm due to someone burning popcorn in their room. There was no apology or compensation from the hotel what so ever. The resturant on the 6th floor that I had read about by other review had complained that it was not opened. Well it was opened, but only for breakfast. The food was terrible and was costly!! Not worth it!! Though the hotel was nice, the class of people was not up to par. But I guess that was where you get what you pay for........

Reviews.Title: “It served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: fybr01
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Grand Hotel from Aug 28-Aug 30 for a quick getaway. The hotel is what is it. But is served its purpose for the 2 nights we were there. The positives: the location (walking distance from the Boardwalk and the beach), the hotel seems to have everything (clothing stores, salon, ice cream parlor, pizza place) on its premises. The negatives: not the cleanest, no wifi in the rooms (only available in the lobby--how ghetto is that!!), you can't connect DVD or video games console to the TV for the rare moment you want to stay in and watch movies, their restaurant only serves breakfast, the rooms have 2 queen sized HARD beds (king size is not an option). All in all, our stay was overall OK but could be better. We won't be staying here on our next OC excursion.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value; Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dewhee32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Aug 19-21 and had a nice room on the 6th floor. The room was very spacious, large bathroom, and nice area outside of the bathroom with "kitchen sink", countertop, cabinets, and microwave. This was an unexpected plus since we had our 7month old baby with us. We had no real complaints about the place, except for the food at the breakfast restaurant. The spa service (massage) was excellent, and the hotel location is good as well. Our friend was in a room on the 2nd floor, and while the size was the same, her room was tiled, and not carpeted like ours upstairs. I did prefer the carpet. Her view was the roof of the stores below, so definitely higher is better. When she complained at the desk, they told her it was b/c she did not book directly through the hotel (she used Orbitz, just as the others in our parties did), and there was nothing they could do about it b/c they were filled to capacity. She was not amused by their reasoning. The rest of us who used Orbitz were on the 6th floor and had no problems. For Ocean City, I think The Grand is worth serious consideration.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price !”
Reviews.Author: cruzans
Reviews.Content: When going to Ocean City Maryland, you don't have many "great" hotels unless you want to pay $ 600.00 + per night to stay at the new Hilton ! Basically you look for the best of the "beach hotels" and realize you are basically just sleeping there - lol. We have stayed at the Princess Royale, The Dunes, The Carousel, The Atlantic, and this year The Grand because it had the best price ( $ 169.00 a night ), a great location ( 21st Street ) and based on seeing the hotel, we figured we would give it a try. We were happy overall, and if we can get a great deal again next year, we will go again. We have a father/daughter vacation every Summer, and we were both happy with the hotel. Again, you're not getting a 5 star hotel, and my wife would never stay there, but we thought the room was a nice size, overall clean, and a great location. As another reviewer wrote, no privacy on decks which is a bummer - but again, our time in the room was to sleep only - if you are looking for a more romantic getaway, probably not the best to have fun. Outdoor pool was adequate, indoor pool a bit "stuffy", never got to the resteraunt. 24 hour coffee shop was convenient. All in all, if you are looking for the best bang for your buck, and just want a fairly clean place to crash - The Grand was very good !

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: feiler47
Reviews.Content: I'm a 54 year old woman who went for a week in July with my mother as a special birthday treat for myself. The first night (Saturday) we were on the 2nd floor and the noise was horrible. Doors slamming, people yelling in nearby rooms, etc. Sunday we asked to be moved and apparently there was only one room available at "our rate" and we would be called when it was available. We waited all day, checking in occasionally to see if we could move and for some reason it took until my 5:30 call to get the other room. That was basically 2 days of my vacation! Then the voice mail didn't work, the iron didn't work (took two calls and several hours to get an iron!) Amenities were not left by the cleaning service so we had to track down the maid's cart several times to get shampoo, etc. I wrote to the hotel with my complaint and received no reply. I wrote to the management company and received no reply. Bottom line is I spent over $1,400 for the room, money in the restaurant, money in the salon and money in the shops. Next time I'll know better and spend my money where I am appreciated as a customer.

Reviews.Title: “ripped of at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: alg951
Reviews.Content: For the last 4 years we have stayed at the Grand while at Ocean City. We have always had such a pleasant experience while staying there. We never had any complaints until this year. We arrived at the Grand on July 15. The next day as we were all getting ready to leave, we took time and put all our suitcases in one place and hid our purses in the draws like we do every year. Later that night we all went back to the hotel and got changed and went out to eat and do some shopping. When my daughter opened her purse to pay for something she found out she was missing $80. At first we just thought she misplaced her money and did not think anything about it, but decided we better all check our wallets. I was missing $70, my son was missing $30 and his friend was missing $40. Altogether we were missing $220! Whoever did it did not remove all the money, just took some out of each wallet, maybe hoping that no one would notice. We immediately went to find the manager because the only other person in our room besides ourselves was their maid service. We told the front desk that we had money stolen from our room. She said that they were not responsible. We asked to see a manager, but she said there was not one available. Finally after waiting at the front desk and asking about 3 people we finally got to talk to the manager, Mario. He said that they would investigate and get back to us and directed us to security. The security guard asked us a few questions and said that he would be talking to their employees and get back to us. We never heard from them again. Anytime we wanted to find out anything we went to them. They always had some excuse like we haven’t talk to everyone yet. After two more days of getting the run around we decided to leave and get a room somewhere else. We moved to the Holiday Inn on the boardwalk to finish out our vacation. (Note: Holiday Inn did everything they could to make the rest of our stay pleasant. There was also a safe in the room!) We just want everyone to know that if they choose to stay at the Grand do NOT leave anything of value in the room. And if you are as unlucky as we were, you need to know that you will not get any help from the hotel manager and/or the staff and you will feel like they are pointing fingers at you!

Reviews.Title: “"Ocean Front" doesn't mean "Ocean Front"”
Reviews.Author: sben33
Reviews.Content: Overall-ok hotel. The biggest issue for us was that we asked specifically for "oceanfront" when making the reservation. We got into the room and was disappointed to find that it was ocean view. Fortunately, the manager gave us a discounted rate and offered to move us into an oceanfront room. We were told that oceanfront rooms are called "premiere" rooms. I suggested they train their people taking the reservations to advise their guests about this or change the name descriptions.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel In OC”
Reviews.Author: virgo22
Reviews.Content: Worst Customer Service EVER!!!! Mario (The Manager) cannot handle any situations. Room service does not come till 4:30. Personnel around the hotel is rude. There is no privacy in the balconies. You can hear what happens in the rooms next door. Enough Said!!!! Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a upgrade”
Reviews.Author: TLHT
Reviews.Content: The beds are poor quality, bouncy with squeaky box springs. We put our mattress in the floor to try and sleep. Management not helpful. Checked out early. The hotel has a great view and location, but wouldn't recommend staying there. Bathrooms are small and there are no comfortable chairs in the room.
